description:
One of the last real bars on the north side of town. Nothing fancy. Cheap drinks, TV's, bar food, and a lot of games like beer pong, pool, shuffle board, pop a shot.. etc. Good also as a warm up bar. A good place to meet and have 2 or 3 before hitting your main spot.
By default I come here a lot. I just don't want to spend $5 for a Budweiser/ Bud Light.  Some domestic beer prices for comparison:
Perry's $5.25 (12 oz bottle)
Bus Stop $5.50 (14 oz draft)
Horseshoe $5.00 (14 oz draft, $3 on Sunday)
Del Mar $6.00 (12 oz bottle... all beers are $6, so stupid)
Blue Light $4.50 for 16oz bottle or a draft (honorable mention)
Monaghan's $4 for 16 oz can (not bad if you pour it in a glass)
BAR NONE $4 for 16 oz draft or 24 oz can. 

Now I understand why some high end restaurants or wine bars charge $7. The rent is high, the remodel of the space was expensive, the ambiance is very nice.. i get it. BUT when you just want a few beers with the boys and don't care about food or the wine list, I'm not paying $6.

I won't get into all of the bars/restaurants that do not offer "normal" "domestic" beers but only fruity $7 IPA's and if you're lucky a Stella. If it's a restaurant I actually get sparkling water if there is nothing I want. Took me years to do it but I like it. SF is expensive but you can still save a few bucks if you try. Cheers.
author: Jim M.

description:
According to the US Citizenship and Immigration Services  *, I am barred from obtaining a US Passport as a Permanent Resident of the United States until I complete the Citizenship process which I am currently undergoing thanks to the help of SF Bar Association 's Free Citizenship Workshop last Feb. 3rd. Somehow this is still the second time I have been discriminated against in the Marina District of San Francisco for not presenting a US passport as a form of entry to a 21+ establishment. Despite my recently acquired status as "an adult" my valid U.S permanent residence card was rejected at @sfbarnone , for the first time, because of an obscure "ABC law", for which they provided no evidence to counter my Department of Homeland Security issued permanent resident card and the US Citizenship and Immigration's list of acceptable identification documents**. Currently, my green card is on record as my Department of Homeland Security  verified List A document at my place of employment. Still, my US Government  issued expiration extension on the back of my green card, which accounts for the 1-yr period it may take for the US Government to print a new permanent residence card, was not accepted by tonight's @sfbarnone crew; they demanded a US Passport. I've been here twice before in the past two weeks without a problem***, and tonight, I naively assumed that my valid, although apparently never before seen, form of identification could continually grant me access to a neighborhood & establishment that presumes a permanent residents may obtain a US passport as they incorrectly refer to the US Constitution as justification for their illegal discrimination. I was denied the right to speak to upper management. 

* https://www.us-immigration.com/us-immigration-news/us-passport/can-you-get-a-us-passport-with-a-green-card/  

**  please see page 3 of 3 at : https://www.uscis.gov/system/files_force/files/form/i-9-paper-version.pdf?download=1

*** and have geotagged time stamped pictures as evidence
author: Genesis B.

description:
If you are looking for a bar with a dirty basement feel, this is it. I came here on a Wednesday after a softball game. It wasn't too crowded, but seems like a go to spot for teams after they play intramurals. 

They have a bunch of bar games (shuffle board, darts, other arcade games, etc) and there is a back room with tables to play beer pong.

Pretty grungy spot but if you are looking for cheap beer and college drinking games then I guess this would be a good spot
author: Taylor F.

description: I love how they just have cups laying around for games! The bar itself isn't in the best condition (flooded hallway) but it's a fun time here! It's def more of a fun bar with friends than a date spot keep in mind!
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
Manage your expectations. This is a great place to come with your friends after work, enjoy cheap drinks, and have a great time. Its a crowded place with a busy bar. If this isn't your scene then you should go elsewhere. 

They have many games (foosball, pool, basketball, beer pong tables, etc.) and everyone is pretty good about giving other people turns. Went undefeated at beer pong that night. 

-B
author: Brandon G.

description: This is a cool little underground bar which has a ton of games and is very grungy. Note the bathroom is very grungy. Like college-age grunge. If reasonably priced drinks (for SFO) and a good place to watch a local game - or play one is your goal, you got this.
author: Steven D.

description:
One of my favorite bars in the city!

I love the arcade game theme!  My favorite kind of bars are ones where you can have a good time just hanging out and being a bit more low key.  You'll have a great time here playing ski ball, pool, basketball, air hockey and many more!

There's not really a dance floor or a dance-y vibe here, so if you're coming here expecting a night of dancing, Bar None might not be the place for you, but if you like to just chill, chat, laugh and have fun with cheap drinks, then this is definitely the place for you!

Something else to note is definitely the price of drinks here!  Not bat at all!!!  Even for somewhere that isn't San Francisco, $4 for a budweiser is still pretty good!  My friends and I enjoyed a few of them in celebration of my friend's graduation from college!  

Definitely a fun night and I'll continue to bring more friends here as time goes by.  Bar None is a great gem in the city for a fun night.  Also a great jumping off point if you're headed to other places throughout the night!
author: Kevin K.

description:
GREAT. BAR. 

Shoutout to Matt, the bartender. He's the owner of the place. Great dude. Good drinks. So much fun. Games were awesome. Feels like a Chicago bar away from home.
author: Roger S.

description:
Has the potential to be a cool spot. Is way too hot in there at night with a big crowd. 

I also lost my credit card there and called 10 times throughout the day, didn't get an answer once. The voicemail box is full as well so I couldn't even leave a message. Seems pretty poorly run.
author: Alyssa H.

description: Horrible bar that only played the same crappy song on repeat for the entire duration of our stay.
author: Mel L.

description: Had a super fun time Saturday night! Good beer and prices.  Nice people.  A friend bought a bunch of drinks and forgot her wallet on the counter after buying a round.  Called the next day and the bartender had her wallet with all cards and cash!  I'd highly recommend this place for the cold beer, atmosphere and good group of people!
author: R M.

description:
I'm a sucker for a bar with games to switch up the mood. Surprisingly there was no line when we came around 11PM on a Saturday night so it was super easy to get in + there's no fee. It's underground so after you get your ID checked by the bouncer you have to walk downstairs. 

Drinks/prices are normal for the area, but it's nice that they have BP, skee ball, and other arcade games. Great place to come with a group of friends because there's something for everyone.
author: Keizzel C.

description:
Out in San Francisco, I did not expect to walk into a bar like this. Everywhere I had been had seemed a little more upscale than what I was used to at home. I welcomed that glitz into my trip there. My best partying buddy from all of my college years invited me out to Bar None with him on my last night in San Francisco and I am pretty glad I didn't pass it up. 

The clientele and vibe here is young, fresh out of college, and packed. I hadn't had an experience like this since I was a fresh faced grad myself. The bar area is of ample size, but on a Saturday night, it was packed Wall to Wall. The place is a little dark with uplighting. The bartenders are fairly attentive despite the packed place.  

The main attraction here is the frat party style games the tables are set up for in the back. Beer Pong, flip cup, and my personal favorite, Boom Cup, are all available. I was the lone 30 something among a bunch of twenty one year olds slapping cups and yelling at newly made friends. I had a ball and wished I had a place like this in Louisville when I was younger. 

I would suggest this place if you like a young dive bar. If you're looking for a laid back experience, steer clear of Bar None.
author: Don B.

description: This bar is disgusting. Worst place you could go in the city. However if you love bad service and bad vibes this is great for you. You'll arrive to 2 people in the bar. The bouncer accepts bribes and is extremely unprofessional.
author: Jackie M.

description:
I had been to Bar None a couple of times before and had enjoyed myself, but after Saturday's experience I do not plan on ever going back. I prefer bars that treat their patrons as humans. 
A group of friends and I were in the back playing games at 1:40am and we had just bought a new pitcher of beer a few minutes earlier. Suddenly, out of the blue, a big burly bouncer came and informed us, along with the others in the back of the bar, that the bar was now closed and we had to immediately make our way to the front. There had been no last call, not even a warning as we purchased the pitcher. We made our way towards the front, thinking that perhaps the bouncer had meant that the back of the bar was closed and we could just hang out at the front of the bar for the last 15-20 minutes that the bar was to be open, according to their posted hours. Apparently not. A minute later, the bouncer came over again and told us that we had to leave at that very moment. I still had about a third of a glass of beer left, so I asked if I could have just a minute to finish my drink as I stood near the door. Instead, the bouncer pushed me, PHYSICALLY PUSHED me out the door.  This whole exchange, from when the bouncer told us we had to leave the back of the bar, to when I was pushed out, couldn't have been more than 3 minutes. That is a ridiculously short period of time to expect to clear out a bar, let alone for any group to finish a pitcher of beer. Being physically pushed by the bouncer was very upsetting, and I do not understand why Bar None allows their employees to treat patrons in such a degrading manner.
author: Elizabeth B.

description: Bar None is cool if you are 21, blacked out or if you really like to play beer pong. I've been incorrectly charged several times by bartenders and the place is never clean. It's essentially a frat house. There are many other bars on Union Street that you are better off checking out.
author: Lacey L.

description:
This place is so awesome most of the time. But they have the most irresponsible staff I've encountered. 

They have this policy on renting darts which requires giving your driver's license. THEY LOST MY ID WHEN I GAVE IT TO THEM!!!!

Enough said, don't tip the guy that's rude to you and go to Blue Light where they have more decency.
author: Lars S.

description:
The place to be if you wanna relive your college life. Very fratty and full of youngsters. Gross floors though. Very much like a college bar and mostly early twenties people here.

They also have games like beer pong and air hockey. Good music and a fun, rowdy environment. 

Don't come here if you want something classy or sophisticated. Nasty floors and bathrooms.
author: Alicia L.

description: Typical dive frat bar. Don't go here for the drinks but it's fun to hang and play beer pong. It's very sticky and a lot of spilled drinks but what do you expect. It's a fun time for sure
author: Jenna G.

description:
I am not sure why this bar has some sub par reviews, I came here for the first time this weekend and had a fantastic experience.  Located right off Union street, Bar None is set almost in an underground tunnel.  Walking in, we were immediately greeted by the door guy who checked our IDs and started a friendly chat with us. Bar None has a long bar with around 10 beers on tap (standard selection of Lagunitas IPA, Shock Top, Stella, etc) as well as full liquor to choose from.  All the way in the back you can find air hockey, skee ball, pool tables, and random arcade games.  My fiancé and I grabbed some beers and set up for a few games of air hockey. Just leave your ID with the bartender and in exchange you get the paddles. Also, there is a change machine located in the back for convenience.  When I first spotted my all-time favorite Skee Ball I jumped at the chance to play, however the bill machine was stuck. The awesome friendly bartender quickly jumped from behind the bar to come help me out.  Apparently some idiots in this place tend to stick quarters in the dollar bill slot causing it to get jammed... the bartender helped us out removing the coins and even giving us a dollar for a free play (thank you!) 
In all, this is a great gem of a dive bar located among the high end bougie bars of the Marina.  Come here for some low key good times, cheap beer and fun games. Cheers.
author: Kelsey B.

description:
Came here for a birthday a few months ago and I really enjoyed my time here which brought me back.  They have all sorts of different types of games which is a huge plus.  Beer pong, pool, arcades, pinball, super shot, darts, and an air hockey table.  There's also TV's along the bar for game days.  

We ventured out here because this place offered everything we were looking for to kill some time.  Booze, games, and TV's.  I bumped into a mutual friend from the past and after the hugs and how are yous, we talked about relationships and some things were brought up giving me relief and assurance that I made the right decision...and that I'm not crazy.

Great service
author: Linda N.

description:
My friend and I came here around 4:00 PM on a random Thursday afternoon. PERFECT time to stop in because the bar is completely empty. Especially on a sunny San Francisco day, the light shining through the glass ceiling gives this place life. We were greeted by Matthew, the friendly bartender. We ordered drinks and headed to the back where the games were located.

There are so many activities... beer pong, skeeball, arcade games, billiards, air hockey, foosball... reminded me of college. I can imagine that this place gets incredibly packed and rowdy during late nights. I don't think I would want to come here during peak hours, so I'm glad I found the sweet spot for when to come here.

We played two rounds of pool which was fun. I don't think playing pool is very practical when the bar is packed because someone could seriously get injured with all the games so closely placed together. There were already columns in the way of certain shots, so I would merely be an observer on busier nights on that.

Before we left, my friend and I had a lovely conversation with Matthew the bartender. He's genuine and sweet, and I'm glad that this bar has someone like him working here! We said we would come back to tell him about this mindfulness workshop we attended, so I guess we will be back!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
I love a place that has beers and games! 

Yes they have beer pong, and yes that tends to increase the grossness of the floors....
author: Greg F.

description: Britton the bartender should find another job. Apparently he doesn't know how to distinguish which IDs are real or fake. He rejected me and my friends completely real California state IDs because "they weren't raised". Weirdly didn't see him card anyone but the minorities in the bar. If you're white you shouldn't have any problems getting served here even if you are completely rude and screaming, but if you're a person of color try the bar across the street called Blue Light!
author: Meghana M.

description: Go here if you want ridiculous service. Bartenders have an attitude and if you ask why you received bad service security will come escort you out. So ridiculous and has not happened to me anywhere in the world! As someone who has managed/owned/ worked at many bars in my time all of my friends in Sf and myself will no longer spend our money here. It costs $0.00 to be a good person!
author: Shannon D.

description: Apparently bar none really means bar "some things" I chugged my beer. Threw it on the ground, as one does. And was asked to leave, aggressively. I was disgusted. As any American would be.
author: S J.

description: Absolutely awful staffs the bouncer destroyed my Washington State ID I asked him for an apology and he refused and told me "I didn't have to drink there" and that my Money is no Good I recommend the bar Bus Stop across the street.
author: Aubrey J.

description:
Ugh, never again please..

I only wound up here because of the group I was with, but this is definitely not my type of bar. It was basically a college frat house, from the beer pong tables to the gross floors. Nothing about it was appealing, but I guess if you're out of college but still want to play beer pong, Bar None's the perfect spot for that.
author: Jessie L.

description:
UMMMM SOOOOO I really like this bar LOL. It's definitely a throwback to those college days, which I mean, I'm not complaining. It's like a giant frat party. If you're not into that scene, then this place probably isn't for you. But it brings me back to my college days (maybe because I was in a fraternity..LOL). 

Tables in the back for drinking games. Guys, RAGE CAGE. rage cage is a lifestyle, not a game. If you've never played, look it up and learn because it's the best drinking game known to mankind. I think there were also pool tables. People were friendly and beers weren't crazy expensive. Cool place to chill and grab a beer. I was here on a night where there was some sort of event so it was pretty packed. Not sure if it's always like this, but I could definitely see it being very fun during holidays or events. Fun bar. Dirty. Loud. Dark. But fun.
author: Amy T.

description:
Beer pongs, bar and bar bites. Bar none reminds me of the ole college days, where it was carefree to just enjoy the college life. 

It brought me back, but I wasn't living it up like those days that you'll never get back.  There were Greek fraternities and sororities there.  

The feeling is different, but a cool spot to check out for the early twenties crowd.
author: Tiffany D.

description: If you're looking for a dive bar with good specials and laid back staff this is a great place to go.  I weirdly love dive bars and felt right at home when I walked in. The bartender was great for conversation and quick to refill our drinks. He told us that late night it turns into a party bar-we left before that happened, but I can definitely see that happening with the cheap drink specials and bar games (darts, pool, etc.).
author: Brittany C.

description: Came here with my wife and some friends visiting from out of town and Bar None was better than expected! It has a nice underground feel and college style beer pong tables set up with other arcade type games. If you're in the Marina district its def a cool cheap dive spot to check out!
author: Mitchell B.

description: This place is great to catch-up with people and to meet new people. The games are chill and the service is great. I would say the best part of this bar would be the beer pong tables. They do get crowded later in the night but if you come early you will be able to find a table. I have so many people there that are fun and challenging them to beer pong. I would totally recommend this place to any one who is looking to have a good time and loves beer and not afraid to meet new people.
author: Poonam M.

description:
LOL Bar None gets such bad reviews. 

Sure, some of the clients can be total meat-heads who essentially never left college. You will immediately recognize these people by their obnoxiously loud speech and blatant duchebagary. But am I really going to give a bad review because of the clients? 

This place does have a full bar. Maybe no craft beer or craft cocktails, but a full bar nonetheless. Moreover, though some clients may be douche bags, the bartenders have been nothing but kind. Service was quick. If they ever made a mistake or screwed up my order, they quickly apologized and bought that drink or my next one. 

It's also a great place to catch the game. If I'm in the area with friends and there's any type of sporting event on, bar none is always one of my options.

Took off a couple stars because there has been several occasions where there was no more soap in the men's restroom. I now bring my own little container of soap whenever I plan on coming here.
author: John B.

description:
I have gone to Bar None at least a dozen times this last year.  While, I understand this is a 'dive bar,' I do not understand why it is not dog-friendly.  I have taken my dog into the ritz, the Brixton (where he sat on a bar stool at the bar), and several others bars.  San Francisco is super dog-friendly, so I am unsure why this place is so strict on not allowing them, when it is quite literally one of the most college-like bars I have been to. AKA the women's bathroom is equivalent to a prison's bathroom, except maybe worse.  My last stipulation is that the bartender is extremely rude.  I worked in the service industry, I understand the hustle and I am always kind.  I continued to be kind to this bartender (tall, white dude with a chip on his shoulder,) while he snidely accepts my drink order and has the worst tone of someone working off of tips.

The Good:  Despite the inconvenience of not allowing dogs in a neighborhood that has a hell of a lot of dogs, a sorely sour bartender that unfortunately works every time I am there, and a bad bathroom situation... I have had many a great time there.  A 3-star rating is the highest I could give Bar None. I have fun, beer pong, skee ball and pool are super fun... the tv situation is great, the beer selection is typically good... but there is room for improvement.  I hope this will be well-received.  On a last note, the asian elderly man who runs around and works hard every time I am there deserves a 5-star rating, as well as the bouncers... they are always super kind to me and my friends.  I will be back, but I hope this place can allocate some money to keep the bar competitive with its neighbors.
author: Amy J.

description:
Your looking for the wildest party this side of San Francisco . 

This is the place you wanna be 

Never disappoints 

Love this place
author: Paul T.

description:
As Cat C. wrote 4 years ago still holds true - "Packed & full of D-bags that wish they were still in college to enjoy the frat parties."

I have only been here during the July 4th Pub Crawl, and both times I have regretted that I had to slum it here on my favorite American holiday. The place is full of people that still wish they were in college. The back beer pong table area is a disgusting sticky mess, the bathroom isn't much better for men or women.

There are some cheap, well drink specials, but I'm also not a broke college kid, so this isn't a selling point. If you're in your young 20s, I can see the appeal.

2 Stars because the staff is actually nice and attentive.
author: Michael C.

description:
This bar reminds me of a raging frat party. It definitely attracts a young crowd, mostly people who just graduated from college. They have beer pong, darts, and a hand full of arcade games towards the back of the bar. I like coming here because drinks are cheaper than most other bars in the Marina. Last time we paid only $3 for beers and well drinks. And on some holidays they have $5 shots. You can't beat those kinds of prices in the Marina. Which is probably why all the youngins come here.

On holidays, they are SUPER packed. I've been here for both St. Patty's day and NYE and it was CRAZY. In a good way though. Everyone's having a good time and there's a great party atmosphere here. 

It's definitely not the cleanest bar. The floors are sticky and bathrooms are kind of nasty, but no one cares that much when they're drunk. :) 

It's also right next to Extreme Pizza, so if you get the drunchies, you can just go next door for a slice of pizza.
author: Mai Y.

description:
Makes sense this place has sucky reviews...

Aka don't go here if you have any expectations whatsoever...
author: Sarah G.

description: Such a cool place. The bartender is really nice and attentive. Love the ambiance. Good food and drinks. They have a pool table and tons of games.
author: Princess Jasmine J.

description: Stumbled in here and never wanted to leave. Had to, of course, but came back for more. Downstairs bar, cool retro video games, fair prices, and a very cool staff. Don't skip this place!
author: Pete M.

description: Fun little hole in the wall in the marina. Good drinks, and some fun games. It's in the basement so it can get a little hot and steamy, but always a good time. If you are looking to dance, this is not the place for you. Much better for a game of pool or air hockey or to grab a beer and watch the game.
author: Ross S.

description: Went here on Friday and had a great time. Doorman was friendly and chatted with me a while. Bartender was a gentleman in baseball cap and was very polite and efficient. Games were fun and apparently I rock at flip cup. Never played before but met lots of people willing to join my group in a game and we all became friends. Wasn't too packed. Drinks were good. Good time had by all.
author: ODHRAN M.

description: Some of the worst customer service I have ever experienced. We paid for over $100 in drinks and they were still trying to kick us out at 1:30am just after last call. We tried to speak to management but they had no type of compassion for good customers. Really an awful business, that doesn't deserve to make it in Sf. Good times are supposed to be shared at bars like these but none were strictly because the bouncers and bartenders are good for nothing bums, who can't get a job doing something meaningful. Thugs.
author: Steven J.

description: I was really not as impressed with bar none as I would have hoped. First, the bar is SO cramped. Literally no breathing room at all whatsoever. I've never had as many drinks spilled on me in my life, and it took forever just to order a pitcher. However, the music was good and people definitely come here more for the games than the actual bar itself. It definitely wasn't a terrible time or anything, you'll probably enjoy yourself, but I'd recommend blue light over bar none any day
author: Sam R.

description:
Bar None was a pretty cool experience:

1. Vibe: Very crowded and very fratty - lots of Southern Tide and visors. 
2. Drinks: Nothing fancy - a selection similar to a college house party. Beer is super cheap (which is nice for the amount of BP that goes down).
3. Bar: Slow, and a bit understaffed. We waited 10+ minutes to get a pitcher of beer. 
4. Location: Fairly central, close to nice eateries, shops, and other bars. 
5. Amenities: Pool, air hockey, skee-ball machines, darts, and 4 or 5 BP tables (though the wait is pretty ridiculous).
6. Restrooms: Far from nice - it's a part of the experience though. 

Summary: College students will be right at home - not somewhere to bring the SO though.
author: Robert M.

description: Love this place. It does get pretty full and very hot but the games (air hockey, foosball, basketball, darts) make it worth it. The bartender I had today made it an effort to remember my name which is great customer service. Would recommend this place to watch any SF games! Four stars only because it's hot ALL THE TIME.
author: Megan M.

description:
These reviews are hilariously spot on! If you like beer pong, skeeball and arcade games then you would rate this place a 5. If you think you are above all that, and over your college days then your lame and will hate this place. 

Personally, I'm all for a throwback to college days. So I dig it. Come with your friends and brush up on your beer pong skills, or dominate flip cup. If you don't like either of those games, then just don't come. 

K bye.
author: Jennifer A.

description: Best bar I've been in to SF. Good drinks, quick service, not insanely expensive, and games/entertainment. Also, big supporters of our service men an women. Home away from home.  Thanks, Matthew!
author: Andy A.

description: If you are okay with staff members of a Caucasian background treating staff of Asian descent with complete disrespect in front of customers totally spend your money here. I could not believe the way this bartender was treating his coworker. He made fun of his pronunciation of English words such as machine and mocked him as he picked ping pong balls up from the floor including saying "You need to earn your tips some how." It was unacceptable and when I expressed my concern and I was asked to leave the bar. And the tip I tried to leave for the disrespected coworker was not given to him and put in the cash register. So by all means tip the racist behind the bar with the fire tattoo on his forearm. He is an upstanding guy for sure.
author: Megan C.

description: Bar None is the worst. If I could give them a zero, I would. They didn't honor the bar crawl's wrist band's that started at their bar for the crawl (the check in was inside Bar None). The security guard was disrespectful and yelled saying "you didn't pay me"; he was referring to cover fee which was covered in the Bar Crawl's fee. Will not be returning anytime soon.
author: Lena R.

description:
Despite what this place turns into when the sun goes down, I found it nice when it's not Bro-verdosed as it is at night. As much as I am hesitant of going to the Marina for its obvious pretentious crowd, it was refreshing revisiting this place after a few years when it was practically empty. Just a few chill folks grabbing drinks after work, and best of all was Matthew, the bartender. He's definitely not a person you would expect bartending in the Marina/Cow Hollow area (just very polite, respectful, laid back, and friendly).

I definitely don't mind if I'm suggested to hit this place up right after work.
author: William Y.

description:
Sticky ass floors... That's the first thing that comes to mind when I think about Bar None. The location of this bar is pretty cool since it looks like it's suppose to be the entrance of some home, but it's a bar!

The bathroom has really poor logistics... And super cramped and dirty :( As you walk further into the bar, they have a foosbal table, beer pong (pretty cool - but I honestly wouldn't want to play with the cups they recycle and the ball that rolls around the sticky-ass floor...), basketball, air hockey (you'll need to trade in your ID for the puck and the thing to hit it with - if you don't return it, you'll be charged!) and other arcade games - pretty neat. When you check in, you'll also get $3 wells! But I think that's already their standard pricing, hahaha.

This place basically reminds me of a college party... Like in Santa Cruz cause there's a bunch of smokers and Caucasian people. Definitely nothing wrong with that, but ohh the memories! The place gets quite rowdy... But then again, I did go on the Saturday before Saint Patty's/ Pi Day so it was a pretty cray day. Bars that a little too hectic like this aren't really in my liking... Shoutout to the bartenders for always being on top of the orders and being friendly though!
author: Nicole C.

description:
BEER PONG!!!!!!!!!!!! This is pretty much the only reason my friends and I decided to come here. I had no idea there were bars that actually do this. I also saw they have darts and pool tables. It was super legit. It was super crowded, even outside the bar was crowded. Legit bouncers checking IDs outside.

The only thing about beer pong is all the spilt beer in the back. It reeked. It was sticky. Super loud. Ping pong balls bouncing everywhere. Cups falling off the tables. And people just keep playing and playing so it was definitely a mess back there.

But HEY! It's better than making a mess at your own house to clean up. And here, you get to watch and meet all the funny drunk people at the bar!
author: Athena C.

description:
Came here the other night with a bunch of my friends. Definitely had a college bar vibe to it.. We ordered a vodka clubs which were $6 each, but we used the Yelp promotional coupon which took $3 off, but either way, drinks were pretty cheap. There are pong tables in the bar, which is pretty cool. Played a few games and hung out. 

The venue is pretty big, plenty of room. Not sure how the bar is on weekends, but it wasn't too filled when we went. However, the place was filthy, looked like a typical dirty college bar. The bartenders were pretty quick with the orders, but had a bit of uncaring and nasty attitude. Would say the bar itself is cool, from what others have said regarding when its a weekend, I can't input, but from my personal experience, would say give this place a try, It was a good time for the part.

Have to complain about the fact the bar closes at 2am, but I came to the bartenders to get a drink around 1:20am and the bartender refused to serve me and told me that they were closed.. We wanted to get a pitcher of beer for another game of pong and some mixed drinks and they would all refuse.. Then mid game around 1:35am the bartenders came down and told everyone they had to leave because the bar was closing... really? Who does that? There is still plenty of time.. We had time to go another bar and get a drink before they closed up and asked people to leave..
author: Steven P.

description: It should be a nice spot, but recently the bouncers in particular are real pieces of shit. It's clear that they are on some sort of power trip, and it's impossible to reason with them. The bartenders were fine, but one of them was clearly drunk. You'd expect that if the service was sub par that at least the drinks would be cheap, but not really. Definitely seems like it's going for the college bar vibe, but it's kinda like that one bar that no one ever wants to go to. Probably why it was dead on a Saturday night..
author: H W.

description: This bar was absolute garbage. We took a chance on this place on the 4th of July because we were given chips for a free beer from promoters we met at Fishermans Wharf. When we went there and tried to redeem them the bartender immediately responded to us by saying " that's not me bro".  He then cut us off by saying "what do you want to drink". I got a Guiness and my boyfriend got a wheat beer. Both were sour tasting and disgustingly warm. This bar is absolutely horrendous! The service, disgusting beer and dingy, frat-tastic environment ensured we will NEVER be visiting Bar None again or be recommending it to anyone.
author: Lauren B.

description:
Looking to relive those college fraternity nights? Come here. Bar None has some of the cheapest drinks you'll find in the area and there's beer pong galore, skee-ball, a basketball arcade game, foosball, and darts. Marina guys generally act like they're still in college and this bar gives them free rein. Beer soaked floors, disgusting bathrooms, and young girls: it's a college frat house to a tee. 

I would say it's a good place to bring a large group of people and start your own epic game of flip cup. If you go into the bar knowing this, you can still have a good time.
author: Shira W.

description:
This place was great! Went for my friends birthday a few nights ago. Saturday night, it seemed well organized, 2 at the door one floating bouncer inside and 3 bar tenders.
Probably not the right place to go looking for problems! 
Pm bartending staff were quick on the drinks and provided top notch service. Getting the 4 girls I was with extremely intoxicated without the waiting between lemon drops they are used to hahah.

Kind of a deuce bag college bro scene. But hey hey 3 beer pong tables so what would you expect?

All in all I would say they are attracting the crowd they want. Not your neighborhood pub but always a good time.
author: Nathan B.

description: This bar is my new guilty pleasure. I came here after an IM soccer game with my team and this is pretty much everything you'd expect at a college bar - pitchers and games. Pitchers are $12 for Coors, and some will run you a few dollars more, like Lagunitas. They have beer pong tables in the back, and a massive supply of cups to play any drinking game that you could possibly think of. Definitely come here with friends. Make a mess here instead of trashing your own living room :P
author: Austin W.

description:
i'm going to go a little against the grain on this one with the review. I can't even imagine why this place has such low reviews. 

Let me explain:
This place is pretty gross, but EXACTLY like your typical frat house.  We already knew this coming in, right? If not, you should have.

Smack dab in the middle of Union St., this place is drowning in beer (literally) and filled with arcade games, think skee ball, foosball, pool, and even one of those boxing things, and of course, BEER PONG! That's what all the college kids come here for, right?

The scene: ridiculously sticky floors (my shoe literally was stuck to the ground so much it came off throughout the night), spilled beer everywhere, frat boys responsible for spilling the beer everywhere, girls way too dressed up for such a gross bar and potentially also contributing to the beer floors, and all the general rowdiness and tomfoolery you would expect. 

Probably nothing about this place is actually a positive, but it does what it sets out to do well, (create a frat scene) and for that, it gets 4 stars.  

Quick notes:
-clean beer pong cups in the back of the beer pong pit. Please get new ones. Reusing other people's beer pong cups is gross. 
-bathrooms are disgusting, but also in the beer pong pit
-last call is ~20 minutes before 2am and they start kicking out people aggressively. If you need to go to the bathroom, this is your last chance. Neither Bar None nor Bus Stop down the street will let you go back in after you are out.
-No food around here after 2, but there is a hot dog man outside usually. $4 a hot dog.
-surge pricing for uber, lyft, etc. in this area @2am for sure. Be prepared.
author: Patricia K.

description:
ah. The gateway to hell.... your official blvd of broken dreams.. This place really gives Union Street its best name.
Frat row.. step right up. Place your best bets who will puke first...
If you are looking for a Herpes free evening.. this isn't your place
author: Ashley Z.

description:
Britton is literally a the worst. 

We asked for 2 waters & refused to serve us and instead decided to kick us out for trying to stay hydrated.
author: Scott L.

description: I don't normally write reviews but when I do, it's because the bar tender shouted at my DEAF friend then kicked him out because "He wasn't listening." When I tried to explain that he was DEAF, I was appalled when the piece of s*** bartender replied with, "Are you sure he just isn't too drunk to hear?"  So I guess this place is ok, as long as you aren't genuinely DEAF. One star.
author: Brian A.

description:
Last night I got kicked out by force by 2 of the bouncers when I was trying to peacefully talk to them. My friend got his beer stollen and thrown away, it was 1 p.m.

Beer pong is fun, place needs to seriously rethink who they hire.
author: Tito A.

description:
You will love this place if you meet Any of the following criteria:

-You're a "Bro" aka "Douchebag"
-Love beer pong
-You're a girl with low self esteem and no taste, looking to meet a beer ponging douche; who will no doubt wow you with stories about his mighty Axe(body spray)
-You just can't enough of the song "Freebird"
-You like to wear the same style of clothes as all the other sheep because it's "popular"
author: Melody C.

description:
Calling this place a bar is just too much. They don't even deserve that name. This place is a HOLE IN A WALL. 

Look, I have been to some nasty, cheap places in my life... but wow, this place has top them all when it comes to nastiness (all around).

Let's not talk so much about the extremely disgusting floors, glasses, or even the horribly nasty-nasty-nasty bathrooms (used toilet paper thrown over the stalls, vomit all over the floor, and wet, slippery floors). 

Let's actually focus more on the customers and WORST staff I ever had to deal with.

CUSTOMERS: truly, most of them were simply a bunch of non-interesting, empty-heads, who just go there to get extremely wasted. They will yell, curse, push you around and look for trouble. Just to mention one of the few things that happened: One customer hear my friend say a word in Spanish and turned around looked at us and said to his friend "Oh no, I better get out of here. There are a bunch of Hispanics". What is that? I was the only one of Spanish origin at the table, but we all felt very insulted.

STAFF: the bartenders are... ok (not dicks or nice) UNTIL 1:30am comes around. My friend purchased a pitcher of beer at around 1:20am. Not even 10mins had passed and the already-by-then drunk staff came over to our table yelling at the top of their lungs "GET MOVING PEOPLE, WE ARE CLOSING, GET THE FUCK OUT OF HERE!". One of the people I was with asked if we could finish the beer we had just purchased and the staff responded "I GIVE YOU 1MIN THEN I WANT YOU OUT OF HERE UNLESS YOU WANT ME TO TAKE YOU OUT MYSELF".

Our group, comprised of three girls and two guys, started walking to the door, completely in shock of what was happening. I decided to approach a bartender to ask him if this was normal and if that staff member was OK, he said "YES, AND PLEASE GET OUT OF HERE BEFORE HE PUSHES YOU OUT". So yeah... he was nice enough to give us a warning about two of their crazy staff members who were already grabbing people by the arm and pushing them towards the door.

This was truly the worst experience I have ever had. It was even scary at some point. Once outside (1:37am) the staff turned off the lights, got out and locked the doors. Zero cleaning people. One of the drunk, tall, bulky member of the staff who had been pushing people out just walked to his car, put up the music to the loudest and made a U-turn while speeding, coming close to hitting one of the customers who had just left the bar... maybe another scare tactic... I don't know... but he was a TOTAL ASS.

Maybe this was just a one night thing... but I came out of there truly hating this place and I would NEVER, EVER recommend it to anyone in the world.
author: Tabata A.

description: While the foods cheap, the service is terrible. Avoid the heavyset bartender in the hat. He's rude and will ignore you if it's not convenient for him. I wish I could write better reviews, but will be going to lightning for Happy Hour now...
author: Ethan M.

description:
We come here almost every Tuesday evenig with a bunch of international students. The place is okay and the "uniqueness" clearly lies in the beer pong tables. But that's it. 
The problem with bar none is the personnel. From the bouncer to the barkeeper to the guy  who walks around to "supervise" the guests: Everyone is unfriendly to an extent that is hard to bear. It is even harder to understand this "anti-service" as the place is always empty and we are their main customers. Every time we get literally kicked-out when they close we swear to not come back. The only unfortunate reason that we come back is our group dynamics that makes it hard to organize another place for everybody and the beer pong. 

Summarizing: This place either needs to re-think immediatey their "service" or they hopefully close their doors forever.
author: Bastian L.

description:
Favorite bar in the marina!

Super low-key. Fun crowd. Cheap, but not vomit-inducing, drinks. Nice bartenders who don't care if you ask for water. You can actually have a conversation with the people you came with as its not overly crowded, overly dark, or overly loud. 

Only complaint, the beer-pong area is mad gross. The floors are full of unidentified liquids on any and all nights and if you're in the mood for beer pong, you're best shot is cozying up to the 6-8 people who have claimed it as their territory and never, ever leave. 

PS Check in when you get here, you get $3 well drinks!
author: Molly S.

description:
Marina...Oh Marina..I thought of you better than this!
This place is cute for the inner "D-Bags" and swarm of College frat boys who never quite grew up. I do like the beers on tap, and the underground feeling and the slightly non-rapist dimmed lighting. 

I love the only one thing, and one thing only which could be 
the demise or downfall of the place....

"Beer pong"

Now for those of you who like beer pong feel free!
For those of you who want to fist pump and find your "bass brother" feel free!
For those who slip and slide, slippery ground, douche' popped collared, shirts...
and vomit in urinals and urine smell and sweat then feel free!

The $3 off well drinks is a plus when you check in......
but seriously why would you want to inform people you've been here.

I guess it's not my scene. But something about this place screams
"Unsanitary" at times, just saying...Just saying.
author: Michael R.

description:
Douche bag central!

My friend wanted to come here to dance, so we walked here from her apartment. I was immediately grabbed by several "teenagers", at least that's how young they looked. The dance floor was packed with trashy girls and douchey boys groping each other, and slobbering on each other's faces. 

Bathrooms are absolutely filthy, and I had to supress my gag reflex, hold my breath, pinch my nose and go as quickly as possible before running out of there to save my life.
author: Dani S.

description: A backwoods Alabama shithouse has more class than this dump bucket of human sewage. Avoid at all costs.
author: Brad J.

description:
Congrats to Bar None for getting my first 1 star review!

I'm a professional photographer; so I have my 5d mark 3 + L lens and 580exii on me... while doing a pub crawl... haha okay maybe not so professional? Well I wasn't shooting professionally that night. I was told at the entrance, that I would not be allowed to take pictures inside. Okay fine, whatever. He stops me after handing back my ID repeating himself, really you are not allowed to take pictures inside. Okay dude, I get it. I won't. Inside I see a bunch of people taking pictures with their smart phones. Nobody, bartenders or anybody, is asking anybody to stop. eh, whatever.

This place is dirty filled with dbags and frat bros. Ordered a gin and tonic. super super super watered down. Can't taste ANY gin at all, and the tonic was maybe just water? Got a lemon instead of a lime. Finished the terrible drink in under a second and just walked around. 

Down to the back, there is a pool table, 2 dart boards and a few beer pong tables. The area by the beer pong tables smells heavily like piss, but it's probably because the bathroom is nearby. Still, it shouldn't smell that bad. Everywhere you go, the ground is super dirty and full of trash and spilled drinks. Did a full round to check it out and left.

I won't be coming back. I recommend you don't come here. 

To recap:
- terrible drinks
- extremely dirty
- rude crowd
- never coming here again.
author: Kaje Y.

description:
Brought me right back to my days in college in the frat...  Tons of beer, dirty floors, mess on the ground, tons of bros, etc.  But with nostalgia aside, this place has pool tables, darts, and beer pong in the very back.  Came here on St. Patrick's Day on a Sunday night and there was still a decent crowd.

I would give it a 2 or 3 star, but the experience with the bartender here was terrible.  My friend bought two pitchers and paid with a credit card.  The bartender, who obviously was drunk, was slurring his words while working.  When the bill came, he handed my friend back the wrong card.  It turns out that the bartender switched the charges on two cards AND lost my friends card.  After asking another bartender to help us out, we located my friend's credit card in the cash register.  After the whole situation was settled, the bartender kept trying to say how the credit card was right in front of my friend the whole time.  The whole experience was a giant buzz kill.
author: Richard L.

description: I'm just writing this review because I've read so many of the other ones that I am convinced this place needs a complete turnover or be shut down. San Francisco deserves better than this.
author: Joash Y.

description:
Not the best bar in SF, but definitely fun. Since there isn't a huge crowd here, I'd say it's on the emptier side, its a great place to gather your friends.

Buy a pitcher, drink some beers, play beer pong and other drinking games. The area for beer pong is DIRTY. Wash those ping pong balls carefully guys...

Beer is cheap. Bathroom stalls are rather dirty and don't lock all the way.

Check in, get a yelp deal, buy a well drink.
author: Amy H.

description: Fun fun fun! Came her randomly one night and will go back. This is like a local version of dave and busters and more for a kick back group. They had tables to play beer bong, a billiards table, basketball hoops, etc. I loved the nightly drink special and overall the drinks were decently prices and I will be spending lots of money here in the future.
author: Devika B.

description:
I blacklisted a bunch of bars after I turned 24.  Bar None was at the top of the list.  KTs, ESW, Matrix Fillmore... all on it.  This reminds me that I should probably update those reviews.

And even though I blacklisted a ton of bars, I somehow STILL end up at Bar None.  I'm going to justify this disparity between my goals and my actions due to the fact that Bar None has a shit ton of beer pong tables, darts, a pool table and foosball... games that are all very enticing when I'm drunk.

But if I'm the least bit sober and can still count to 10, no fucking way.

I'm also fairly certain that the place is full of SDSU students.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Early last call. Closes 45 minutes before they close. I'm astounded that bars will turn people away before last call. 

The bouncer was complaining that he was required to work the next day at 3pm at 1:40 am. Somehow he thought that was going to be an early day and that everyone else should leave the establishment before it shut down. Considering that he is likely to be paid by the hour he is likely to be lying on his time cards. 

Complete shit-show of a frat bar and I regret trying to come into the establishment, even after a terrible experience the previous time that I visited. The bar has incredible potential to be fun so I hope that an owner with sufficient experience can make this happen
author: Curtis C.

description: Imagine walking into a dimly lit almost dark, mildly humid room with sticky floors and packed with people mostly guys who are undoubtedly no more than two years out of a college frat house (they might still be in one....) and you've got 90% of the idea of Bar None.  The bartenders can be friendly, most times they aren't but I can only imagine they've got reasons and plenty of stories.  Drinks are priced fairly.  It's really just a crowd thing.  If you're into the early 20's, mostly male fresh out of college vibe, beer pong balls on sticky probably rarely cleaned floors and back into your beer several times, scream talking over loud music kinda thing this might be the place for you.
author: Britt T V.

description: Shitty drlnks, shitty service.  Hope the bouncers know a threat when they see one (i.e. 4'11" asian girl with a cup of water in her hand is not one of them)
author: Roxanne M.

description: If you are looking for hot chicks, good conversation, and an overall relaxing night...then PLEASE go some place else. This is "Meathead Central", where it seems like all the bully's from all the 1980s movies hang out. Everyone is a "Bro" here, and last night we saw a few guys literally flexing their muscles to each other for about 10 minutes outside by the stairway... I went here late last night with my girlfriend, and two big guys accidently bumped into her while she was holding her drinks. Her dress was ruined, and one of the guys didnt even say sorry, just walked out. To be fair, the bartender did offer us free drinks (but at that point we really just wanted to go). It was a pretty bad experience. Very gross inside, a little smelly, and people just didnt seem all that friendly. I actually love dive bars, but this place does seem out of place for the Cow Hollow.
author: Matt L.

description:
This reminded me of my undergrad days hahaha. 

Bar None caters to the younger crowd. 
It's a bit grungy. 
There's beer pong tables in the back where you can play. 
Crowded. 
Stuffy. 
And definitely a "bro" place. 

But for $42, we got a PITCHER of Long Islands. Yes, it is ridiculous. But worth the price compared to buying drinks individually. AND THEY WERE STRONG.
author: Noelle H.

description: Trashy place for trashy clientele. What a dump. Obnoxious crowd of 30 year old wanna be college students. Bad service. Bad beer. Bad bouncers. If you want a loud place where the collective IQ is likely about 90, this is the place to go. Otherwise, there are much better bars than this. Not recommended at all.
author: Armanius M.

description: I spent the summer in San Francisco and looked for a place to get some strong drinks and good food! The wings were amazing! So much so that we went twice because they were so delicious. There is a jukebox in the corner that allowed us to control the music, and they have a space in the back that allows folks to play beer pong. Yes, it's a little frat, college laced, dive bar, but from the looks of the group everyone in there seemed to have professional jobs, but an air for college nostalgia. Overall, it's not fancy but it definitely does the trick if you're trying to just hang out with a group of friends and re-live college for a nice.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Are the only customers of this dive all young idiots who think a night of fun means standing on the street in front of the joint yelling like drunken monkeys? 

How does this place stay in business with such piss poor management and flouting the civic laws?

Hey #SanFranciscoPolice don't you ever check on this place?
author: Joe S.

description: For my first time experiencing SF nightlife, I stepped into the bar. The bartender was awesome. It is a college type bar with the beer pong, basketball, and other arcade like games. I went alone, and met a couple cool people. I came back the next weekend alone, and met more people to hang out with. It gets very crowded around 10pm. Good thing is, it's a great place to meet different types of characters.
author: Captain N.

description: Went to Bar None for my first time last night. There are soooo many games :-o ! Loveee that. Drinks were cheap (especially with the $3 well drink check in deal). Also a random MLB player sighting. Sicky! I had a blast and I hope to return to Bar None ASAP.
author: Ruthie G.

description:
Yes this is just a divey bar that reminds me of all the places I used to black out at in college.  It's dirty and smells bad and is not equipped with mixologists or other SF staples.

I come here for the beer pong.

Maybe I'm biased because I have the best pong partner in the bay, but I love coming here to play.  We always show up, get a pitcher, make our way to the tables and find some random people to play with.  Sometimes we make friends, sometimes we wish we hadn't.  At one point we had a 12 game winning streak, working on getting that back right now.  Just last night we smoked some german exchange students.  #AMERICA

People do love to hate on this "fratty" bar, but let's be honest, who doesn't wanna pretend they're back in college?!
author: Lindsey G.

description: The draft heineken tasted funny. Bartender was nice and replaced it with bottle. Cool bar will come again.
author: Jim R.

description: If you are missing your college life, this is the place for you! It is kind of fun to throw yourself back into the days of flip cup and beer pong for a night, but this is not a place I would frequent - I am too old for that:( Nonetheless, with the right group of people it's great!
author: Prianka K.

description: I frequent Bar None with my SF friends and its a really fun spot, easy to get drinks, never overcrowded, and a great atmosphere. Beer Pong going on all night, and cheap pitchers!
author: Roya S.

description: Not a bad place to hang out with friends and family. The place is clean and has a Table to play beer pong. There are also other games you can play.
author: Alex C.

description: A little bit of a frat boy bar but it's fun nonetheless. They had great nightly specials and I saw games in the back (beer pong, ski ball, pool, darts, etc).
author: Kristine N.

description: Bar None is like Christmas in the basement of a dirty frat house. Yes, it is covered in a thin coating of beer residue, but it is a fun place to play beer pong, make new friends and dance. If you're socially awkward, there are even arcade games in the back. Great place!
author: Lexie K.

description:
If you don't mind sticky floors and sub-par restrooms but are looking for a college frat party atmosphere, Bar None is your place. 

I visited Saturday night for my friend's 21st birthday. The place was pretty crowded - as expected on a Saturday - but I was still able to get a drink the minute I walked up to the bar. They had plenty of bartenders behind the bar so there was never a long line. I checked in on yelp and unlocked the "$3 well drinks" deal and got 2 vodka cranberries. The bartender gave me a token for a free drink that I used later in the night, so including tip I spent $10 on 3 drinks. That's a steal for a bar in the marina. 

Towards the back of the bar there are a few tables for beer pong, a pool table, a basketball arcade game (only $.50!), and skee-ball! 

We were looking for a loud and rowdy bar with a college atmosphere and didn't care much about the cleanliness of the place. We got exactly what we were looking for. Our group had a blast! The boys had a lot of fun playing skee-ball and pool. 

Another plus: I've only been here twice but both times parking has been easy. Side streets usually have plenty of space.
author: Melissa C.

description:
This one-star review comes with a caveat: I am over 35, I am married, graduated college long ago, and haven't played beer pong in probably 15 years.

This is a place to go if you are barely of drinking age, play beer pong, and...uh...well, this is the place for those things.

If you are over 25, like decent beer, or aren't trolling for half-drunk college chicks, then keep on walkin', stranger, nothing to see here.
author: Ben G.

description: Great drinks. Great atmosphere. The manager makes you feel comfortable and the bartender makes drink like you'll never believe :)  so much fun. If I lived here I would definitely be a regular.
author: Valerie H.

description:
A REAL review :
And it's a NEGATIVE review!!!! This bar lost my credit card and when I gave them my ID to find it they said word for word " FUCK you this is my bar. I work here and I don't give a FUCK about you. I CAN tell the bouncers you're drunk and it doesn't matter. They will kick you out regardless" That entire quote is word for word. I know a lot of people including myself would assume I was drunk and misbehaving but I literally had 3 beers in 5 hours. I took my dog out for a walk between between beers 2 and 3 which I took a cab home and back afterward (is documented). When I asked the bartender for my credit card she completely ignored me while everyone around me made comments about how she was too drunk to remember. Did I mention that the bartender's friend, the person she was next to  that said "FUCK YOU" (more to come) by the way him and his friend took a shot of tequila with us!!!!!! And she was noticeably shitfaced afterward. If you want credit card theft and to be charged for things you didn't buy AND to be told (continued) "FUCK YOU I RUN THIS PLACE" come here! This company will STEAL your money and blame you for it. Hands down the worst "establishment" I've ever run into. I went across the street to get a sandwich and I heard "we get that all the time. (Referring to the bar across the street)" Their positive reviews in my guess are only from friends, family and themselves hitting the "like" button  . This company couldn't have been more disrespectful and disingenuous. "Fuck you I work here and I can tell whoever I want to fuck off",.. Spend your money on. business that care about YOU as the customer. Not business' that spend money to keep you quiet.
author: Connor C.

description:
Came here a few weeks ago with some friends. 

College Frat type-of-bar located in the Marina district. Friendly bartenders and drinks are decently priced. 

More of a younger crowd (20's and early 30's).

Music was awesome! They played a mix! But I loved how they played some hip hop and old school jams!

Love the games located in the back! There are foosball, basketball, some kind of fighting game, a punching thingy, and skeeballs. There are also beer pong games in another room. It wasn't super crowded the night I went so it's awesome!

The only bad thing is that one of my girlfriends started throwing up in the garbage can and our whole group got kicked out. I had to babysit her the whole night. Other than that, I would definitely come back. Hahahah
author: Tammy F.

description:
My friends and me actually come here very often to play beer pong and other games. 
They provide beer pong tables, cups and ping pong balls. The price for the beer is okay as well.
The place has a lot of potential unfortunately there are too many drawbacks.

First. The last call is way to early. It seems like the staff wants to leave as soon as possible so they just close 45-60min earlier. 
Second. The place is dirty. The floor is sticky and the bathrooms are just nasty. It seems like they barely do a proper cleaning. 
Lastly and the worst part, the staff. Simply awful service. They treat their customers without respect.

Overall, I am surprised that a place like this can even survive. I do not recommend to come here. "Bar None Service". I wish I could give zero starts.
author: Adrian F.

description:
darts: require an exchange of a valid identification, which will be returned upon returning all 3 darts. there is a $10 charge or loss of i. d.  if all 3 darts are not reutned. 

cornhole bags: are given with an exchange of credit card. $10 charge for each bag not returned. no charges apply unless all 4 bags are returned.
author: Toby W.

description: As people that were visiting San Francisco and wanted to see the nightlife there,  we met a local that told us it's one of the best dive bar for young people around. We went and had a blast! Good atmosphere,  the bouncer was hilarious,  everyone was super social and the best... You can play beer pong in the bar!
author: Émilien B.

description:
Oh yelpers, how misguided your analyses of Bar None. No one should be coming here for craft cocktails, plush lounging or a clean and modern environment. You are here to drink like you used to in college and fancy yourself a seasoned beer pong player. 

I will honestly concede that this is my most frequented bar in the city (sad, but true). I usually have my classy drinks at the restaurants where I'm having dinner so when the goal is finding a bar to drink and hang out, why not return to the college days and play some good old beer games? 

As a rule, I tend not to use bar none bathrooms until I reach a point where I won't remember using them. At that point, what you don't know won't hurt you!
author: Raina B.

description: The bar itself is ok. I like that they have darts, beer pong and I think pool. It gets a little crowded and frankly I don't particularly enjoy the crowd most of the time, but its ok. Helps that it is right next door to Extreme Pizza (great for after boozing snack!). Drinks in SF are all overpriced, in my opinion, but this place isn't too bad especially for the Marina. Not much else to say about it I guess.
author: Anna T.

description: The atmosphere was cool. There are a lot of fun games to play while drinking. Some of the staff is nice, some aren't. Both bartenders I came in contact with seemed as if they hated their job. My drinks were okay. I know I can make better ones at home. I'd come back, but only if it was the only bar open.
author: Celeste T.

description: Not for BOOSHIE folks. If you wanna let loose and party your ass off this is the spot to be.
author: Sione K.

description:
I was having a good time dominating in beer pong here until I ran into some stuck up blond bitch of a bartender. Uncoordinated or drunk, I don't care, just don't fail to pour my beer 13 times in a row to the point where even when you do get all of the foam off the top, it still tastes as flat as Kiera Knightley's chest. 

After taking a few sips of that atrocity, I decided to go back to the bar and POLITELY ask for a newly poured beer or get my 5 bucks back so I could go over to Blue Light and have a bartender who actually knows what he/she is doing to get me a beer. The bartender who can't even pour a beer right surprisingly thought her shit didn't stink and starts to go berserk giving me lip and waving a bouncer over toward the scene. 

Bouncer comes, who is actually more sincere than wanna-be Barbie and requests that I leave. I was disgusted, felt like the white Rosa Parks in that bitch. For simply expressing how I felt about a horrifically poured beer and requesting a new 1, I get kicked out?? That's some BULL SHIT!!!!  BUTTTT the only reason I gave this shit hole 2 stars is because when the Bartender escorted me outside, he asked me how much I payed for my drink, I said 7 bucks for shits nd giggles, when I really payed 5 and he gave me my refund!

With my 7 bucks I went across the street to Blue Light and told the bartender there about my story.... The dude was amused as hell and hooked me up with a free red bull vodka!!!! 

Free red bull vodka + perfectly poured beer + better bar in general = Shittin' on Bar Done
author: Patrick O.

description: The layout of this place is cool but the workers are AWFUL and act like children. One of the workers was playing an arcade game when a friend of mine walked a little too close to him and immediately apologized (mind you, in a crowded bar on a Friday night), and the worker turned and GRABBED my friend, poured his beer on him, and drug him out of the bar. Worked by douchebags, screw those guys. Never going back ever again. My group of 14 people will happily take our business to another bar. Bye bar none! See you never!
author: Hannah H.

description:
The definition of Marina is Bar None.  Packed & full of D-bags that wish they were still in college to enjoy the frat parties.  I know, it's Marina where at least 90% of the people roaming the streets are white, but, please remember you're in SF, one of the most diverse cities, so don't be surprised when you see an Asian & feel it's necessary to talk smack about them (call me paranoid, but it was pretty obvious)!  

I haven't really explored the night life of the Marina besides Circa, but I definitely prefer Circa over this place.
author: Cat C.

description:
I am so disappointed in their juke box! Just truly disappointed. I put in $5 without looking at what songs they had to offer, silly me. I was struggling to find current songs. I'm a hip hop and R&B kinda gal and the selection was terrible. Music really sets the mood in a place, you know? But good thing I was with a great group of friends so I ended up forgetting about the bad music in the background. 

We came after class at around 4pm on a Thursday afternoon to celebrate my friend's birthday. Needless to say, it was empty because it was so early. We all had fun playing some beerpong, pool, and hot shot (the arcade game where you shoot basketballs). 

$14 pitchers of Bud Light. 
$18 pitchers of cider (for my gluten free friend)

I also bummed some delicious tatertots from my friend. It was hot and fresh... It was really the perfect thing to munch on at the time. 

I probably won't be back to be honest. It was an okay bar but nothing special to me besides the arcade games and the beer pong. I honestly wouldn't want to play beer pong there at night when it supposedly gets packed.
author: Connie Y.

description: Do I have to give them a star! Worst bar in town!!!! Tried calling and they acting as if it was bad service and hung up on me after they didn't know the answer to my question.
author: Melissa S.

description:
11.21.12 etc.

When this place isn't packed with dbags, it's actually not half bad.  You can watch a game, play some foosball, and of course, beer pong your way into someone's heart.

And, if you're (un)lucky like me and ended up there with a bunch of boys, the bartender may take pity on you and hand you a beer (not Bud Light) on the house.
author: Jenny L.

description:
This bar is what its advertised to be. I have read some reviews here that don't like the look or feel of the bar. Lets rate this bar as it is.
College bar
 Beer Pong tables: great if you are in the mood to compete with some college kids or want to get competitive with a fun drinking game out.
 Pool Table: another fun event when out drinking
 Dart Board: great way to change up the games at a bar

This bar is a great college bar. rarely do you find a bar when you're going to know everyone becasue they go to your school that has the house party feel but you're actually out. 

Cons: hard to find parking
           bathrooms are filthy
author: Miles P.

description:
"Yo bruh, I got sooo wasted last night. I mean, soooo wasted... Anyway, wanna go play beer pong at Bar None?"

If this sounds familiar and/or you normally answer this question with "tchyaa!" then you should definitely check out Bar None. If you puked a little in your mouth reading this, you might avoid at all costs...
author: Peter C.

description: A bit divey. Fun if you want to play college beer games. It's mostly guys who want to feel like they're back in their college bar scene. Younger crowd. Not as douchey as some places in the Marina.
author: Caitlin C.

description: If zero stars was an option... The bartender was one of the most offensive people I have ever met. "T" or "Towel" or whatever the heck his name was. Kept shouting inappropriate words especially for the city he is in. "F@ggot" are you kidding me? who still uses that word. What an asshole.
author: Kathleen C.

description:
The bouncers at Bar None are not there to stop fights, they are there to start them.

That is the most important information I can give, however i would like to touch on other matters first. Bar None is a great place to go to play drinking games. They have plenty of tables to play beer pong or flip cup. They have a pool table and other bar games. If you are into bar games, Bar None has the equipment to suit you.

However, Bar None is one of the filthiest places you will ever visit. I'm not sure they ever clean anything. You can notify the staff of broken glass and they will glibly ignore it (so don't wear sandals if you visit). The bathrooms look like they belong in the lowliest establishment in a third world country. That might even be an insult to third world countries. But, a person can get on fine with this level of care, as long as the staff is up to snuff.

Bar None hires men who have no thought except for the next opportunity to pound someones face, and closing time is the perfect place. Take a second too long to react to an order to vacate, and an employee will be in your face telling you to throw a punch. Doesn't matter if you are walking towards the exit, trying to leave, they will accost you as you exit. They want to fight. Bar None employees understand that as long as you throw the first punch, they are justified in beating you, and they want you to throw that first punch. They antagonize their late night patrons, looking for the fight that normally wouldn't happen. As you walk away, down the street, they scream after you to come back and show that you are a man. To them, you aren't one if you don't attack them.

At most bars you expect the bouncers to stop fights, here you should expect them to initiate or at least join in. If you go, leave before 1; unless you are the type that enjoys a good brawl.
author: Stephen S.

description:
Really, there's only one thing Bar None is good for... and that one thing is Beer Pong. If you come here for anything else but tossing dirty ping pong balls into cups sitting atop some of the stickiest rectangular tables in San Francisco, well... I probably don't want to hang out with you. Ever. 

I'm not much of a beer games type, but when you've got a gaggle of inebriated bruts in tow on a gorgeous Saturday afternoon in the Marina, sometimes a quick dip into a college bar for some binge drinking is just the thing to kick it up a notch. 

This is the only bar that I know of in The City that has beer pong tables set up year round (complete with plastic cups and more ping pong balls than a Thai gentleman's club), so if you're hankering for a duel, but don't want to get sloppy in your own abode, you know where to go.
author: Ruggy J.

description: I HAVE experienced better.
author: John H.

description: This place is the meet up for after kickball games--which was fun playing flip cup and beer pong.  I used to frequent this place every week after games. HOWEVER when I came to this bar with a friend whom has a SERVICE DOG the dog man was friendly and let us in. We are on our second drink when the asshole manager comes out and aggressively tells us to leave his bar. Confused, we were not sure why he was being such a douchebag, he then goes in to say "I don't give a f*ck if that a seeing eye dog or whatever the hell he's for, get him out of my bar!" Now...I can understand if it was a pet dog...but a SERVICE dog? Really dude? Anyways I haven't been back to this bar since, I don't want to support a douche that makes a mockery of people with disabilities and in need of services.
author: Arielle M.

description: Best dive bar in SF! The service is awesome! I always have the time of my life when I go there! I don't want to be friends with anyone who doesn't like bar none. Awesome people working there and good vibes all around! Thanks guys for another epic night!
author: Thomas P.

description:
Love this place for watching sports.  Always a solid time, lots of TVs and they pretty much always  honor requests for games to be shown.  The beer is very reasonably priced, and you can order pitchers.

There are other non-sports watching activities as well...among my favorites: BUCK HUNTER, and there is a beer pong area.

Great inside-outside space conveniently on Union St.

The only negative is the food isn't that great, but that can be remedied by taking a break from the beer pong table to grab a slice at Extreme Pizza next door.
author: Nic S.

description:
With foosball, beer pong, how can you go wrong? It's dirty, congested, and stuffy. 

No.
author: Atif K.

description: The staff were extremely rude, the bouncers were extremely rude as well and the place smelled like a barn. Never again will I go there
author: A L.

description: Mediocre bar in the marina. It's very chill. Fun if you like to play darts, beer pong, or pool. Decent drinks. Gross bathroom.
author: Julianne P.

description:
Lost my ID here, called the next day and they said they did not have it. Came in person and they said they couldn't find it. Received a call from a San Mateo County Sheriff about a month later saying a bouncer who worked here was caught burglarizing a house with my ID on him.

Quality Establishment.
author: Nick D.

description:
FRAT HOUSE.

If you like beer pong and crazy fights, this is the place for you.
author: Sophia B.

description:
I haven't had that much beer spilled on me since college. And never have I been made out ON. Two people chose me to lean up against me like I was a wall (and not because it was too crowded) as they sucked each other's faces off. 

I like what one Yelper said, "You have to know exactly what you're getting into when going to Bar None." This is true. We were meeting someone here and did not go by choice. I wouldn't chose this bar in a million years. 

It was okay before all of the marina showed up and then it was just too crowded with way too many young overly drunk people. 

I did kick everyone's butt on the basketball hoop though, and sadly, that was the highlight of my night.
author: Nikki G.

description:
I'm giving Bar None a three-star review w/the disclaimer that if you show up here, you at least somewhat know what you're getting into.  Meaning, it's a dive, its frat-tastic, and you're here to play drinking games.  That's essentially what this place is all about, and if that sounds awful to you, there's nothing about Bar None that will make you change your mind about any of those things.  It is what it is.  

The bathrooms are gross, the floors are sticky, and the crowd is douchey (which strangely, can be endearing).  I recommend showing up already a little buzzed and sticking to beer (even between pong games).  I'd also leave the white shoes at home...
author: George A.

description:
worst bar in SF I have ever been to. my friend ordered a drink and they gave it to her and then immediately kicked her out and refused to give her a reason or let anyone talk to a manager and then kicked out anyone who talked to her. 

worst management and customer service I have ever seen. everyone was looking forward to a good night together.
author: Gabriela L.

description:
So the fundamental problem with most of the reviews you will read on this Yelp page is their lack of understanding of a specific value prop as being paramount in an evaluating framework. 

Bar None is exactly what is proposes to do, and if you're comparing it to French Laundry, then you have a framework issue and your review is functionally futile. 

Let me tell you what Bar None is supposed to be: a fratty, day-drinking, beer-pong-playing, early-to-mid 20s kind of bar that brings back nostalgia for your college days, whether it be in terms of cheap beer, dirty bathrooms, or unspeakable sins that forever stain your standard in men. 

To these notions, Bar None is true and faithful. 

And because of that, it receives 5 stars. 

Go have some watered down bud light, maybe a jager bomb or two, and feel young again.
author: Meghana D.

description:
I was actually happy to be in the Marina for once, because this bar has beer pong!

Long story short, I went undefeated, and then rented an apartment with it's own beer pong room so thankfully I can postpone my return to the Marina indefinitely.
author: Emily D.

description:
Went here Friday night with a group of 7. I wasn't thrilled with the idea of going because I've never really liked the crowd or how dark and dirty it is inside. However, my friends all wanted to go so I tagged along. Big mistake. 

There were 3 bouncers at the door and almost everyone got in. One of my friends handed a bouncer his ID and the bouncer handed it back and said "$5 dollars to get in". Well the idea of paying to get into this place is laughable (and nobody else was asked to pay) so my friend thinks its a joke and laughs and tried to walk past him.
