The bouncer then placed his hands on my friend's neck and shoved him several steps away. The bouncer kept shouting that he was going to wring anyones neck that crossed him and that he would choke my friend. This scared most of the other people in line and they started to just hand the bouncers their IDs without making eye contact and without saying a word. Since everyone was so intimidated it reminded me of the episode of the Soup Nazi from Seinfeld. Why, when there are so many better options, would you still enter this place where trash greets you at the door? 

If you wonder what my friend did, he walked away to smoke a cigarette while I grabbed the rest of our group that got inside so we could leave. Bar None needs to provide their bouncers with proper training to prevent lawsuits for using excessive force. Why didn't we do something to get his guy in trouble? I keep asking myself the same question but I guess we were just shocked that my friend was singled out by some power hungry bouncer that was looking for trouble. The whole situation disgusts me.
author: Christina E.

description:
This place kinda sucks and I always plan on not going here..............

Yet, somehow I end up here half the time Im in the Marina!!!!
author: Alex B.

description:
Maybe I will need to graduate college first before the idea of paying exorbitant prices to play beer pong will appeal to me, although by then I think beer pong will no longer be an appealing way to spend my time.

This place is basically a frat transported into the Marina but with most of the good aspects of the frat removed. You can play beer pong, which seems to be a big draw, but the expensive drinks and proliferation of high school aged or at least high school acting patrons doesn't appeal to me. I understand why some people might like this type of atmosphere but there is no appeal for me.
author: Nicolas H.

description:
I came here for a friend's fundraiser.  While I can understand Ligaya's hatred of this place on a higher level (we both went to colleges in *the* college town), I was actually ok with it's existence.  Here's why:

First, it is cool to know that you can play official beer pong somewhere.   Sure, the guy pontificating about beer pong rules like it's the Magna Carta is annoying, but it just gives people like me a chance to use the term "douche bag"  more often in everyday conversation.

Second, Bar None is actually a much bigger bar than most marina bars, so maybe you can squeeze yourself into a meathead-free zone.  I was, in full disclosure, here at 1 in the afternoon and the crowd was pretty amped up even by early afternoon standards.  

Third, they gave us rolling rock on tap for the beer pong.  I love Rolling Rock, much to the chagrin of my more cultured friends. 

Last, if you love tater tots (I do not), your $6 order of tater tots is huge.

So, in reading over my friends' reviews, I don't disagree with what they are saying.  I'm sure if I tried a Saturday night excursion into this place, I would be outta there in 5 minutes or less.   But for my niche foray into the marina twenty-something scene, it worked out ok.
author: Will A.

description: I had fun here and enjoyed beer pong and drink specials. However, the bathrooms were s bit sketchy and dirty. The bouncers were also total jerks and unfriendly. The owner was nice but the bouncers really ruined it for me.
author: Theresa B.

description: Everyone gives this place shit, but on a mellow night, it's actually a pretty good time. A lot of frat bros, arcade games, and beer pong, but I'm a believer that anything is good in moderation so is this my favorite spot? No. But I'm happy to stop in every once in a while for some skee-ball and Hot Shot Basketball. Cheap pitchers too
author: Nick S.

description: On slow nights hours of operation can close whenever the staff feels like it. The more you tip the more they are obligated to stay open. Only come here for beer pong !
author: Tommy s.

description:
You have to know exactly what you're getting into when going to Bar None. This is not a place I typically go to because of it's crowd and general extreme frattiness (even compared to other Marina bars).  

That being said, my friends and I picked BN for a pre-Final Four game watch venue because we really just wanted to play flip cup.  BN is the best place for such activities, and for this they get a full 3 stars.  Otherwise, I probably would not be caught dead here.

The Bar None folks are smart - beer pints are provided in plastic, not glass, cups and there's a stack of beer pong/flip cup cups available in the corner for you to grab at your leisure.

Pitchers of Bud Light are $14, which seems a little pricey to me but hey, when you have a group of roughly 20 people playing flip cup, that's what you do.  I do wish I had clorox wipes with me to clean the tables off before playing, but oh well.  The bathroom was surprisingly not terrible and accessible from both sides of the bar.

For the times I want to relive college shenanigans, I can think of no better place than Bar None to do so. If you just want to chill and grab a drink, I'd probably skip this place.

I will say, during the daytime, the large area with the glass roof was pretty cool.
author: Naoko M.

description: It's not the cleanest but it's the best for your money.  The bartender Matthew will hook it up and keep it real.  Real drunk.  Staff is always friendly and prices are reasonable on the daily.  $2 mystery shots never steered me wrong.  5 mystery shots have but that's expected if you make it that far.
author: Brandon N.

description:
Its just another marina bar with same marina crowd. A lot of people complain about the crowd here, but its just a bunch of college kids that pound drinks and get obnoxious. If your not a kid like that you probably don't want to find yourself in here. I think the beer pong going on in the back is dead giveaway of the crowd their trying to attact. The bartenders are very experienced and friendly. Theres always sports on and theres a jukebox.

Gets two stars because the weekends sometimes gets too packed and you really gotta work to get through the crowd. This is when it gets touch to get a drink. It gets packed to the point where its not fun anymore and its just annoying. Theres a pool table in the back and some small tables and chairs. Played beer pong once here, but only because I was beyond smashed. The floors get sticky and grimy and i wouldn't recommend playing unless you really don't care about hygiene and your health or whatever.

Cheap compared to the lounges around there like Circa and Matrix. And its in a good location thats sort of in the middle of everything in the marina.

Beezys will be beezys and douchebags will be douchebags but theres room for a little fun in between.
author: Arthur C.

description: More like Bar NoFun. Although that bar is spacey, its always packed with the typical Marina crowd and 21 year olds. The rude bartenders who suck at making drinks makes it even worse. Good luck getting a seat/drink/enjoying yourself.
author: Anastasia P.

description: Such a fun time, I didn't even remember anything after. Your typical college like bar but that's what I was going for.
author: Stacy G.

description:
Oh Bar None. What mixed-reviews you receive! Perhaps thats why I've (until yesterday) avoided you at all costs. 

Alas, my girlfriend was celebrating her 25th birthday and insisted we go there. (Really? REALLY?)  Ok fine. Only because it's your birthday.

Call me crazy- but I like this place. Perhaps it's the familiarity- the urine & booze soaked wood, the divey atmosphere. It just feels comfortable. (Like G Street on a Wednesday night at UCD- but I digress.) My college days are over.

The staff seem quite friendly and the crowd seemed to be a nice mix. Didn't catch the douche-vibe (Oh god! Is this because I've become part of the "Marina Crowd?" Scary thought...) In fact, I met quite a few cool people. :)

I'd go back without question!
author: Annalise F.

description:
How many places can you name in the city that have tables especially for beer pong (or beirut as some east-coasters call it)? Yeah, that's what I thought. After doing some intense research, a couple of my friends came here just to relive our college days.

Is it really pretty inside? Not particularly. Is it uber clean? I'm sure the staff could do some more wiping down of the bar and sweeping of the floors . . . BUT is that really what you need when you come to play beer pong? Not at all!

The beer is really cheap and the bartenders are willing to give you extra balls and anything you need to keep the fun going. I even spilled a half pitcher of beer (I know, shame on me), and a janitor came to mop it up in minutes. I think that's all I require and expect of any dive bar that provides recreational beer pong.

Tip: If you're above 24 or 25, Bud Light is just not what respectable 20-somethings should play with. That and at this age, your taste buds are refined enough to tell you that Bud Light is just straight up gross. So, if you're a young adult, play like one, order pitchers of Pacifico.
author: Linna L.

description:
This place. FANTASTIC! Lol.....Reading the other reviews had me cracking up! But honestly.....Its a BAR!! What do you expect....This place is such an joyous place to start, finish or pass through the day....

Darren the bartender may just be the best part! This marina joint definitely has my vote to visit any day of the week morning, noon or night!
author: Hillary H.

description:
Bar None is exactly what it is... Bar None above the rest of any other mid 20s-early 30s post college dive bar that offers nothing but cheap beer and ordinary mixed drinks. If you're looking for a chic SF cocktail bar or dance club, you might as well suit up and find somewhere else. Bar None specializes in beers, bros, babes, and sports. Oh, and blackouts too.

I started coming here with my buddies after graduating college and moving to the city. You're more likely to find others from every other part of the world than SF, yet all focus is on the locale of the city of gold in peace, iron in war. One thing you will have to understand is that the bar staff encounters hundreds of new faces daily, and may not be the most accomidating. Just be friendly, wait your turn, and pay your bill.

Lastly, shout outs to Otto (recently retired), Matthew, Julie, and Tao! Keep it up guys, although seperated by 4 oceans, 8 time zones, and over 30 countries, after one year deployed you better believe i'll be back!

- Z
author: Vince Z.

description: Came in on Sun afternoon. Place was empty. Big beer selection just nothing out of the ordinary. Bartender was attentive. Smells like dirty bar rag - I hate that. Seems like a typical college crowd bar.
author: Chris M.

description:
Yes, this is a normal fun dive bar that i have frequented for years but I had a very disturbing experience at Bar None recently and I don't plan on ever going back again. 

A bouncer in the back of the bar, out of nowhere, told my friend and I to stop looking at him or talking about him.  He added that "I already have two children to deal with; I don't need two more."  Ooookkaaayyyy.... We continued on the path of NOT paying any attention to him then he came back, again claiming  that we were talking about him. He swiped my friend's drink out of his hand and pushed us out of the bar, with the unnecessary help of several other bouncers.  Considering we were essentially sober, the whole transaction made me feel insane and I was very shaken.  All but one of the bouncers were unresponsive when I tried to complain at the front of the house.   I kept expecting them to announce that MTV's "Boiling Point" was back on the air and we had won $20.  It is not safe to have a gigantic unstable man lurking in the back of a bar with nobody willing to regulate him.
author: Molly S.

description:
If you enjoy drinking in port-o-potties, dirty alleys or frat houses, please do go to this bar...and stay there.

Not only is it littered with filth, it's filled with college girls in players' jerseys they've probably never even heard of, frat bros and your occasional bleach blonde bimbo.
Basically, douche-central.
At one point, some dude-bro even came over just to let my friend know he didn't like her dancing...probably because she wasn't dancing like a hoe.

Never. again.
author: Bree P.

description: Hey, sometimes you want to go to a dive-y, somewhat douche-y meat market of a bar instead of the usual $13 cocktail mixology bars San Francisco offers. And that's okay. Bar None has got you covered. The drinks are cheap, it's loud, crowded, and you'll definitely get hit on by some bro named Chad. But it is kind of a fun place to go if you keep all of that in mind. The door guy is suuuuper nice, by the way.
author: Kate C.

description: Fun bar to go to if you want to play darts, arcade games and beer pong. Very young crowd but always a good time.
author: Nicholas F.

description:
Well after 6 hrs of bar hoping on our quest for a dart board in a pub. (Wake up SF if the word PUB is in your name you need a dart board) anyway we found this place and got the last set of darts and 4 or 6 pitchers later (don't remember) we were doing good. the beer pong looked like fun. We had a good time.

Chris
author: Chris A.

description:
So whilst on vacation we came here 'cause it was close to our hotel and they had some good deals for their power hour. 

So I thought. We got there just as it started and bartender pours us two beers, checks his watch and charges us full price. Ok...well I guess maybe our watches were fast? No biggie. 

Second round of drinks, definitely during their power hour. Since I had a tab, didn't see what he had charged us until we cashed out. Charged us full price for every single drink. I know we probably should've said something but the bartender seemed more like a bouncer and ever so slightly terrifying to someone who's barely 5'3''. 

SO that, along with a meh atmoshpere = not a place tourists (or even people who live here) should go, unless you feel like getting ripped off, playing beer pong or reliving your long gone college days. Pr
author: Jesy B.

description: I went here with my friends on 4-18-14 11:40pm'sh after hanging out at silver cloud.  As I entered this bar, it reminds me of dave and buster's, there's a pool table, skee ball, foosball, and arcade basketball.  We're just chilling, it's alright.
author: Jer W.

description:
I must say that I agree with everyone on here. There is definitely nothing special about this bar...hence the name Bar NONE. Not only is the crowd filled with rambunctious college kids and frat boys but it is always very crowded.  I typically prefer an upscale environment and a mixed crowd. AND one in which I can walk freely without bumping into someone or getting bumped into. 

Quick tip...Be careful what you touch (ex. tables, bar, everything else), things at this bar are disgustingly  filthy... Other than that..I've always had fun at this bar because of the people I come with. I suggest coming here with a big group of friends as it will make things much more exciting.
author: Viennelyn C.

description:
Nothing too special about this bar... out in the Marina which is pretty far out from the rest of the city. Came here for a birthday, only thing special about it is that it has a pool table, a basketball hoop, arcade games, skee-ball, and 4 tables for beer pong. They have several TVs in there which is nice. Place looks pretty old. They had food but I didn't order. Asked some friends who tried the taco and they said I wasn't missing out on anything... and that it was pretty dry. But I guess it was only $1... and when you're drunk... you just don't care! Bought some pitchers for beer pong... but pitchers here are pretty pricey and it's small! The worse thing was that there was a lot of foam on the top too, so I felt really ripped off paying $16 for a pitcher. Finally... the mens room was pretty disgusting. I've seen my share of gross looking bathrooms and I usually don't care... but this one was pretty rundown looking. What used to be a sink is now a huge urinal. I wouldn't mind so much if there wasn't like 20 different flies in there trying to land on me and my junk.

Anyway, now I can say I've been here... and that's that! Other places in the city where can I get reasonably priced beer, play beer pong at, and not worry about being attacked by flies.
author: Johnson S.

description: This place has such terrible reviews. I have no idea why. Actually I do: don't go there on weekends or busy nights with the Marina douches! The staff is so friendly and welcoming. I have only lived in SF for less than a year, this was the first bar I ever went to and I cannot recommend it enough! On an night that's not super busy, it's a perfect place to make your day a little better. Calm, great drinks, great nightly specials, food if you are hungry (yay tater tots!), good conversation, even spare cigs if you are low! Matty, Britton, Jimmy, Durrajeh, Jason, etc. are so hospitable and kind to newcomers, and now that I know them, it's still true. This place is a gem for me.
author: Miriah S.

description:
ugh... trust fund douchebag frat boy central, and it was just grimey all around. The bathroom floor was completely wet, and why? Because i looked over at the toilet and it's filled to the brim and over flowing w/ nastiness and the trashcan was hidden under a 4ft tall mound of paper towels. The rest of the bar wasn't much better.

never again...
author: Charles Michael B.

description:
This is the grossest dive bar I've EVER been to.

The beer pong table area is the worst. The floor is an unevenly paved mess. The restroom is right next to it and the whole area smells like a GIANT URINAL. I don't even want to imagine what type of disease is festering on that floor...
author: Lisa Q.

description:
This place is a two star rating and I'm being generous. It's grimy, drinks are bad, and the crowd is immature and rowdy. It is seriously a frat boy central. It consisted mostly  of guys who are in college or think they're still in college. 

I came here to see what it was all about, and now I'm glad I know. Never again.
author: Denise W.

description:
Wow, I'm a little taken off guard seeing all the hating on Bar None, and figured I would throw in my two cents.The clientele is definitely fratty, but I've never really found it that much a deterrent other than the sea of plaid once you enter. If you are coming to the Marina, this is to be expected, if it really bothers you, DON'T COME. 

The beer pong/flip cup set up is definitely what makes this place. It's great to come with a group of people and find your self delightfully inebriated after best of 10 flip cup rounds. I also have eaten here on more than one occasion when Extreme Pizza was too crowded, and definitely can vouch for the good drunk food.
author: Melinda S.

description: We (my hubby,  my sister, my BFF and a couple friend of ours) had a great time! We stumbled on this place while on the "no plan plan" while visiting the city. Matthew the was great! Even threw us some freebies! We were there for almost 8 hours and loved every minute. Sure it's a little dark, a little dirty and has some interesting aromas but as a dive bar in the Marina/Cow Hollow area it was awesome. The food wasn't anything special but it was filling and tasty. Order the wings! Crispy and not over sauced. We will be back for another niner game!
author: Lisa W.

description:
Wednesday happy hour deal is truly a happy hour!
25cents buffalo chicken wings+ beer + burger + chicken sandwich + yelp deal + awesome bartender = happy hour!
author: Mari A.

description:
LETS JUST SAY I GAVE NEW MEANING TO "PUB CRAWL" ST PATTYS DAY 2012

I was visiting on vacation and decided to do the pub crawl I am so glad we got there at 1230 ( when i thought i was actually running late) cause when we grabbed our things to start our pub crawl that place was elbow touching packed ! .... Luckily i got a couple seats at the bar and never made it to the parade or other bars on the intinerary 

phew .. after 4 jamesons a car bomb and dollar beers i was done at 330pm ! 

I gave the waitress a st pattys headband as a peace offering for those IDIOTS THAT CALL THEMSELVES FANS OF THE DODGERs and told her not all dodger fans are like that ... 

Place was a nice spot to start and end my st pattys day i really wanted one of their shirts ! i am going to nyc this sept so ill be sure to visit the bar none there too ! 

after those drinks i crawled literally up the stairs to wait for a cab lol good times at bar non ... I am not sure how i ended up with a tab of 65$ but oh well lol
author: Cynthia C.

description:
I'm not sorry to put down only one star. I'm not from this neighborhood, nor do I try to be one of those haters who hate the Marina just because...

But I do despise this bar. 

I was forced to come to this bar though so I didn't come here looking for a fight. I was expecting a place with a decent Scotch list and a floor that wasn't flooded with plastic Budweiser cups and strewn booze.  I wasn't going to balk at the decor, the lack of a jukebox (it was just the same lame song over and over by the way) and or the lack of a crowd.

I do give this place one star for the staff and the cronies that hang around the bartender on Monday nights. I came in with a group of 10 after dinner and while we were dressed nicely, we got cat calls and told we were at the wrong bar. Ouch. 

While most of the boys were already engrossed in their beer pong game and completely enjoying the alpha male bonding experience, the girls ventured out and got dirty looks from the Porky's crowd and for the most part, laughed at for wearing a skirt and heels. 

While I realize it's a frat boy's wet dream with the trashy pieces of what's hot now fawning all over any beer guzzling Neanderthal, it's not my idea of even a dive bar and I love a good dive bar. 

I sincerely hope this place closes down and then re-hires all of their bartenders and possibly retrain them in the process.

As for the jerks who are regular bar rats here, I hope they get a piece of their own medicine one day when I turn them away for reservations at my restaurant.
author: Jessica K.

description:
When i have friends in town, one of the places i always visit in Bar None - but only for a short while. Just enough time to play a game of beer pong and flip cup, then we're off. Most of the time the crowd is great, but the inevitable macho guy comes up with his buddies if you stay past and hour/ Self proclaimed cardiologists, NY attorneys that don't know the name of a court room in NY, and just about every other loser that heard you could pick up a girl by playing beer pong. 

Overall a fun place to hit up if you ever have the need to play beer pong or get a quick drink. The bar is actually pretty long, so you can actually sit at it rather than trying to wave you money near a bartender's face to get him to give you a drink. You can choose your setting too - get there early and there's very few people, get there late and it's packed.
author: Lisa T.

description:
The bartender sells me a pitcher of beer, I grab it and walk to my table and literally two minutes later we're approached by a meathead bouncer who says something along the lines of "get out.  We're closed."  No last call.  No warning.  Nada.  Also note: it wasn't even 1:30.

I responded by politely telling him that I'd like to finish the beer I just paid $15 for and I'd make sure I was out in the next few minutes.  "GET OUT NOW" and the meatball proceeded to push us toward the door.  Awe, hell no. 

I'd eat soiled underwear from a homeless man before going back to Bar None.
author: Selina I.

description:
A great spot for cheap beer and great beer pong.

I went to the one in New York and I had fun there too, but something about the one in the Marina is just a little better.

If you're not into being just a little immature, you probably won't like this spot, but if you want to have some fun and enjoy a little bit of your college years, Bar None is great.
author: Ken G.

description:
Do you miss the grungy FRAT PARTIES in college?  Have an itch to play BEER PONG?

It's really that simple: if you answered "yes" to 1 or 2 of those questions above, then you should visit Bar None.  Major advantage: their beer pong setup is very well organized & easy.

1. buy a pitcher of beer
2. grab a table (3 or 4 in the place)
3. stacks of disposable cups &  ping pong balls are right there next to the table
author: Michael B.

description:
Bar None? More like Bar No. It reminds me of those underground spots that would hold fight clubs and private card room in the back.

I like the diversity in the crowd mix. Well, it's SF so it should be mixed. Along with the looking for parking like playing darts in the dark, it's a typical joint that SF has to offer in the Marina area.

First impression: dark, dingy, DIRTY.

Second impression: grenades, land-mines, beached whales with boots.

Third impression: drunktards, douches and pricks.

Dress policy is addressed in this place's name: none - The fashion police would have a ball at this place. If there are guys who are looking for a place that does not regulate on dress shoes, dress shirts policy, this is the place to go.

This place has lighting issues. I'm not sure what type of ambiance they're trying to create about it's sure a fuglee one. For a place that has beer pong in the back, they're sure playing a lot of Lady Gaga, Ke$ha, and Beyonce. Should I be concerned?

The folks playing beer pong: you guys realize every time the ball drops on the ground, it's filthy right? It drops in the area near the bathroom hallway. And the bathrooms are disgusting and flooded. So you dummies are going to pick up that pong ball, play with it, get it in your beer cup then drink the beer? GROSS.

To the drunk idiot next to me: I don't care if you're drunk or pretending to be drunk, can you please not push me? Clearly there's hella room to stand around and have a good time. Have some courtesy and learn to respect people's personal space. This is California after all, prick.

The drinks at this spot were good. Mixed drinks were up to par. The beer seemed to be a hit with my group but considering it's all the same old on-tap offerings, it's not hard to please.

I only came here at my group of friends' request. Otherwise, I rather not. It's a good spot if you don't mind the rude patrons, the stupid displays of peacocking and level-5 clingers trying to buy you drinks.
author: Stephanie N.

description: Came here for Halloween. It was pretty cool overall. Not a very large line to get in, but boy was it crowded inside! If you don't sweat easily, be sure to sweat tons here! Ha. Lots of people on edge that night even though the crowd wasn't the type to fight, aka all bark and no bite! If you like your own space at a bar, then good luck here! The prices were just as expected, so no complaints. It was fun but it wasn't an awesome enough place to stay here all night long.
author: Lauren Ashley G.

description:
I actually enjoyed myself here quite a bit! I came here to watch the recently failed Niners game (so sad) and this was actually the second bar that we went to. The first one, which shall remain nameless for now, was WAY too crowded, so we tried out Bar None. Low and behold, there was plenty of room to watch the game, and several TV's strategically placed so that wherever you stand you have a good view.

The place got pretty crowded, but there was never a time I started to feel claustrophobic or had people pushing up against me. This place is much bigger on the inside than you would think looking from the outside, which is always a bonus.

As for the drinks, I don't know how my friend did it, but whenever we needed more, she would disappear for about a minute and return with pitchers of beer. Now, yes, you get some kudos automatically when you're a girl, but this was during one of the most popular football games in San Francisco, and the bar was packed. She definitely had mad skills and we never had to wait for more than a few minutes to get refills of our beer, which I don't know if I give credit to Bar None or to my friend for this.

The only thing I wish would have been different is to have more chairs in the back room. There were a few tables and chairs but a lot of empty space, they could have fit quite a few more chairs, especially along the back, so that more people could have had seats. But such is life, it's a bar, it's not expected, just would have been nice.
author: Tiffany C.

description: Under rated.   Try it again for the first time.
author: Doug B.

description:
Yo, bro, eff this place! 

I'm going to update this later, but just want to drag their score down in the meantime while I can.

--------

I'm back and writing novels today. So the reason why I hate this place is because of the racist shits that come here. My friends who are colored folk (we're brown and yellow people) were playing beer pong, having a good time. Then busloads of douchebags in retarded kickball t-shirts (both male & female) inundate the bar and think they own the joint. They try to kick my friends off their table "just cause". No, how about we leave when you beat us. Even though that's clearly fair they still whined and told on us to the manager, who even agreed that he can't just make us leave like that.

So thank god my friend is really good at beer pong because he killed every douchebag there. I've never been prouder of being Asian. I almost changed into my kimono and played a victory song on my lute. I don't know how he stayed so calm with these dumbasses accusing them of cheating every shot they made and with this one particular mindless steroid-injected freak yelling in their face every 5 minutes about some bullshit, because I was flipping my lid, cussing a girl out for wagging her finger in my friend's face, and wringing my hands with how much anxiety I felt at the possibility of losing to these assholes.

My friend's brother who had nothing to do with anything walks in later and immediately gets yelled at and told by a douchette that you and your friends shouldn't be allowed here for the next 3 months. He had no clue what she was talking about. We laugh about this now.

Also, amidst all the senseless yelling, they try sending over their one lapdog Asian ambassador to talk some sense into us but he just ends up barking in our faces like he's got something to prove. I could've vomited.

I give this place 5 stars if you're the type to like bar fights because this place will give you a great reason to start one. Don't forget to invite me. These spoiled brats are all bark and no bite, cowards who deserve a good spanking. Props to the manager for having some sense and definitely to the Samoan bouncer who had our back.
author: May C.

description:
***Sigh*** What is there to say about Bar None that hasn't already been said? 

Even though I'm 29 and should have graduated from this place 8 years ago, I still have great affection for this place. Maybe it's the mix of stale beer and Bath & Body Works that assaults your nostrils as soon as you descend into the bar entrance. Maybe it's the lovable Polynesian bar back that fistbumps everyone, even after taking care of some bodily fluid left behind by one of the regulars. Maybe it's the trough style toilet that reminds me of the old days at Candlestick & the Oakland Colosseum. Whatever the reason, as I enter my fourth decade on this planet, I am still a regular here (and as of 12/25/10, I'm the Duke).

One of my favorite memories here: Fellow yelper Joe M. and I stopped by at 5pm on a whim for A game of beer pong (not beirut). One game turned into two, and two turned into five. Mind you, drinking games are not Joe M.'s area of strength so he ended up taking down 3+ of the five pitchers. By 7pm he was nice and saucy for his next event: a celebration for his buddy's third year of sobriety!!!

Enjoy Bar None for what it is. Don't hate. It's frat-tastic.
author: Chris F.

description:
When I used to live in San Francisco, we would come here quite frequently. I was young and stupid, what can I say? No, just kidding. This bar can actually be quite fun on the weekends. It does get crowded and definitely attracts San Francisco's best douchebags, but you can also meet some fun crowds while engaging in a raucous game of beer pong. 

The bathrooms are absolutely disgusting. I mean, perhaps the worst I have ever seen in my life. But hopefully you will be inebriated enough not to notice. 

I actually came here during my last trip to San Francisco and we popped in to try to catch the niners game. Strangely enough, there wasn't a single TV playing the niners...? Odd since they are a San Francisco team. I guess that just goes to show how transient this city is. But anyway, our bartender was SO nice. His name was Matt and he was more than accommodating, checking on us frequently and offering us a free shot here and there. He was so friendly and quite honestly, in a city with not very many overly friendly people, it was refreshing. He is probably originally from the Midwest.

My Bloody Mary was spot on and they had a generous selection of beers.
author: Kristin R.

description: Bar None is a college bar for sure. We went on a weekday, so it's not a bad place to wrap up the night with a little bit of beer pong and / or desperation. It's ok - we've all been there at one point or another.
author: Laura N.

description:
Want to know my idea of hell? Bar None. This place is disgusting and crowded. I had no idea what I was in for when I allowed myself to be dragged inside.

Two words: NEVER AGAIN
author: Miriam W.

description:
It was conveniently located. We walked from MatrixFilmore and the Comet Club. It was just a jaunt away. 

I went on a Friday night around midnight and did not have to wait to long to play a game of beer pong. It was only about a 15 minute wait. The beer was about $15 a pitcher (with tip and all) at the cheapest. 

It was definitely fraty, to say the least. 

I would definitely go back if I had the urge to play beer pong.
author: Frances M.

description:
This place is so bro-y and shit-faced-peeing-on-myself-drunk that you should be forewarned: none of the class that the Marina district exudes exists here. 

Think of the money holders that have abodes in the Marina: rich old men with perma-sunburns and loafers, accompanied by wives perenially trying to cheat death by going for jogs at Crissy Field, and at 65, still looking amazing. Well, everyone at Bar None are these people's KIDS. The spoiled, entitled ex-Greek children who found meaning to their lives in the preying-on-the-insecure's-money practice of inducting people into an organization based on dues-paying friendship are here, post-graduation (with that recreation studies degree) to shove in your face that they were perhaps a beer pong champion, drive a hummer or have more access to steroids than you do.

The first time I ever got claustrophobic was here. After all these years, the beer-stained floor and shirts of the patrons (starting from my days as a budding Davey at UCD house parties) finally got to me, and I had to flee. I hadn't even drank anything that night.

If you're 20-24 years of age and haven't experienced partying in your college life yet: this is your place.
author: Davey R.

description:
There is definitely an age limit (or at least maturity level limit) that you should abide by if you are thinking about going to this bar.  This is a great place to re-live the college days of yester-year by drinking cheap beer, playing some beer pong/flip cup, and having an overall good time.  I have been coming here on a regular basis for my kickball after parties the past month or two but sadly, the season is over so I no longer have an excuse to jump on the 45 bus to party like it's 2005.

Tips:
-Don't expect some fantastic mixed drink, stick with rolling rock
-Wear what you want but someone might spill on you
-Have fun!  If you aren't having fun, you are in the minority.
-Grab a table and play!  Seriously, when is the last time you played beer pong?  It was fun then, it's still fun now.
author: Scott G.

description:
This place isn't really my cup of tea. I'm not really into the college scene anymore.

Come here for:
-beer pong
-flip cup on those days the kickball teams are here (or join a kickball team too)
-weird specials like jersey shore thursdays
-a crowd of ex fraternity and sorority members that are still trying to relive their college days
-foosball
-pool

Don't come here for:
-a classy setting
-a place to show off your new designer dress
-a clean bathroom

I've been here plenty of times, and I do walk in every now and then because friends are there, but it will never be the place chosen by yours truly to hang out.
author: Ashley D.

description:
Bar None isn't quite as sh!tty as I expected it to be but I did go early in the day probably before it reached it maximum gross-out potential. I was prepared to be disgusted as I descended into the subterranean bar but thankfully the bar is huge and there's a sky light towards the back that lets in a good amount of natural lighting. The bartenders were extra friendly on a busy day so that was cool. The bathroom is precariously tipping on the edge between tolerable and disgusting.

Unfortunately, I did not have the chance to buy a $10 pitcher of bud light because  went during the Union Street Fair and of course price gouging was in full effect -- $5 for a pint of bud light. Hella weak.

I'm not the biggest fan of the Marina soooooo I probably won't return unless the party crew wants to hang there.
author: Kiristen R.

description:
It is with a heavy heart that I give this place a decent review. 

I play on an adult kickball team and Bar None sponsors our league. 

It's like a raging frat party. Never a dull moment here....if you're into raging frat parties. 

If you show up on Wednesday nights you'll see the post kick-ball game crowd playing flip cup / beer pong.

Beer is dirt cheap here and if you're looking for marina blondes, they are here by the boatloads.

I can't say anything bad about the place as much as I want to - I've had some good times here lately.

(hangs head in shame)
author: Carlos A.

description:
Only come here for beer pong. this place reminds me of my college days in Denver. The place is really dirty and there's always tons of fights here.

But the last time my buddies and I went here to play beer pong. My friend Pat (who we call Pav) complained about his beer not being poured right to the bartender, right when he did that they kicked him out  isn't the customer always right!! I didn't feel like he should of gotten kicked out. I haven't been back in a few months. Maybe I am getting too old for the bar none crowd.
author: Brian B.

description: Worste service ever. All the bar tenders are assholes who demand tips before you've even considered leaving and don't serve you unless you get on your knees for them. One bar tender, Matt, refused to give me water when the water cooler ran out and actually splashed me with water for asking. When I told someone else that he was being an asshole, he over heard me, asked what I said and then kicked me out. Before kicking me out he grabbed my cup of ice and through it on the ground. The manager was the only reasonable one there who understood why we were pissed off and told us to come see him next time we are in the area. The only plus side was that everyone I was with also left and we could go to somewhere a lot cooler.
author: Chase P.

description:
If i could have given this place no stars I would have. Upon entering the bar everything looked good security actaully checks ID's guy at the front was nice.

After being inside the crowd seemed like the guys that were stuck in high school/frat bros, the bar tender was an ass hole extremely rude and pushy also over charged me for my drinks where as my friends I was with all had different priced drinks (even though they were the same). Someone threw up while they were sitting at the bar waiting to get more drinks... 

They closed at 2AM yet at 1:40AM were kicking people out, grabbing drinks out of peoples hands and throwing them into the trash. 2 of our friends were in the restroom (one female one male) it was about 1:45 at this time and they made comments about him being in the bar still and how they should drag him out of the bar and he told them he was waiting for his friend and they said that there is no safer place for a girl to exit the bar than with "6 pissed off security guards."

If you're looking to go to a tool shed be my guest. Worst experience at a bar I have ever had.
author: Brandon W.

description:
ok guys, dont forget to wear your popped collared polo shirts when you come to this bar and youll fit right in. Playing beer pong is really fun at a bar because its like you can get your college life back only for a night. This bar is basically like a giant house party but you have to pay for the beer.

When waiting to get a table for beer pong, make sure you already have your pitcher in hand ready to go. See which table has the least amount of people waiting and talk to the current people playing to make sure you get on a list. DONT be an asshole!!! its just a game. yes i said it. if you lose, thats ok - at least you got to drink more.

A lot of people come here for beer pong, darts, or pool, but it is also a full bar. take shots with your friends or just get a beer and chill, relax, and enjoy :)
author: Kailey O.

description:
Actual: 2.5 stars

Pretty much a standard bar... nice tv setup for sports, long bar, a few tables with stools... bonus for the college set would be the beer pong tables in the back. Bonus for the gals? Fairly clean restrooms...
author: Rachel M.

description:
Yea I am happily biased. I didn't have high expectations. 

I have two requirements.

Clean Restrooms

Men who don't hound me and rape me verbally. ICK

I went here for a Pub Crawl event. I didn't make it out the Bar though I had a handy map of other Bars participating. 

I got PHUKKED UP in a very good way.

Cost me $6 to via Goldstar for a 3 day pass. I used it for a place to be for Halloween. I went by myself had friendly conversations a few people. They were 3 monitors and I was able to watch cheesy American horror movies and football while guzzling stiff ass Whisky and Coke (cause I forgot to bring my list of drinks to try that I haven't had before) and a tall cold glass of German Beer.

Yep I went outside to smoke and it hit I am DONE for the night.

If I was an alcoholic this would've been like heaven. 2 for 1 specials= 2drinks/$5 and $2for draft Beer. I was so confused I gave the Bartender more money which he brought back to me. Wait its not 10 for 2 but 2 for 5?????!!!!! Dayum I need some more friends.


I actually left with money $50 bucks in my pocket what not .50cents. From the City. OMG thats unheard of.

The Bathroom was clean (awesome surprise) and the guys were respectfully macho (also I am a bigger chick and the dudes were gawking at the groups of skinny girls).

Will I return? Not without great cause it was a helluva journey to get there by Bart and Bus.
author: Adamma I.

description:
Beer Pong is the new bowling where people eithertake it too serious or they are trying to throw the ball between their legs. And now you don't need to wait for the next tailgate or house party to play it with 3 tables in the back of Bar None.

Bar None is the place to go when you need a bar and nothing else. Huge bar top so you can seat at the bar but you won't have people 3 deep behind you trying to get their next round.
author: Justin C.

description:
Do you like underage girls, fighting, and beer pong? Personally, I only like one of the three. To really love Bar None you need to love all three. And if you do love all three, then you will love Bar None.

At Bar None, It's not uncommon to be approached by a Marina dude with his chest puffed out saying, "What the ____'s your problem, bro?" Before you know it, you're getting shoved, a 19 year old girl is lifting you off the ground, and you can't wait to start your next round of beer pong.
author: Kevin H.

description:
Typical Marina sports bar. Typical Marina crowd. 

The bar is set up with some tables and cups for flip cup and beer pong in the back. If you want to relive your college years and feel like you are in a dirty, windowless basement of a frat house that reeks of chlorine and feet, this is the place. 

I am only giving them full 3 stars because the bartenders were surprisingly very nice. My drunk roommate left her phone there. They were kind enough to put it aside and the bartender who helped me when I ran in to pick it up for her that night was very pleasant. Plus the other bartender earlier in the day did not give me attitude when I had him fill up my water glass a few times. :) Non-douche-y bartenders can be hard to find sometimes.
author: Gina G.

description:
One of the finest establishments that San Francisco has to offer! I've been here dozens of times. Birthdays, Thursday nights, Saturday directly after brunch, you name it. Bar None has been a go-to of mine since i graduated back in 2007 and it's still going strong. It's a fairly big space with a huge bar in the front, and beer pong/pool tables in the back. The beer pong area has its own corner/nook which makes it super convenient to play games and not worry about spilling all over the place. They have cheap pitchers of beer, ping pong balls, and cups ready to use! I never feel like it gets too crowded/packed that you can't move around - it's truly well-sized so you don't need to worry about that. I would recommend having a birthday party here if you're into beer pong/flip cup. It's so much fun. I love that Marengo is upstairs because usually I end up eating there first and then coming down to Bar None. 

I've probably had way too many jager bombs for my own good at Bar None, and I plan to keep coming back :)
author: Priya G.

description:
One of the few bars that offers beer pong in their back room. We came on a Friday night and it was loaded with college kids. My boyfriend and his friends wanted to play beer pong, so I quietly tagged along. I seriously don't know how people play beer pong when their missed ping-pong balls are bouncing all over the dirty dirty concrete floors. Mmmm, I like beer pong more inside a house.

It's not really my type of place to hang out on Friday night. I prefer seats and good music more..

I did secretly wish I saw Tim Lincecum there. :(
author: Rosanne L.

description: If you like beer pong and cheap rolling rock pitchers, this is your heaven.
author: Brian C.

description: What a nice little Saturday.  Bar None was full of bar games and young drunk people.  What more can you ask for on a Saturday afternoon?  Beer pong took up a large chunk of our time here, and the $10 pitchers of Rolling Rock kept us nice and inebriated. If you want a classy joint, go somewhere else.  If you want want fun, Bar None is your place!
author: Nick W.

description: Bar None is my kind of place in SF's sea of lounges. I felt at home in the sporty, casual bar with pool tables and beachy types. I would make this my spot in SF!
author: Victoria S.

description: This is the grossest bar I've ever been to in my life. Someone needs to call John Taffer and rescue this place.
author: C T.

description:
Are you a bro? Do you like to wear one polo shirt on top of another and pop both collars? Do you find yourself still wanting to play beer bong every night even though you graduated from college five years ago?

Are you a bop? Do you like it when sleezy guys hit on you just so you can feel good about yourself and brag to your friends later about all these guys that kept trying to buy you drinks?

Guess what, Marina kids, this is the bar of your dreams.

I don't know how many times some roided up jock tried to pick a fight with me or how many times some roofied up bimbo tried to get me to buy her a drink, but this is quite frankly the worst bar in all of San Francisco. Not that you should expect anything otherwise from this part of town, but sadly I have family that live in the Marina and they regularly insist on bringing me out with them to this bar. Oh the things you do for family ....
author: Anthony C.

description:
What's with all the one star reviews?? Please. 

Breakin' it down a little:

Beer selection - 4 stars
Beer Pong - 5 stars
Wine selection - 3 stars
Atmosphere - 5 stars (in class)
Bathrooms - 2 stars, but what the hell do you expect?? It's a bar.
Food - 3 stars, surprisingly good for pub food.

If you like a BAR this is the place. I had not ever played beer pong and went here with some friends for a going away thing last Tuesday. It was cool. I'm not a drinking game guy generally, but OK, it was fun. 

We got there about 6:00 and the tables were open. Two more groups showed at about 8:00 and they seemed like they could have been fairly regular. My wife and I bailed at 9:00 ish and it seemed like things were still getting warmed up. 

I can see where it might be a scene on a Friday.

We had wings, chips, quesadillas, and my wife had a burger. All good. In fact the wings were really good and the salsa was really good. 

I gave the beer selection 4 stars 'cause I did not see an IPA on tap. They did have Sierra Nevada Pale Ale, which I like alot too, so I was good. I think the beer pong would have been more fun had we chosen a better brew for that as well. 

Oh, they had FREE BEER from the time we got there at about 6:00 until 7:00. Not sure if that was happy hour or a holiday week thing or what. Who does that?? 

I'd go back again anytime.
author: John D.

description:
If you are NOT white, Stay away from this bar unless you want to be experience racism from White Patrons. What amazes me is that White women patrons, in particular think they can say whatever shit to people who are NOT white and get away with it.

Bar is OK, but the Patrons are NOT.
author: Dan D.

description:
Let's see.... what don't I like about this place....

Is it the girls that I am almost positive were shipped in from LA in their stilettos, leggings, and hot pink shirts? Or is it the guys with their popped collars and designer jeans? If you want a flash back to college or you just got out of college, then this may be the place for you. Is there anything I like about this place? The beer pong tables. If you go there for happy hour it is dead and you and your coworkers can enjoy a little beer pong. It is a shame because Bar None has a ton of space, flat screen TVs, dart boards, and cheap beer. I don't think that is enough to change my mind, unfortunately...
author: Jessica P.

description: It's a cute little bar, the outside reminds me of Alice in Wonderland's Red Queen/guards. The Bartender made fun of me for asking for club soda and juice after one drink, but I wasn't offended. It was  in a cute way.
author: Xuan C.

description:
I want to really like Bar None... I do.

Here is what you may encounter:

 A) too many frat-tastic marina guys B) it's too busy to get a drink or C) it's too empty to talk to anyone besides the bartenders (who are great!)

Where's the happy medium? I actually met someone I dated for a few months at Bar None, and now I understand why you don't decide to date someone you meet at Bar None.

They were also uneducated on Bartab. I met the Bartab peeps at Mas Sake's anniversary party this year, signed up, and have been a user... so imagine my surprise when they had NO idea what the Bartab feature was. Too bad... not sure where the lack of meeting of the minds happened, but either the Bartab people need to lay it out better, or the management isn't relaying the message to the staff. I lost 2 Bartab credits... (my friend and I sent each other drinks on a Friday) and were told we couldn't use it on a Friday. Fail... it's the principle!
author: Kristin F.

description:
Beer pong, sticky floors, and cheap drinks. Overall, Bar None is fun -- as long as you keep expectations low and remain tolerant of the frat party like atmosphere
.
author: Vanessa Y.

description:
This is a college aged bar which is fun for when you first get your ID. In fact, I didn't even like coming here when it was crowded, the most fun I ever had was on a Sunday night, a bunch of us drove out there and had the beer pong and other games to ourselves. 

On the weekend, its packed, not worth going to, and overrated - when you are in there by yourself - not bad.
author: Sam A.

description:
After cabbing it from dinner in Hayes Valley, my ladies and I ended up here in my pre-celebration of taking my NCLEX. We got here fairly early, and my first impression of the place was honkey tonk, let's blast Toby Keith from the jukebox all night long type of place. It was called Bar None after all. But such wasn't the case. 

They offered a pretty decent amount of taps, which I was satisfied. What beer I was drinking, I honestly couldn't tell you. Usually I refer to the website to refresh my memory, but unfortunately, their draft list isn't posted on the website. You'll have to ask one of my lady friends for what beers I drank. After the 5th pint, it gets a little fuzzy. Playing cricket (darts) was fun. Some dude came over to our table and gallantly invited us to play beer pong with them, but we respectfully declined. I can't imagine playing beer pong in a public place - picturing the little cup filled with the ping pong rinse water with floaties of Lord know what. It makes me hurl just thinking about it. And no offense dude, but we want to hang out with each other without inviting other dudes into the mix. And just when I was thinking that in my head, my friend recognizes one of my dude friends from across the room: "Hey...isn't that David?" And of course, I had to say hi. I know what you're thinking. I stayed true to my word about it being a ladies night.

I would come back again. Come early like we did because this place fills up fast, and I can tell it's a spot that you can only enjoy when there's elbow room left to spare.
author: Grace L.

description:
I haven't been to Bar None since I was 22 other than the rare occasion on which I'm forced to go because of a birthday or other group outing. I was forced to go there recently, and I remembered why I don't go there. It's an under-age type of crowd, it's douchey, and it kind of has a general funk to it. 

A few redeeming qualities from this visit though were several uninterrupted games of pool and a fun bachelor party that happened to be there. 

Unless you're under the age of 23, I recommended checking out a grown-up bar instead.
author: Megan S.

description:
2 words. Animal House.

the theme is frat house, and it achieves it perfectly. Wasted young men and women, beer pong tables, beer by the pitcher, smelly atmosphere and music. If you're with a bunch of dudes and your MO is to get as wasted as possible, 2 more words, BAR NONE.
author: Peter T.

description:
i love this place! went in here a few weeks ago with some friends that came up from fresno and had an absolutely lovely time!

we started off with a few appetizers and let me tell you, the tater tots are addicting the have reasonably priced pitchers that was good for 4 people.

after getting started decided it would be a fantastic idea to play some beer pong. i haven't played in a couple years so it was SO much fun being able to play again on some actual beer pong tables. 

after some beer pong we played some pool which is always a good time. 

all the while this is going on we have the giants game on several screen throughout the bar. i can't wait to come back to this place and have some more fun.
author: Andy S.

description:
Dear Hipsters: 

I am sorry that this bar is not the place for you and your circle of 8 close-knit "friends" to figure out which of the two people in your group they haven't slept with they are going to go after. I'd say go after the one in the plad print, but that would describe everyone in your group.

I understand that the music here may actually be known by more than three people on this planet earth and that none of it could be described as "ironic". And so I apologize.

However, as you enjoy complaining, Bar None will provide plenty to complain about. You can complain about the girls that are dressed better than you, the guys that are more fun and outgoing, or the fact that there is beer pong here rather than emo poetry readings and hacky sacks.

As for me, I prefer to gather up my broskis and have Heinekens and Jagerbombs all night!

XOXOXOXO
-David H.
author: David H.

description:
Something about the marina attracts the douchebag crowd, must be the smell of richer neighborhoods and the bourgeois atmosphere.

So where Gravity attracts the Ed Hardy crowd, Bar None attracts the same crowd that goes over to the east/west bar in the other end of the Marina.  This crowd that I am talking about is the group that probably just graduated from their undergrad and still think that they are in college and come from privileged families and should all be on that VH1 show "You're Cut Off!" or "Tool Academy"

Anyway, this place has a huge bar, but i dont think they pour well either.  It's got three beer pong tables in the back, but good luck getting a game in if there is a lot of people around, which is normally how its like.  Pretty intolerant crowd too since they were baggin' on of our friend's in our group.
author: Mark L.

description: This place is awesome.  The bartender is the nicest guy around and if you are not a drunk bitch, he will make sure you are all set and comfortable. He came up to us and asked what game we wanted to watch since we were from out of town. Definitely a great place to hang out.
author: Kristin M.

description:
A list of key questions to ask yourself:

- Do you ever find yourself wishing you could be in the movie Old School?

- Do you yearn to relive the douchiest frat parties of college?

- Are you a girl who likes getting hit on by bros with popped collars who purposely flaunt their aviators inside a dark room, or a guy who aspires to be like the aforementioned description?

- Do you like feeling the haze of dank bar sweat and self-satisfaction stick to your skin beneath your Lacoste polo?

- Have you wanted to test the limits of your immune system by playing Beer Pong in a bar where balls don't discriminate on which surfaces they touch (double meaning intended)?

If you've answered "yes" to at least any of these questions, then this would be a good bar for you.

The only reason I gave it that extra star is that occasionally, when you...or "your friend"...have been drinking for hours in costume, you may be able to get duped into coming here, especially with aroma of Extreme Pizza next door, like sirens beckoning the drunk masses.
author: Alice C.

description:
Bar None has it's good points and it's bad points, but I think a lot of people are too eager to hate on Bar None as a way of proving to other people that they're grownups now.  I'm no longer in college, and I play a lot fewer drinking games now than I did then, but I didn't stop having fun playing beer pong and start exclusively frequenting wine bars the moment I put on my cap and gown.  It's fun.  Get over it.  

Bar None is a place with a niche, not someplace I go to regularly, but every now and then with the right company it can be a lot of fun.
author: Andy B.

description:
Been here twice and have two opposite experiences-
1-For a friends 21st birthday and we had a blast! Playing beer pong, dancing, and had cheap ($2 shots) as a special they were doing that night.
2-Was promoting a movie and basically got told to fuck off by the ex sorority and fraternity 30 year olds that are too good to talk to me. Only one of the six stalls in the ladies bathroom was working the entire night (from 4pm to 2am); 2 were exploding in diarrhea, 2 had broken seats and one had no seat once so ever. 
Overall I probably won't go back there again.
author: Sierra B.

description:
Stop hating. You all know why you go there and you love it.

I have never had a bad time there. 

Ask the bartender to battle you with jaeger shots and let the good times roll.
author: Roxanna A.

description:
I love to hate this bar.  Truth be told, I have spent quite a few nights drunkenly tripping up and down its stairs...perhaps engaging in one or two games of beer pong.  Ah, my glorious youth.  It's really easy to hate on the Marina so let me try and figure out why I don't detest this place:

1)  Friendly bouncers.  
2)  Outdoor smoking area - great for people-watching.
3)  Moderately priced drinks.
4)  They take their beer pong very, very seriously.
5)  uh...better music than Matrix Fillmore?

I think it's an experience.  Would I go back?  Eh, probably not.

Oh and I'd like to add that more than one of my hipster friends have gone there...willingly...on multiple occasions!
author: Helen F.

description:
I would like this place if they had a better set up for their beer pong.

The beer pong area is somewhat grimey and felt like I was inside someones garage with a few tables that you can buy from Costco.

Also, we were lucky because we got there a little bit before 10 or else we would have never been able to get a table since there's only four.
author: Mimi P.

description:
AW YEAH AW YEAHHH YEAH! BAR NONE..... I go there allllll the time when the bathroom at the superior BLUE LIGHT (directly across the street) is packed.......  

THANK YOU for having more than 1 stall. In all seriousness I've had some good times here playing a massive game of "flippy" cup (as the drunk Irish guy called it) on the beer pong tables. This place is fun when you're delving into the bar scene for the first time...so young, so naive. But you'll soon see that there are bigger and better things out there. No hard feelings Bar None! You were good for 2 hot, very short seconds. Moving on.......

I'd check it out if you've never been. But I'd be a little embarrassed to call myself a regular here.
author: Denise L.

description: $10 for $20 of drinks?? $2 coronas (meaning $1)?! It was insanely fun with both beer pong and flipcup, which as you may or may not know, is illegal to play in bars in Vancouver, British Columbia. This is the second time I've been here and both times the "usual Marina clientele" have been incredibly friendly (perhaps it's because we're Canadian and we're just so nice in general ;)). Every time I come to San Fran I make sure that I visit this awesome bar.
author: Eric C.

description: One more star for an empty Bar None the day before Thanksigiving! We had a huge reunion at this bar, my friends from So-Cal, college, highschool kids, and old roommates reunited here. It was a great night to catch up with these kids. I still wouldn't come here on a regular night. We just got lucky because we had the bar and the pool table all to ourselves that night.
author: Jojo N.

description:
The first time I went to Bar None it was with my college for our weekly senior pub nights.  I had a great time.  Beer pong is a classic.

The second time wasn't as fun probably because I wasn't drunk enough and I had outgrown the whole frat party scene.  If I go here again, I'll make sure to have a few more drinks so the pushy frat guys and gals don't get on my nerves.
author: Karen N.

description:
Great place if you miss the frat/college days.. If you miss beer pong, flip cup, and dirtiness... GO HERE!!!  They have multiple tables in the back where you can play with your friends.  They have juke box that you can stick a few dollars in to get a few decent songs on while you're there.  

But... if you DON'T miss that type of environment and rowdy crowd.. then this isnt the place for you.  Dont get me wrong.. I love flip cup and beer pong.. but more for a summer bbq at my house and not so much for a bar experience.  I think I'll pass on this place for any future visits.
author: Vicky T.

description:
If I'm going to the Marina something went horribly wrong, so please send help to either Bar None or Circa, which are the only two places where you'll find me in this neighborhood.

The beer pong is a good diversion and the bar is passable. Plus they let my friend in wearing Under Armour and basketball shorts. Probably thought he was some sort of elite Bar Method instructor.
author: Leo K.

description:
Was at the Blue Light on Saturday night, around midnight and the scene was dead.  But just across the street, there's Bar None.

Friends went over and we figured we'd play a little beer pong.  This bar was packed, lots of hot girls, but this place was pretty disgusting.  Beer all over the floor, piss all over the floor in the bathroom... truly reminds me of my college days. But then again, I haven't played beer pong since college too.

Overall, pretty interesting crowd, but a disgusting joint.
author: Todd M.

description:
it was a very confusing night. i came here with friends for a field trip. it never came across my mind to go out in the marina at all. but here we came.
the crowd is your usual marina clientele. don't let me describe it. 
beer pong tables are in the back for your enjoyment. those girls put on pretty good music on the jukebox. 
but yeah... not really my kind of scene. and there's no pleasant surprise.
author: Te R.

description:
I'm not a beer person due to a wheat allergy (lame I know) so I'm not going to comment on the beer, or whether or not it's good.  The beer is probably fine.  Generally this is a good place.  Only complaints:

1.) bathrooms are disgusting and often don't have toilet paper.  I once had to wipe myself with a napkin.  

2.) People there are generally abhorrent.  

Don't get me wrong, I love to party and I even love the marina, but guys here are pretty damn awful.  And the girls basically do nothing but squeal and pretend to love whiskey and beer and football, saying they're "not like most girls" so guys will like them more.  (Okay. Not all of the girls there, but it's an annoying group).

Example of a bad person I met at this bar: a guy came up to me, hit on me and I said I was with my boyfriend who was on the other side of the bar.  Later that same guy came up to me and spoke to me even after I pointed out that my boyfriend was only feet away.  Even then, he continued to talk about how my boyfriend was a "bad guy" for playing beer pong and "neglecting" me.  Dude, I was doing my own thing!  I don't drink beer!  GO away!
author: Alexandra B.

description:
There was a time when I might have given Bar None a higher rating; let's call it my fresh-out-of-college-newly-living-on-my-own-phase. I was living in Lower Pac Heights at the time and Union Street was THE "it" place to party. I loved the beer pong, adored the cheap beer, lusted after the young pink popped collars, and finished my nights with a slice of Extreme Pizza. 

Four years later, I cringe as I walk by and literally would need to be clubbed and dragged by the hair in order to get me to enter. Last Friday night was a going away party for my friend's boyfriend. When the word was spread that Bar None was the watering hole of choice (and after I threw up in my mouth just a little bit), I tried to convince myself that maybe it wouldn't be so bad. 

Unfortunately this was not the case and have come to the conclusion that I am just too old for this sh*t. Case in point: I'm getting a beer at the bar with a friend. As I turn around my elbow barely comes in to contact with a girl (couldn't have been older than 22), which btw, I didn't even feel. All of the sudden I hear a voice behind me:

Catty Bitch-Face: "Umm, you need to watch where you're throwing your elbows around!!"

Me: ::Oh hell no, hair flipping:: "Excuse me? This is a bar sweetheart, if you can't deal with somebody brushing up against you, you shouldn't be here."

Catty Bitch-Face:  "Just watch yourself! Watch your f*cking elbows."

Me: I barely touched you.  Calm your sh*t down.

Catty Bitch-Face: "Whatever bitch."

Me: "I'm too old for this."
author: Julia N.

description: If I could describe this place in one word it woud be BARF.  We walked down into this place to have a drink since we needed to pass some time before dinner and the smell damn near made us puke.  My bf and I looked at each other and went "EEEWWWWW!"  There was a girl, drunk as hell screaming at the top of her lungs on her way out as she passed us.  Hmmm, the happy drunk was a big clue of what type of dive bar we were about to get a whif of!  Don't get me wrong, I love dive bars but this one is not for me!  Perhaps I'd of gone in a place like this back in the day of bar-hopping while loaded but I've grown up and was so happy to find the bar inside of Osha across the street - ahhhhh!
author: Ruthie V.

description:
Updated as of 11/18/05

Okay, I've gone to Bar None for the last time.  I admit it, shamefully, I did like this place.  Sort of an LA crowd, good energy, lots of people. 

But seriously.  They let in too many people and have too few bartenders.  I mean, I was a bartender in LA, and I know how hard it is to keep up with the demand, but if I ever tried to get away with the 3/4 oz shots these gals were pushing, someone probably would have kicked my ass.

Also, someone needs to teach them the difference between drinks that are described as "shots" but poured into 3/4 ounce glasses and the 1 1/2 ounce straight shot of liquor.  Not worth the money, or the stress (or the dry cleaning bill from the drink spilled on you after two former frat guys get into it over who's got the better stripped shirt and diesel jean pairing.)
author: Mike V.

description:
I gotta say - after reading the reviews... its funny how negative people say aobut the place, but continue ot go there
Its a college atmosphere bar, that has beer pong in the back - regularly priced beer, and ping pong balls @ $.25 a ball, just in case your drunk friend steps on one or breaks it 
all and all --- you go there to hang w/ your college buddies, and reminice the old days
nothing more, nothing less......
author: Ken T.

description:
If you're looking to play a little beer pong at the crappiest frat house style bar in the Marina, then Bar None might be for you.

If you're looking for the type of classy place that seems to encourage peeing on the floor of the restrooms, then Bar None might be for you.

If you are looking for cheap and poor tasting beer served at a higher than market average price, this is the place - Bar None.
author: Peter M.

description:
This place reminded me of college, but not really in a good way.

The night my friends and I were there, it was "Kickball night" and there were tons of people drinking up and getting ready to play.  It was fun watching people walk around in sweatbands and a pint, but that didn't hold for long.

There are beer pong tables in the back room, and a lot of space to mingle on wooden floors.  This place doesn't serve many cocktails, but beers and whiskeys flow like rivers.  There are a lot of neon beer signs, sticky wooden tables, and a freakin load of noise!  

At one point,I was feeling a bit nostalgic for college.  I was remembering what it was like to be 21 and eager to down a beer-- but I snapped out of it when I heard a bunch of men whoop loudly before tapping a beer bong.  

I don't think I'll come back here, mainly because it's not my kind of bar (anymore).  However I will recommend this place if the group I'm with wants to play beer pong.
author: Marissa N.

description: This is probably my favorite bar on Union St. I always go here with my boys over the weekends and find it easy to leaving knowing I had a great time.
author: Allen G.

description: You gotta be pretty far into your night before you stop in here bc the douche factor is pretty high.  But I like that they have beer pong.
author: David P.

description:
So, I was scared. Especially after a quick glance at the reviews. But some folks were meeting up here and I didn't want to be a drag. 

The fact that I went there at midnight on a Wednesday probably helped. But it wasn't complete torture. I actually had fun. Would I go here on a weekend? No way. But late on a school night could be doable again.

The bouncer out front was friendly. The bathroom... well yeah, I've been in better. A lot better. Paper towels would have been nice. And hot water isn't asking too much, is it? But it certainly wasn't OMG-I-will-hold-it-until-I-get-home bad.

There were a lot of people out front when we got there, so I was worried the whole place would be packed. (I'm not a Marina girl, much less a packed-bar-in-the-Marina girl.) Fortunately they were just smoking; the inside wasn't so packed.

So... beer pong. Never actually played before. Yes, I went to college. Somehow that experience alluded me. So this was fun. Disgusting (when you think about the ball bouncing over and in god-knows-what on the floor and ending up in the cup of beer that you have to drink)  but fun. 

The pool table... um, sucked. In a so-bad-it's-(almost)-good kind of way.   Lovely faded white felt with a huge COORS LIGHT logo on it, one (!) cue, no chalk, and an incomplete set of balls. First game there was no 8 ball, an uneven number of stripes and solids (we improvised -- see picture) and an extra cue ball. (Cue ball became the 8 ball thanks to a little help from Mr. Pen.) Next game there were magically two 2 balls, one of which served as (again, with a little help) as the 8 ball. 

The jukebox... didn't actually use. But from what I could tell, towards the end of the night, the only artist you were allowed to play--despite the fact that it was an internet jukebox--was Tom Petty. Not that I'm complaining. But I heard a LOT of Petty. And every song was followed by an excited blonde girl screaming "oh!!! this is my song!!!"

Okay, that's enough...
author: Tara B.

description: The bar tenders here are super friendly! The drinks were strong but not overpowering, and I hear they have beer pong. Will be back to check out the beer pong...
author: Stephanie T.

description: As a huge beer pong aficionado, I love to come here to get my game on. A lot of cute girls come here, and the drinks arent too expensive. There are lot of d-bags that frequent the place, and the music is pretty bad too. I would recommend this place if you like to play beer pong and you want to be come to place with a lot of hot girls.
author: Jayrod L.

description: Any bar with Guinness and Darts (www.sfda.org) gets four stars from me.  I was there on a relatively quiet night.  Food was decent and I like the low ceilings.
author: Jersey M.

description:
Minus the douchebags and post college meatballs, Bar None ain't half bad. It's got a long bar, plenty of seating, beer pong (although not regulation tables), and some decent enough bartenders (not quite "mixologists" but still capable of their trade). 

My advice is go here during the early evening -- you just might have an ok time -- in fact, if you get drunk enough like I did there last night, you could actually become a douchebag yourself!
author: Nish N.

description: I give this establishment one star for 2 major reasons  #1 - this place is not wheelchair accessible. the bar claims that they normally are wheelchair accessible: #2 when we tried to addressed it, management was insensitive and almost had a attitude of, "well, tell your friend to get up and walk down the stairs." LAME!! The security guy also began taking pictures of us and when we addressed it with management, he made up some story about the guy taking pictures of  the layout of the bar.  I might have believed this if he had been walking around the bar taking pictures of everything but he stared straight at us in a creepy way off and on for at least a half hour and snuck pictures of us.  We decided to start taking pictures of him and almost got kicked  - WTF? Last but not least, their TVs are crappy for watching football.  AVOID THIS PLACE.  I actually wish I could take stars away.
author: kara c.

description:
This place gets a worse rep then I think it deserves. Is it kind of a post graduate crowd? Yes but its no worse then a Hipster hang out in the mission. Smells a lot better that's for sure. Here's what I base all my bar reviews on, if it is a fun and cheap place to get drunk at. I am a drinker, I don't go out to try out the new specialty cocktails or whatever "Hip" thing there is. I go out to drink and drinking is the only thing that matters.

Its got some of the cheapest beer in the city which is why I give it 3 stars. 10 dollar bud light pitchers. Straight shots of Southern Comfort were a little pricey for me but I've been living in Texas and everything is sooooo much cheaper there. 

So 3 stars for cheap bear, no stars for pricey shots, and 1 star for not a bad place to go on a weekday night.
author: Patrick H.

description: Home of the best bartender in the City (Matty), bouncer (Taua), flip cup battles and the celebration of yours truly watching the Giants World Series Game 5 win.  2.5 stars is not cool for this "fine establishment".  Yes it can be douchey but so are many other spots in the Marina.  If you don't like it, go to the Mission.  I do avoid this place on a late Friday/Saturday nights but weekday nights and weekend days it can be fun and not packed wall to wall.  Throw in darts and pool and I guess beer pong and find another bar that does the same.  Extra awesome when you can take over the juke box with a side of tater tots.
author: Abhay M.

description:
I hate this place!

I really do almost with a passion. It's probably, cuz  am not the typical Marina crowed anyway and I ended up at this bar by default, but wow. This bar is like being at a bad frat party in some little city where this is the only kind of entertainment they get. If you like to get hit on by drunk frat-likeboys this is your place. If you don't like it... then don't go. The bar has pool tables, beer pong and all this kind of stuff and does get really packed on the weekends (what's wrong with society?), but to me it's like being in hell. 

If you're not the frat/sororoity type and find drunk people screaming, falling and crawling all over annoying and disturbing, stay away!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
This place is awful! It's a place that preppy frat boys and sorority girls like to hang out at. There are a few douchey hipster types that hang out here as well. This was one of the stops for the DYL Marina Bar Crawl-D-Bag event. Most of the people in our group ended up playing beer pong. If you like beer pong and shooting darts and hanging out with scummy people, this is your kind of place! 

There is a full bar here with overpriced drinks. I got a Long Island iced tea for $10.00. The bartender looked like a douche and wasn't friendly at all. He had a lot of tattoos, the spiked hair, and bad tattoos on his arms. I would stay clear of this place though as one guy in our group got attacked by some douchebag who got mad at him for something stupid. The fight occurred outside. I didn't see it, but I heard that security did very little about it. To my surprise, no one called the cops. This place is where troublemakers apparently like to hang out.
author: Butterfly A.

description:
If you're still 22 years old and you and your frat-bros are looking for a place away from home to go play beer pong, get s#!t-faced on Bud Light, maybe get in a fight and try to impress the marina ladies...then by all means, go to Bar None and enjoy yourself.

In a way, I'm glad this place exists...this way I know where all of the douchebags will be, so I can make sure I'm somewhere different.
author: Devin G.
