description: All these reviews talk about how Bar None is like a total college bar.  I disagree...this isn't even a college bar...this is like one of those college frat house basement parties.  With the sticky floors, the beer pong and darts going on in the back, and the fact that you have to go down some stairs to get in, they aren't too far off.  All that's missing are the paddles on the walls and the coolers of Jungle Juice.
author: Mike L.

description:
I never cease to be amazed at the bitchiness of some people on YELP.
I read one review complaining about the bar and staff after his group had an altercation with another group, even though the manager sided with HIS group. What? The staff sided with you...but you want to flame them? That tells me what I need to know about him/her. 
There are several posts from people that love to play beer pong...but hate other ppl that play beer pong. My suggestion to those ppl? Stay home. 
To the person that complained "...it's always either too empty or too crowded." Are you freakin' kidding me? That one doesn't even make sense. 
"It's too loud...on a Friday night" *sigh* it's.too.loud....on.Friday.night. Stay home and read a book. 
I know some of you like to flame people/places for the hell of it, or rag a place to be funny and that's your right as an American but at least include an actual (and honest) review. 
I was staying with a friend that lived relatively nearby and we stopped in on successive nights. I'm a little older than the target demographic, but I had a really good time both nights. 
Granted, as the evenings progressed, it got more crowded. That's the way it works at pretty much every bar I've ever been too. 
I didn't actually play beer pong. It's not my thing. I watched several games each night, however.  There were some nice people, there were some that were a little annoying. There were a few people that got sloppy late in the evening, but the one's that stepped over the line were dealt with pretty quickly, I thought.
The drinks, were more than fair, as were the prices. The staff was friendly to everyone, save a few douchey kids that started trouble then tried "it wasn't me", "do you know who my father is" and "you can't do that to me/kick me out/deny me entry,,,I know the law". I was actually hoping the staff would throw a couple of them a proper beating, but I was disappointed. 
The bottom line is, this place is what it is. Is it spotless? No. Is it a fancy or "nice" place? No.  Is it fun, absolutely.  Is the staff friendly? Yes, to me & everyone that I saw that wasn't being a jerk. Are the prices reasonable and the drinks stiff? Hell yes to both. 
I probably wouldn't be a regular, since I'm too old to get that drunk too often, but I would absolutely return for a great time. If you like to have a flat out good time, aren't pretentious and like to play or watch bar games, Bar None IS the place you want to be in San Francisco.
author: Matty M.

description:
I was sort of drunk already when I showed up here this weekend, and I was here in the middle of the day, so I imagine my experience isn't the "typical" Bar None experience. 

I thought it was A-Ok, but I wanted to see what others said who were here on a more normal night, so I started reading the other reviews, which provided me about 10 minutes of entertainment. I noticed - all the people who LOVE Bar None also mentioned that they love "simple America" "popped collars" "frat boys" "jager bombs" and assumed anyone who didn't love Bar None was an "emo hipster" or "jealous that everyone having fun was hotter than them." People who DIDN'T like Bar None seemed like educated, nice, normal people who don't like racists, drinks spilled on their clothes, and drunk guys starting a fight. 

So . . .  all I have to say is, I am glad I WASN'T here on a normal night. I thought, when it was mostly empty, that Bar None was a decent bar. Big space, cheap enough drinks for the Marina, somewhat inattentive bar tenders (but in all fairness my boobs weren't out.) My girlfriend and I did fall for the "Hey it's my birthday can you buy me a drink" prank (while the guy's lady friends laughed at us from a table behind us) so, maybe that's a preview of what it's like at night. And I don't think I am particularly hideous/emo.

I don't go out in the Marina much so maybe it's par for the course but  all I can say is it sucks when a good seeming bar has sh*tty clientèle.
author: Alex G.

description:
Bar None is where you go to play some beer pong, drink with friends, and re-live some of your college memories.

BN is dirty, has terrible bathrooms, smells gross, and generally attracts the 21-24 crowd that is still trying to pretend college isn't over.  It's a Union St. landmark and I suspect it will be around for quite some time, but know what you're getting yourself in to before you head here.

Don't set your expectations too high and you will not be too dissapointed.

Just drink some bud light, hit on girls that are way too young for you, and eat some tater-tots... all will be well.
author: Chris R.

description:
I am shocked to see that this place doesn't have all good reviews. I guess it is because as much as I love San Francisco, bar none does not have the typical San Franciscan. 

It definitely has much more of the frat boy from state school alumni vibe, which I totally love. While I also enjoy going to laid back hipster type bars, I also am an all American girl who enjoys simple American beer, darts, sports, and hot guys who probably have several old photos where there pink polo collars are popped! They have tons of TVs, tons of great games to keep you occupied, and if that isn't enough there is plenty of eye candy for both guys and girls! 

This is the kind of place that you can relax during the afternoon and watch whatever sport you like and then stick around until the late night crowd shows up and have a great night!
author: M M.

description: Randomly went into this place since it reminded me of a bar I go to back home.  Wednesday had 2 for 1 on a certain beer and it ended up being like $4.  I liked that they had multiple tvs and they have NFL Sunday Ticket.  The bartender said that it doesn't get crazy crowded on Sundays so I guess I'll have to make my way there for football one Sunday.
author: Grace P.

description:
This place is exactly the same in SF and NYC. I know that the NYC location is a hangout for underage NYU students, but I still love it. 

The SF location is a fratty bar with beer pong, check beer and plenty of space to have a good time. I would definitly hang out here, if I lived closer. 

Recommended for bringing friends from NYC.
author: Ryan B.

description:
I love the pitchers of beer and the fact that there's beer pong and flip cup, but with that said, this whole scene can get tired pretty quickly. But if you want to relive your college days, here ya go. It does get a little rowdy at times - very reminiscent of a frat party - but other than that its a good time. 

I mean I'm not going to lie, I've had some pretty good times here and made tons of memories, maybe 2 out of the 545 times I've been here it has been a slow night. The only reason I go here is because the drinks are cheap, the juke box has some good music, and I won't get shot, but other than those three reasons, there are definitely other BETTER bars to go to.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Wow, this place has *terrible* reviews! I gotta give them a little love though, because I had a blast here. Yes, it feels (and resembles) a frat party in probably more ways than it should. But they have beer pong. It just makes me think of dumb and dumber... 

[after Lloyd trades the van in for a moped]
Harry: Just when I thought you couldn't get any dumber, you go and do something like this... and totally redeem yourself!

That's sort of how I feel about this bar. It is frat-tacular in basically every way, right down to having some of the most disgusting bathrooms you could possibly imagine. Seriously, the entire floor was just a lake of urine. Gross. But beer pong is the moped that this bar got in exchange for the shaggin' wagon - it totally redeems it, but it's still a terrible deal.
author: Ben Y.

description: $3 for well drinks during happy hour - never have I ever bought a round for so many people for so little money!! Also the first time that I've seen lemonade as an option in the soda gun! There are also both pool tables and long tables for beer pong/flip cup.
author: Melody L.

description:
I don't hang out in the Marina EVER. Just wanted to say that first before I started my review.

As mentioned in my Matrix Fillmore review....last weekend went to Boboquivari's for a birthday dinner and decided to hang out in the Marina after just for shits and giggles. We started off at Matrix Fillmore...tolerated that for about 30 minutes then left and went to this place, Bar None. 

It's a bar. Plain and simple. We must have came on an off night because it was not busy at all. Lots of open space and plenty of tables in the back to chill out at. Apparently they used to have a beer pong table but they took it down so the room in the back is just an empty room. I wonder if that's the reason it wasn't busy in there. But anyways. We sit in the back by the pool table. We order up some beers. $4. Sweet. Now these are my types of prices. The bar is huge. Lots of stupid games one could play - darts, pool, video games...to keep you busy. 

We actually meet these Marina people and they invite us to play drinking games with them. We do and they're actually cool people. I mean I don't want to pigeon hole everybody that lives in the Marina as not being cool but these people were really cool. They bought all the beer and we played drinking games the rest of the night. Good times.

Will I ever come back to Bar None to party it up? Most likely not but I won't rule it out.
author: David C.

description: One time I came by on a Saturday, you wouldn't let me play darts because I would be throwing them over the make-your-own-Bloody Mary bar. The next time I came on a Saturday, the make-your-own bar was gone and the Bloody Mary you made me was just not any good. I just can't win here on the weekends and guess I should really stick to Wednesday nights after kickball!
author: Meghan P.

description:
I told myself I would never go in this bar.  I was dragged in here against my will.  I used the disgusting women's restroom with a missing door, clogged toilets and a brown lake of goo in the sink.  I stared at the girls wearing tank tops and mini skirts when it is 45 degrees outside.  I shuddered when I saw the ghetto-fied dudes talking to these dim witted scantily clad cheap looking fakies.  I left out of pure disgust.  I just ate dinner and it was ready to make an exit out of my mouth.  

BAR NONE makes me wanna BARF ONE!
author: Christina S.

description: I have a soft spot in my heart for Bar None - it lets me relive the glory days of college. Who doesn't love that?!? I found that my favorite time to go is during the off hours...ya know, like on a sunday after a mimosa brunch and you still want to keep drinking, or when on Wednesday nights, just cause you're bored after work. You can play beerpong, flip cup, darts, and pool. And the best thing is, if you're short on teammates, it's never too difficult to get others to join you! It may not be the classiest establishment, but if you're down for drinking games and a good time, it's a pretty awesome place to be.
author: Michelle P.

description:
I'm writing this review completely Sober, which probably explains the low rating.  

For the most part, I don't like this place.  Over crowded with marina douchebags and college frat guys who think they're cool for getting off campus, the place reeks of prepubescent machismo.  Keep in mind I was IN a frat, and still can't stand the place.

that being said, it's a GREAT place to go if you're completely blacked out.  Suddenly everyone is smiling, you feel at home with the other drunk assholes, and somehow your witty pick-up line of  "you look fat in that dress" manages to work on every girl you see.

All in all a great place to show up at 1am when things have gone from grey to black.  Other than that? Stay away...
author: Joseph F.

description:
Come on people, seriously? You're going to to give a place a bad review for being exactly what it's supposed to be? If you don't like beer pong, if you don't like bleach blonde hair, if you don't like huge tools who spent more time on their hair than the girl they're with...OF COURSE you're going to hate this place.

But when you feel like getting rowdy, or an afternoon of beer pong, you can always count on Bar None to deliver. The bar is large and generally well staffed. Additionally they also have pool, darts, and some other shooting game to occupy your time between trips to the bar. The bathrooms don't ever seem to be clean, but, then again, it is a bar. The best time to go is definitely late afternoon, you and your group will have the bar to yourselves (and the bartender) as well as control of the juke box.

In conclusion, simple solution: if you know it's not your scene, DON'T GO. As such, I haven't been in a while, but I definitely know at one point [Jill and] I will be back down those stairs and ready to challenge douchey strangers to a game of beer pong.
author: Rachael W.

description:
Although I would probably never come here on my own accord, I was visiting San Francisco and happened to be out that night with fellow rock star yelpers Anna K and Keith F, who took me here to play some beer pong. The events that transpired that night went as follows:

Pregamed with my buddy Keith F. Headed over to Anna K's place. Had some delicious cake. Thanked Anna K for it. Drank some more at Anna's place. Made friends. Took to the streets. Walked to Bar None. Scoped the place out. Agreed with my buddies that it was incredibly frat-tastic. Popped my collar. Laughed out loud. Put my collar back like a normal human being ten seconds later. Went to the bar for some pitchers of beer. Paid surprisingly little for it. Headed over to the beer pong area.

Took over the beer pong table. Paired up with Anna. Dominated. Had new challengers/fratty d-bags get some new pitchers. Drank with the fratty d-bags. Kicked their ass in beer pong. Did it again against new challengers. Decided we should stop playing because Anna had to be at work the next morning. Laughed at Anna. Kept drinking. Picked my hottie kickass partner up several times to celebrate our 3-0 winning streak. Put her down several minutes later.

Went over to see how Keith was doing. Saw him spitting game. Laughed and drank some more. Watched said couple play Big Buck Hunter. Internally thanked Bar None for having Big Buck Hunter in the bar. Became intensely jealous of Keith for playing Big Buck Hunter while I had to watch. Got over it ten seconds later. Finished my beer. Looked around and became extremely bored. Drank some more.

Woke up on a girl's couch the next morning. Woke Keith up because he was there too. Found his car. Went home. Exchanged stories. Laughed some more.

The End. What can I say about Bar None? Well, at least I got a good story out of it.
author: Pete V.

description:
When I grow nostalgic for my college life, and the frat boy existence, I head to Bar None. Like many other reviews, this place is a frat party, sadly without the costumes, but with all the beer and "frat" minded people you can find in the city. 
I don't know of anywhere else you can play beer pong at a bar, so for that, 3 stars. They also have pool, but really, when faced with a college game of beer pong, and pool....obviously my frat loving self will chose beer pong. I have been here on nights where beer pong tournaments are taking place, and graduated frat boys are living out all their dreams, and all it took was beer and ping pong table....to the owners of Bar None, you must be ex frat boys, this idea was genius.
Don't go here if you are looking for a classy bar, go here to relive your college life, and enjoy it for what it is.
author: Bianca L.

description: Went three nights in a row while in town.  Each night we went in fairly early for late afternoon beers/baseball/football.  Staff was very nice to us esp Matt.  We were close to being the oldest ones in there each night.  Our last night there, a Friday, we were noticing that more and more large guys were showing up to work - and thought "I think this place is about to get nuts"  And we were correct.  A younger crowd came in and the place was packed.
author: Carolyn A.

description:
I've lived in SF now for about a month and been to Bar None 3 times. Each time I've had a ton of fun and met really cool people. 

The first time I met up with a group of probably 40 people and it was amazing! There are so many different areas to hang out in. They have 3 beer pong tables, a hallway of bathrooms, a really long bar which makes it easy to get drinks, a corner area that's pretty large for hanging out, and an outside area for smokers. There are plenty of attractive young men here too, which I like in a bar. 

The other times I went with a smaller group of friends but still had a great time and was actually cut off which I really appreciate because I was hungover for 3 days after that. I'll definitely be coming back (and drinking a lot less before I go). Good looking out Bar None.
author: Victoria A.

description:
It wasn't that bad! I went last Friday and I was the DD. You can imagine how much I was dreading going to this place, especially after reading the not-so-flattering reviews. However I was pleasantly surprised. 

My girlfriends liked the drinks and the deals. It did have that frat party vibe and we definitely felt eyes on us at times, but what can you say? We're pretty girls. The guys we did chat with were from Sacramento and pretty polite. One had a pink shirt. We laughed.

The bartenders were quick and friendly. My virgin Red Bull was $5 while my girlfriends' mixed drink was $3 before 9 or 10. Parking was a breeze. I pulled up right around the corner in a perfect spot. 

As the night got later, the alcohol was flowing, the music was loud and the voices were louder. I don't know what it is about this place but I saw at lease 4-5 people drop their drinks within the few hours I was there. The floor was pretty wet but whatever. It's a bar. And it wasn't THAT bad. I actually would like to come back and play a game of pool or darts. Next time I'd like to be wasted-faced though so I could really enjoy the scene.
author: Robin M.

description:
"Dude, let's get some jager bombs and then go play another game of Beirut. What? You call it beer pong? Dude, that's so lame. See that chick over there? Yeah, I banged her last week. Yeah, total butterface, but she let me get all three inputs! Ha, I puked the next day just thinking about it. Know a good doctor where I can get these genital warts of mine burned off? One of the dirty sluts I've been banging every time I'm not too drunk to get it up must have given them to me. Why those bitches gotta be so slutty? Yeah, all my frat boys and I used to make fun of all them after we slept with them. Dude, you should totally pop your collar. Yeah, man, chicks dig that shit. I got some GHB, if I find a girl hot enough in here, I'm gonna slip it in her drink."

The jukebox is decent, but you probably won't stick around long enough to discover it.
author: Suge K.

description:
If you ever doubt that I'm a self-flagellating masochist who does some really fucking unhealthy things on occasion, please remember that I had a beer at Bar None once.

To say I'd rather have Mike Tyson punch me repeatedly in the balls or pole my barge down the Love Canal at Neverland Ranch than visit Bar None again would be totally unfair. To the two Mikes.

I'll be diplomatic and say that I should have been a teen coed in a cloud of J.Lo Glow with a fake tan, streaked hair, big tits, and a tight Hollister shirt who aspired to star in Girls Gone Wild - The Cherry Picking Edition and answers to "Cassie" or "Hey you" or perhaps "Statutory Ho" so I could fully appreciate this shithole.

Even my masochism has limits.
author: d s.

description:
OK you sexy Cougars...can we say FRAT PARTY??

ha ha yes...Bar None screams nothing but COLLEGE..don't get me wrong, I'm still young and still in college, but after going to several other places, this isn't what i was looking for. Too Crowded at times, and the guys here..Um....are...umm....well I'm speechless...

I usually come here after i get sick of Blue Light, and every single time i meet  at least one slime ball who "makes a ton of money"...but their fake Armani suit didn't fool me...i can see right through that nasty blazer and wrinkled stripped shirt....c'mon now boys..get some style!!I'm sick of the stripped shirt jeans look...spice it up a little...KEEP IT SEXY!!!

Otherwise, drinks are so so..nothing too special..but my friends seem to like this place...No clue why....
author: Jarren A.

description:
Until recently, Bar None topped my list of "Places I would rather chew glass than go to" (if that's even proper English).  Club NV and Shitty Tavern followed closely at its heels. 

Bar None smells of skunked keg and raging hormones.  The female patrons are ready to greet the city of San Francisco with open legs.  If you are on a mission to get laid and have reached the point of last resort, feel free to drop in and pick up a one night stand.  Also, I am constantly accosted about my ID, even though kids I used to babysit for are in here on a regular basis.  

My seething hate for this bar has ebbed.   Bar None sponsors my Wednesday Night kickball team and I cannot detest the place that brings so much happiness to my hump days.  We all would rather be someplace else, but we're hating it TOGETHER.  As one.  It's a necessary evil.  I cannot bite the hand that feeds me.
author: Kerry D.

description:
Haha, love the reviews and i will have to concur... came here because it was a San Francisco State Study Abroad Pint Night, so I had lots of friends going but in general I don't hit up the Marina often. 

My first impression upon walking in was that I was back in Davis at a, you guessed it... Frat party.  But I told myself, no lets check it out... although the collared shirts and T's on so many fresh baby faces made it hard to not keep saying... Frat Party, Frat Party.  

Now I don't want to hate on the scene, its just not my steez... although I did enjoy singing with many other bar goers tunes from great artists such as, Journey and Queen.  

But yes kids they do have thin beer pong tables, also referred to as Bay Rute (spelling questionable) as well as a pool table.  I mean I give one star to the Jagermeister poster on the wall that said Nice Rack, I wanted it.  

There was one great male bartender a fantastic female bar tender and then there was the coke lover, mayne!  Im not gonna tip you well if you don't pour heavy... come on now! and I wont come back to you.  But the other 3 I had were great, thanks guys!  

It's crowded and feels more like someones basement *cough frat house*  so I wont be back.  But thanks I had fun with my friends... although I really could have fun with them in an ally with 40's and a hacky sack... in the dark!
author: Megan L.

description:
I can understand why people aren't necessarily a fan of this establishment.  However, you have to understand what you're getting yourself into when you go to a bar that prides itself on having Beer Pong in the back.  

With this said, Bar None has its positive points.  Their draft beer variety is somewhat extensive, and the place is spacious when compared to other SF sports bars.  Beer pong is not the only competitive activity either.  There is a deer hunt game (which is actually entertaining), foosball tables, and pool tables that are almost always open.  

I suggest going on Thursday nights when there are cheap Coronas and sliders.  Good deals aside, the crowd is a good mix of kickball enthusiasts and mellow sports fans.
author: Sara J.

description: Bar None is the mecca for young professionals reliving their college party days.  With beer pong, darts, and pool this is like a Frat party reincarnated but without the cheap natty lights and keystones.
author: Kristen D.

description:
I'm sorry, did I just spit on you?  That was a totally involuntary reflex, I apologize.  No, don't say that, you still look good.  Any one of these guys would still be willing to take you home and donkey punch you.

*If you don't know, now you know: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donkey_punch

http://www.cleanscores.com/2227/Bar+None+Sf%2C+Llc
author: Ann W.

description:
1 star for beer pong in the back.  Be aware however that if a bar has beer pong, guys who play beer pong will be there too.  Don't get me wrong, i have enjoyed a good game at this bar, as well as many backyards, and many of my good friends play.  But with the good come the bad, and you cant choose who comes here.  I wouldn't be surprised if cans were crushed on foreheads, and holes were punched in walls just to see if they could do it.  I mean....this is the marina. I'm kind of a marina hater....don't take it personally if you live there.  Its a stereotype for a reason.
If you really want to play beer pong, you would be better off making your own table using wood, a net, and buy some cups.  You can choose your company this way, and probably do it for cheaper.  

1 star for selling beer by the pitcher.  I always like bars that sell by the pitcher.  Makes for communal drinking, and that to me is important.  We all get drunk together!!!
author: Lauren F.

description:
If you've been out of college for a couple years and you feel like life just isn't as fun as it was back in yer Golden College Days just swing by Bar None and reflect on how glad you are to be out of that thick-necked beer pong abyss. Then go somewhere swanky, drink 20 shots of Jaeger and be carried to your doorstep by the cab driver like a real adult.

I have to edit this slightly and add 2 stars for their fabulous "power hour" from 9-10 pm with $2 cocktails/beer/etc. Very worthy of pre-gaming!
author: Jane K.

description:
Aka "Bro None," featured as #6 of SF's Douchiest Bars.

http://sf.eater.com/archives/2008/11/13/eater_map_your_guide_to_san_franciscos_douchiest_bars.php#pointmap

What you'll find:  Lots of Bro's exhibiting Bro-mance.

If you're a Bro-mosexual, you should peep this place.

If you're Bromo-phobic, or hate hearing the word "Bro," every fourth word, then I would suggest going elsewhere.
author: Daniel M.

description:
The first time I came here, I turned around immediately.  It was packed with the youngin's playing beer pong, dart's and flip cup. not my idea of a Saturday night on the town.

A Wednesday night, however, and you couldn't keep me away from Bar None!  

It has become a weekly ritual after our "kick in the box" games.  Kickball teams flood the bar and I'm now the girl who fights for a flip cup table... wow, that girl on the Yellow team last night was feisty!  haha

Seriously though, it's a great place to hang out with pitchers (and pitchers and pitchers) of beer and get to know a great group of people!   

Thanks, Anna K, for getting me to join the team and teaching me "flippy cup".  Thank God I'm not the weakest link on the flip cup team anymore - phew!  Now I just have to work on my kickball skills.  

I look forward to hump day with new enthusiasm now!
author: Lauren C.

description: Worked a gig here for the Wild Turkey pub crawl and the male bartender here was so awesome and friendly! I would definitely come back with my girlfriends!
author: Lena L.

description:
"Damn Homie, in high school you was tha man, homie
What tha fuck happened to you?" - 50 Cent (Wanksta)

That's what it seemed like with some of the dudes up in there trying to relive their glory days.  

I really should split this review in half but I won't.  I could care less about the fraternity like atmosphere in the back.  A couple of my friends were visiting from San Diego so I decided to take them to the Marina.  Went in and out of a few bars then came across Bar None.  We walked in, looked around and everything seemed cool and spread out.  You actually had room to walk around.

I got to tell you... it felt funny to be categorized as "Marina".  Folks thought I was from the "Marina" and that I was going to have a "Marina" like attitude.  Man, people in the "Marina" really have it hard ;0).

Alright, so 5 stars to my man Chuck the bartender who took care of mine and my boys drinks.  Seriously, man knows how to pour a stiff Jack and Coke.  I don't have time to break down the dialogue or I would, sure was funny to me... ok, ok, real quick, real quick:

Jamal, "what's up! what's up!"
Chuck, "what would you guys like to drink"
J, "Man, can I get a couple GOOOD (with the head nod like ya you know what I mean) Jack and Cokes?"
C, "So do you want a regular or a double?"
J, "I just want it good."
C, "Well if a regular is not good you can always get a double."
J, "can't I get a single that kinda taste like a double?  You take care of me I take care of you"
C, "that's not how it works here"
J, under my breath, "This motha F***A.... Fricken Marina people I swear ;0)
J to C, "Alright a couple Jack & Cokes and a Stella."
C, "the one beer we don't have is Stella."

So I'm thinking to myself, "isn't this some shit?"

J, "he'll take a Pilsner"
My friend, "What's going on?"
J, "Nothing."
J, "How much do I owe you?"
C, "have you even tasted it yet?"
J, "For what reason?  I either like it or get a double"
C, "taste it so I know if you like it or not"
I take a sip.... Mmmm. "that's a Good (head nod) Jack and Coke"
Chuck with a slight smile, "I knew you'd like it."

Chuck's the kind of bartender I could go out the way to visit and I'm not from the "Marina."
author: Jamal G.

description:
Too crowded. Too much like a St. Mary's College I-have-no -brains-but-a-lot-of-money-but -like-to-pretend-I'm-poor bar. But hey if someone buys me a free drink - maybe I'll stay for a split second. Thanks much drunkards!

Over it like Kate Moss' marriage to Pete Doherty.
author: Aim E.

description:
The grossest rat's hole I've ever seen.....and believe it or not - every SERIOUSLY shady marina guy I have ever known loves this place.

I wouldn't be surprised if girls get roofied here on a regular basis.
author: Yelper A.

description:
For God knows what reason, I've inadvertently stumbled into this bar on a few occasions. Every time, I am immediately reminded of the extent of how much this place sucks (Note: I chose the word 'suck' at this juncture because it highlights the intellect of the lame-wads that populate this place).

I'm quite certain that on any given night Bar None boasts the highest population of post-college Frat Boys who still believe that the pinnacle of coolness is wearing a cheesy, sexual innuendo t-shirt (think anything sold on BustedTees.com) and a pair of aviators. 90% of this bar's patrons probably believe that Eddy Money's Take Me Home Tonight is the best song ever written. It would be shocking to find that anyone who frequents this bar doesn't have CollegeHumor.com as their default homepage. To put it quite bluntly, this bar is a hipster's nightmare. If you wear tapered jeans, avoid Bar None like the you avoid Lacoste.

Additionally, the bartenders, who attempt to maintain a cooler-than-thou aura, are quite mediocre at best. They actually served me tequila shots without lime - I'm pretty sure that's covered in the first day of bartending school in Bartending Lesson 1: Don't be an idiot.

A small back area of the bar is dedicated to beer pong. This is convenient if you (1) have an IQ represented by a single digit number (2) are a freshman at any school with a ranked D1 college football team or (3) enjoy spending a majority of your night explaining elbow rules to Sigma Nus.

The Verdict: As far as I'm concerned, this bar succeeds in only one aspect: it has alcohol. I would not recommend attending this bar. If the imminent San Francisco quake hits tomorrow and God manifests his vengeance through destroying every bar aside from Bar None, buy yourself a case and drink at home. It will be more fun.
author: Tom C.

description: Stopped in here for St. Patty's Day, and thought it was fun. The layout is nice, with good seating and the bar is large. The bartenders were unfriendly, but it was a St. Patty's day so that's understandable. I was a bit put off by the ridiculous number of young, plasticky blondes and frat bros, but if that's your scene you'll definitely love it.
author: Bianca F.

description: I'm surprised this place is getting such bad reviews i mean its a bar with beer pong of course there's gonna be sticky floors come on people.... I had a great time here with a group of 5 playing beer pong and pool but i can imagine its not so good for a date or something intimate. For being someone who spends more time at the bars in the mission than anywhere else this was a breath of fresh air (literally and figuratively).
author: Matteo C.

description:
Walk a few steps down into the Bar None cave and you'll enter a world of perpetually wasted former frat boys that prefer staring to starting a conversation. Beer pong is the game of choice and you're guaranteed to hear at least one Journey song. (Don't stop BELIEEEVIN'!) Creepy guys aside, I suppose this bar would be okay if you're in the mood to relive your college days. 

Ladies, don't make our mistake and go all dressed up before heading out to a club because that's a guaranteed starefest...it's definitely a t-shirt and jeans kind of place.
author: Contessa S.

description:
Bar None is the epitome of a "bro bar".

When I first moved to the city, I had friends who'd drag me to this place in a futile attempt to pick up "bro hoes". Needless to say it wasn't my scene.

Any place that serves booze where the bartenders don't know what a Manhattan is scares me (it's a classic cocktail made with rye, sweet vermouth, and bitters FYI). I assume it's 'cause they're so accustomed to serving Jagermeister and Coors Light to numbskulls (gross-and-gross).

Some douche nozzle posted something derogatory about dive bars in the Richmond and praised numerous bars in this nefarious/dubious neighborhood. He seemed like he'd be a patron of a spot like Bar None: a 20-something, moronic, striped polo shirt clad tool. The world would be a better place with fewer people like him and fewer watering holes like Bar None.
author: Rodney P.

description:
They have beer pong!

The Marina gets a bad rap from San Francisco. Yes its mostly "Orange County" white. Yes its like a big Greek row full of ex-frat ex-sorority. Yes you will find a lot of popped collars. No that doesn't mean you can't have fun. 

Its not fair to judge a place just because your gay hairdresser friend feels uncomfortable coming here in his new leather outfit. Or because your hipster friend gets jealous at what he considers spoiled rich kids. Or because your sNob Hill hybrid-car-owning friend lifts her nose at the preference for beer.

Its just another area that adds to the very diverse atmosphere of the colorful city we're apart of. Lets all take a deep breath and come together on things where we can find common ground. Like a hatred for Bush.
author: Joshua G.

description:
BROSEPH!

Been here a total of three times which is enough for me. 

Beer pong isn't my thing. Bros aren't my thing. Girls throwing up on my boots in the bathroom aren't my thing. $10 baby shots of Jameson aren't my thing. Frat kids aren't my thing. ANYWAY...

I'll add one star for the bartenders tolerating the people who come in and for making a mean tokyo tea. However you will NEVER catch me here on a saturday... ok any night for that matter.

Decent bartenders, dirty bathrooms/floors etc., not my crowd. NEXT
author: Amanda S.

description:
BLECH. Nothing is more lame than 25 yr old frat boys who use pick up lines like "If I told you I had a dead body in my car, what would you say?"...

Really? REALLY?!?

And thats whay I hate Bar None. Gag me with a pitchfork, you are all lame.
author: Alison D.

description:
Typical pick up conversation at Bar None interpreted through their nightly musical repartee:
Beer Pong Boy "Hey baby, I'm just a city boy, born and raised in South Detroit"
Slutty Tank Top Girl: "Well, I'm just a small town girl livin in a lonely world"
Beer Pong Boy: "How bout we take the midnight train going anywhere?"

Really, I love Journey, but why do so many drunk girls bastardize them with their horrible renditions... for the love of God tell me.

The one time I had a decent time there was on a random Monday night when it was completely barren. I Ended up talking to one of the older barkeeps and then *coughgoinghomewiththebouncercough*. At least now I have a really good excuse to avoid the place.
author: Mary F.

description: Decent bar, good beers on tap too. Great place to watch March Madness - tons of TVs to watch all the games.
author: Rich P.

description:
its not that bad, crowd consists of young hip people that either reside in the area or WANT to reside in the area.

Can get pretty crowded, what I like about this place is that it isnt packed full of wannabe hard ass chinese kids. But then again there were a bunch of white douchebags standing around eyeing girls like hawks...so i guess you can never really get away from those type of people.

um other than the crowds, they do have a table for beer pong and a darts area so I guess that will somewhat make this place stand out. And the fact they have a smoking section outside where you bring your drinks does help too.
author: phillip w.

description:
Believe me, I take 2-star Yelp averages seriously.  Our second pub crawl stop was supposed to be Perry's, which seemed fine to me, but it was deemed too much restaurant, not enough bar.  As we stood outside contemplating going straight to Blue Light, we noticed Bar None.  It didn't seem too bad from outside, so we checked it out.

Of course, Bar None is (in)famous for its beer pong, but it all takes place in a back corner, and you can easily ignore it if you wish.  To be honest, it looks like a fun game to me, if played with due irony of course.  But of course you won't get any irony in this bar, except for the jukebox that happily takes your money but doesn't seem to be remotely affiliated with the actual sounds coming out of the speakers.  

Ultimately, Bar None could be just about any rowdy college bar (though the rowdiness was actually quite tolerable at 10:00).  It'd be fun to play the hipster card and give it two stars, but it deserves a bonus point for having Hemp Ale on tap.  It's a wonderful brown elixir, and no, it doesn't taste like weed; overall it's a spicy, nutty, sweet flavor, not bitter in the least.  Now how could this be the only bar I've seen it in?
author: Wes M.

description:
Guilty pleasure.  

Perhaps some anecdotes will shed light on the famed Bar None:

***One Saturday night, I got half a pitcher of beer poured over my head at Bar None by a drunken partygoer holding up his pitcher to push through the crowd.  Literally my hair and shirt and shoes were totally soaked.  When I asked the guy to at least fill up my empty pint glass with the remainder of his pitcher, he denied me and walked away sans apology.  I'm pretty party-hearty but sheeesh, buy a girl a drink!

***Once, I ordered a double Red Bull & Vodka (my drink of choice).  The bartender put ice in a pint glass, FILLED it up with vodka, and gave me a can of Red Bull.  I like this sort of thing...

***The other night I was waiting to order my drink and the guy next to me (striped-shirt) ordered 3 pitchers of Coors Light.  I asked him if he ordered them because Coors was a special that night.  Douche-bag says "I'm from southern California.  I don't care how much pitchers cost!" to which I replied "Then why the hell would you order Coors Light?"   I'm an Anchor Steam kinda girl...

HINT: Don't walk in front of the drunkies playing darts.  They will peg you.
author: Erin L.

description:
Bartender, I'll take a shot of tequila.  Two more would be good.  How about a gin and tonic-- make it a double.  
Even after valient efforts to make myself forget what crappy times I've had at Bar None, this place still remains the easiest way to ruin my night.  I don't recommend stopping in for more than 15 minutes.  On the other hand, you might consider staying if you're into a superficial scene with a never-ending lines of guys in pollo shirts (collar-popped!) and girls in short skirts trying way too damn hard.
author: Leslie P.

description:
Ouch.  2 stars?  Really?  Reading some of the reviews here it's clear that the personal preference of most San Franciscans is very San Franciscan - aka, no 'stereotypical' college dive-type bars.  Well hate to break it to ya, but sometimes a girl wants more than a 'you've never seen this before' type atmosphere and some remembrance of good ol' college days.  Bar None will supply that with beer pong in full tow.

Though a little crowded on a Sat night, I was pretty happy with this place.  The bartenders were attentive, the drinks were decently priced, and the beer pong was a ragin'.  Sure, it's a little dirty down there (beer cups *everywhere*) but you can't really expect much less.  One thing great about the 'college' vibe is that strangers are actually willing to chat with you!  Since it's such a social atmosphere you can actually make a few one-night friends.  And boy, did we.  Some interesting folk populate that place.  Sometimes it's nice to spread your circle of love a bit more than a normal quiet homey bar will allow.

So sure - believe the 2 stars from everyone who apparently are not interested at all in remembering college days or having interesting impromptu conversation with intriguing strangers.  But I freaking loved college, and will revel in any remembrance I can embrace for an evening of drunkenness.

Bring on the shots of Popov!  Okay...so I don't need to remember college that bad...
author: Robin L.

description:
When the bouncer is hitting on you before you even walk into the bar, you know you're in for a sketchy experience.

But let's be honest... it's hard to not have fun while you're playing beer pong, but be prepared to fight off the boys.  Normally, I don't mind this, but evidently these boys weren't up to my standards - even when drunk.  Sad.
author: Caitlin D.

description:
Admittedly, Bar None (aka, "Bro None", or "Beta Nu"), is the quintessential frat-tastic dive in the Marina where the popped collars come to relive the "glory days". The reason for this: its the Beer Pong bar. Which, depending on your collegiate experience, either makes you fist pump triumphantly, or throw up a little bit in your mouth. 

Personally, I dig the game. Incidently, so does my dad. Now, some people may give a girl in her early twenties a quizzical look for playing drinking games at a bar with a suited gentleman in his late 50's, but not the patrons and employees of Bar None. My dad immediately became the most popular guy in the room when people started realizing that Old Man River is actually a damn good beer pong player. Everybody wanted to challenge us, and you can bet your pledge pin we didn't pay for a single pitcher, courtesy of our opponents and Otto, my favorite bartender.  (Sidenote: if you 'accidentally' call him "Hotto", there's a free shot in it for ya... worked for me!)

Three stars for college nostalgia, but be forewarned: a significant number of the Bar None's patrons are not the sharpest tools in the shed, but certainly are tools.
author: Anna K.

description: I've been in Bar None once and will never go in again. My wife an I went in to see what all the commotion was when we first moved to the area and it turns out the commotion was a fight between a bunch of greasy, v-neck wearing, frat boys. We wrote that up to wrong time, wrong place and decided to get a drink. 30 minutes later the bartender had served everyone around us, some more than once. We left and promised never to go back. What a joke.
author: Pete F.

description: Really awesome atmosphere. They were playing 80's/90's music. Made for a chill mood. The  beruit beer pong tables were full all night. But thanks to good conversations it was hardly noticed. Crowed was chill. Did not see any knuckle heads all night.
author: Craig F.

description:
Not gonna lie, I really liked this place. Within the first 15 minutes here my friend and I already had made friends, and I love, love, love, new friends. 

Yes, it reminded me of many college nights spent in the the fraternity garage walking on sticky floors watching/playing beer pong, but those were some GOOD times people. Everyone here that I talked to was pretty nice and friendly. 

Will def come here again the next time I am in SF, maybe then I will get to school some peeps at the tables.
author: Andee V.

description:
I went here once, two years ago.

I felt like I had walked into a fraternity house.  My friend and I were looking at each other, like "Are we allowed to be here?"  I felt that we needed a secret handshake to enter.  It seemed like a private party, where all the frat boys knew each other...almost more than intimately *wink-wink*  

We walked in, did a loop/survey of the spot.  Only two other girls in the whole place...and it looked like they were frat "groupies" - if there's such a thing.  You know, 28 guys to every 1 girl as the rest cheer on??

Too weird.  We walked out.
author: Ladi Da A.

description:
Let me tell you something about people. People (myself included) all want some sort of definition. We want to know who we are, what we stand for, and that we belong to a group. We need the peer-vindication. It's true!

Some people do this by finding a cause, an ethos or an endeavour, in which they believe, and going with it. Some do this by finding others in which they disapprove, and react to it. The second group define themselves by that which they are not. It's easier, and it's constantly reassuring, if you need it!

You see a lot of it... um... everywhere. 

Bar None is a frat bar. Yes it is. Yes it is. No doubt about that. There is beer on the floor and there are silly frat kids as far as the eye can see. They all wear a uniform and they all say silly trivial things about their trivial lives. Just like you... and me.

However, that's what they know. They just got out of college and it might take a little while to shake off that college-peer-induced identity. I would expect as much. The big bad world takes its time in slapping you around a bit, but there's no rush. Is there? Huh?

I concede, being stuck in that frat identity at... ooh... let's say 31, would be fairly depressing, but lay off the teenies and try to be a little more paternal/maternal and magnanimous with your vast amounts of worldly knowledge. They have their reasons, they're only young, and they're having fun.

That this venue gets consistently low ratings just because of the clientele, who have just as much right to do what they want for kicks as the rest of us, when the proprietors are actually working damn hard, is a bit shameful. (And the bouncers have always been extremely polite to me, as I have to them).

While this may seem a little like a venue-prompted review, I can assure you it's not. I just happen to live near the bar, so I often call in to check on the menagerie.

I am Jimmy Kiwi, hear me roar!

By the way, beer pong is kinda fun (if you can possibly survive a little beer spilling on you).
author: Jimmy F.

description:
Won't say much more than what's already been said.  Definite madness with a collegy feel inside.  Bar environment with different activities you can do like darts, pool, and beer pong. (gross!)  

The service is a bit arrogant.  Maybe they have to be with all the drunkards but still.  I didn't pay so I don't know if it is overpriced but reading some reviews, it seems to be.  Either way, this place is a bar so I don't expect two thumbs up.
author: Jess C.

description: I had never been to this part of sf until last night and I kind of felt like I was in a whole different city. It wasnt your average diverse parts of SF. It was alot less lively. But I will say the bar was a cool little spot and the bartender was really sweet. She introduced a new friend to Cazadores tequilla and told him that it kicks patrons ass. I was bummed that they didnt have the ingrediants to make a LC but hey irish carbombs would suffice.
author: Valerie G.

description:
I was visiting San Francisco over July 4th weekend, and we decided to get a beer pong fix.  Well:

 They didn't have the beer pong lined up when we got there, but no big deal
 The bar was SO crowded and people kept stepping on me
 Because it was so packed, the service suffered
 The bar was SO loud, I practically lost my voice by the end of the night
 Someone spilled beer on me... but then again, I was looking for beer pong
 
Overall, it was a nice place, I just think I caught it on a busy night.  I mean, there was a line to get in when we left!  At Bar None!  I'll hit it up next time I'm out that way.
author: Dana R.

description:
This is a review solely for Wednesday night when I come here with the greatest Kickball team of all time. The Yellow Team!

When you're surrounded by fellow kickballers, and a maestro yelling, "LINE 'EM UP", you gotta love being there.

With flip cups games being pounded out, and ridiculously cheap pitchers flowing, life is pretty good.

Is this a place I want to come for a Friday or Saturday night? Absolutely not.

BUT, is this my home away from home on Wednesday nights during kickball season? Absolutely.
author: Mike K.

description:
More like Bar NADA! Came here after Circa on Friday night. TOTAL SCENE CHANGE!!! I moment i step in i felt i was in a rowdy tavern full of douche college dudes looking for tang. You can smell the testosterone in the air. GROSS!

Neat idea that they had beer pong but way too many people waiting to play. 

There was very little music bright inside. Its more of a talky get hammered type bar. Not my style for a friday night. Maybe happy hour.
author: Brent W.

description:
I went here on a whim with a few friends.  I was actually surprised to see that Bar None had such a low rating... typically, I agree with Yelp ratings.  Upon walking in, the bouncer told some girl to "get the hell out" after she showed him a fake ID that clearly wasn't her.

Anyway, it was really packed on a Friday night, a few beirut tables, a young 20's crowd.  It was a lot of fun despite the fact it was filled with a bunch of dudes dressed to the nines.

Bar None reminded me of a young 20's bar in NYC, and it's definitely the only underground bar I've been to in the Marina.  I really liked this place because it's great for large groups-- people are social, everyone was young, and I liked the atmosphere.
author: Jason R.

description: If you are looking for Beer Pong, this is your place! It harkens of the Marina stereotypes, but has always been a good time for me!  It does get hot when it's packed.  Watch out for drunkards sing/slurring anything from Gaga or Katy Perry.
author: Bryson S.

description:
I'm not even going to dignify this "bar" with a review (and I use the term bar loosely!). I've been dragged here a handfull of times, and each time it only reminds me of why I don't go out in the Marina.

This. Place. Blows. The people, the drinks, the people... in the words of a good friend, it is the quintessential TOOL SHED.

If you possess any shred of dignity or culture, stay away. 
If you possess some killer beer pong moves, a sweet new woven from Abercrombie or a wardrobe from Wet Seal... enjoy! And stay away from the good bars in this fine city.
author: Megan B.

description:
If you have recently moved from a college town and want the atmosphere of a bro-bar, Bar None is for you.

Frat guys, sorostitutes, bros and bricks (bro-chicks), popped collars, beer pong, sherpa boots (uggs), girls with huge sunglasses, ruffle-but skirts, if these things appeal to you, go to bar-none.
author: Alex K.

description:
eww! yeah, I gave up dirty frat house drinking back in college! I was grossed out the whole time we were in here. You know when a place just smells dirty? Like a mix of mildew and trash...yeah, you know EXACTLY what I mean!

The only good thing I can say about this place is it's location.  Great spot in the Marina, but there are so many other places I'd rather go.  I won't even GO into detail about the bathrooms! D-I-S-G-U-S-T-I-N-G!
author: Candice M.

description:
Calm down; it's just a bar.  
I have never seen a more polarizing neighborhood than the Marina, and what better bar to address this than Bar None.  Sure, every guy there has a vertical striped shirt on and most of the chicks are carrying purses that they put on their plastic and cannot afford, but I'll just use a great douche bag line to explain the place- "It is what it is."
Don't over think this place and you might have a decent time.  I've got no problem with a cool game of beer pong, some classic Bon Jovi, and moderately priced beer.  
If places and people like this piss you off, then you've lost sight of just having a fun night at a bar and you should think about how harmless the place really is.
author: A. S.

description:
Jagger bombs + cheesy 80's ballads + beer pong + drunk underage girls = the formula for another One Industry success story! If, that is, you consider a below par frat party where you still have to pay $8 for a well vodka tonic a success. They hold "power hour" every night from 9-10. Need I say more? The fact that it seems to always be insanely crowded in here serves as a benefit to patrons who are 9 times out of 10 too drunk to stand on their own, the density of the crowd generally keeps them afloat. It's the marina version of the Abbey Tavern - those of you who are familiar with the abbey should instantly understand the dynamic here at Bar None.

The darts and kickball after parties make it an occasionally unavoidable weeknight destination but I avoid it like the plague when at all possible. So unless you're an 18 year old girl looking to make out with a slop who won't remember your name in the morning, or vica versa,  a sloppy drunk guy who can't get play from any sober person his own age, this is not the spot.
author: Taylor E.

description:
There are plenty of places in this city that have a particular purpose.  For example, if I walk in to an asian massage parlor, I'm clearly not going there for the purpose of getting a massage.  Thus, it wouldn't make any sense for me to rate said massage parlor on how good a massage I get.  That would be stupid.  As another example, when I walk in to a strip club, I don't expect the strippers to serve me a venti half caf latte.  And again, I wouldn't rate them based on that criteria.

Now, with those caveats in place, you have to give the same treatment to Bar None.  You don't go to Bar None expecting excellent service and the best drinks on the planet.  Don't expect to have a calm and soothing environment where you can chill out with your lady-friend.  

You go to Bar None to get a pitcher of beer, play some beer pong and relive your college days.  If you go here expecting ANYTHING else, then I'm sorry, but you're an idiot.  The whole atmosphere is geared towards reliving those days when we all went to frat parties and waded through an ungodly amount of drunk people to get up to the front of the line so we could do a keg stand.  And keeping that in mind, it does a very good job of providing that kind of atmosphere.

The bartenders are great at pouring shots and pitchers; I wouldn't venture much beyond that.  The bathrooms should be avoided at all costs; again, even there Bar None does an excellent job of replicating the fraternity party atmosphere.  Did you ever walk in to a bathroom at one of those parties sober?  

And finally: beer pong.  Play it.  You know you miss it!  You know you loved it!  If you go to Bar None and don't play beer pong, you're wasting your time.  This is a place to relive your days in college... so relive them.
author: Kurt C.

description:
Beer pong, huge huge bar and area, plenty of seats, good service, and reasonably priced drinks, $5 for a beer. 

Always a must stop on the way to the other bars in the area. Great place to relax with friends since the place is just massive. You're not hitting other people or being elbowed trying to get to the bar. 

Really like this place. Would recommend it.
author: Ahmed S.

description:
If you like college parties, then this place is fun.  The crowd is young and fun.

The place smells a bit like a fraternity basement (meaning, urine and beer), but if you avoid the back area, then you will avoid most of the odor.

Drinks are reasonably priced and the bouncer's aren't assholes (*cough* Medjool).
author: Ankur P.

description:
This place has a few things going for it, although at the same time there are many things wrong with it.

PROS:
-Beer Pong in the back, and the brew is not that expensive
-Shots during happy hour are cheaper than most other places
-For the most part, the bartenders are quick and happy to take your drink orders down.
-The bouncer/s aren't typical tough guys. They're actually nice guys that you could chat it up with while you're waiting to get in, even during busy hours.
-Bank ATM (it was either WAMU or BofA, I forget) right across the street, so you don't use the one inside with a 5 dollar surcharge.

CONS:
-For the kind of bar it is, Bar None is quite small.
-The place is dirty. The floor is sticky and sometimes it smells disgusting.
-Calling the restrooms dirty would be an understatement.
-The place gets really crowded on weekends, so in consequence getting a drink on a busy night is dependent on who is willing to move away from the bar when he/she got his/her drink, and usually they don't leave for a few minutes because they take more than one round.
-No DJ, music from what I remember comes out of a jukebox (it's something different, but not something I could get comfortable with)
-For the most part, the crowd is pretty rowdy.


Sounds like a bad review right? Only reason why I'm giving this place three stars is because there wasn't a night that I regret going here instead of some other bar. Plus, it's always fun watching people who are more drunk than you are. Of all bars I go to, people tend to get way more destroyed here than other places I've gone to.

Examples:
-Britney Spears' "Slave" came on, and this cute blonde who was a rabid fan of hers tried to destroy the jukebox because she wanted to steal the CD so bad.
-Two drunk guys started to brawl inside, only to be escorted out, and apologize to each other telling each other "Sorry bro I was drunk, I don't even know who the hell you are"
-Two drunk girls fighting each other, only to realize they were sisters fighting over some short dude in a tank top.

Randomness at its fullest. I can't promise the same experience, but I can say this: something ridiculously random (and maybe funny) is going to happen due to the amount of alcohol being thrown around. Just hope it's not you making a fool of yourself.
author: Gene P.

description:
Bar None is actually pretty awesome. The drinks are cheap and they have beer pong! If you just wanna hang out with some buddies and drink..this is the place to be. I remember there were so many bars that I went to with friends and we usually ended up going to Bar None because the other bars sucked. Girls can wear whatever they want..from tennis shoes to nice stilletos. 

The only thing is that it can get really crowded...but what bar isn't.
author: Lana K.

description: The worst bar in this city by far. Terrible people, terrible drinks and you can't even hear yourself think. You can hear the college chants from blocks away! Please do anything you can to remove this bar from SF, Stat!
author: Christopher A.

description: I prefer to have a drink rather than play beer pong. I also don't think highly of the trust fund frat jock trying to prove himself by talking about fighting or picking fights or getting into fights. I once did see the bouncer choke one of these guys unconscious inside Bar None. I thought it was pretty cold and fucked up so I asked him why he did it. He told me dude was fighting his own friend so the bouncer moved in to stop it and the guy swung at the bouncer. I was like "Damn". Then dude came to, got up, took off his shirt and wanted to fight the bouncers (or acted like he did). They got him to leave without further incident.
author: Ian D.

description:
Who the hell called this a cougar den?  Are you kidding?  Well, it's probably where cougars would like to hang out because it's full of lame ex-frat boys under 25.  As a 22 year old, even I feel old there.  It feels like it's full of 18 year olds.  I am not a huge fan of this place, but yet I find myself still going there sometimes.  And as always I'm never there longer than half an hour or 20 minutes.

Update 08/28/2007:

I'm now 24 and don't ever go here.  They won't let me in.  I'm too old.
author: Vanessa Z.

description:
Bar None is one of three watering holes where I've walked in, seen copious available seating, and walked out.  Yikes....this place was just TOO YOUNG for me.  It was like walking into a taping of "Romper Room" where the kids were college graduates, Miss Nancy had called in sick, and the substitute teacher was handing out bourbon-and-seven's instead of milk-and-cookies.  Everywhere I looked I saw the wild gaze of teenage fancy, heard the mating calls of twenty-something males, and smelled the acrid stench of bad cologne mixed with stale beer and a hint of cigarette smoke.  The male-to-female ratio was rather respectable at 3-1, but the oldest woman I saw in the place *couldn't* have tried on her birthday suit before I took my first legal drink.  Frat party? Yes.  Cougar Den?  Uh uh....no self-respecting middle-aged woman would be caught dead trolling for bottom-feeders in this pond.

Patio area in front. Bar down the side, pool table to the rear.  Instinct told me to get out....quick.  The only bar where I've had a stronger urge to leave was El Trebol ( http://www.yelp.com/biz/8J1RXJ07Pb4sdGvBxB_LRw?hrid=vdtkzPK9iqp4rS_9Nx3B2A ) in the Mission.

I'd recommend this place for 21 year old boys with type-A personalities and turrets-like tendencies to yell when drunk.  I'd also recommend it to predatory young girls that crave male attention, and find amusement in manipulating a crowd of horny guys. Fortunately for Bar None, its surrounding area has a sizable population representing this very demographic.  But for all practical purposes,  the rest of humanity can find greater amusement value at the endodontist's office, in the chair, getting a root canal.
author: Mike W.

description:
Yucky.

Just like the bars I avoided like the plague in college.  Don't come here unless you like getting spilled on, visually undressed, ignored by all the bartenders except one sympathetic girl, trampled, groped, or having your eardrums blown by the rallying roars of the winning beer pong table.

No, thanks.
author: Kate M.

description:
Bar None is great for Beer Pong aficionado's.  The trouble is I remember beer pong involving a paddle.  Here you just throw the small ball into a cup which seems to involve a little less dexterity than using a paddle while not trying to knock over your own beer.  So if you like playing carnival games (I remember trying to throw the quarter into dime sized vase / never won for some reason) then maybe just maybe you'll like this bar.

You will also enjoy this bar if you enjoy concrete floors, the smell of stale beer on the floor and very drunk older gentlemen who look like they are preying on little girls.  Why isn't NBC's to Catch a Predator out here?

Literally this reminded me of the old fraternity, you know the mystery stain on the couch, the smell of Natty Light, half-full beer cups littering the area while giving that no so sweet aroma of barley and hops exposed to air for over a week.  I remember the carpet being brown at the beginning of the year and black at the end.  Just take all that in and transport it here and that's what you've got with Bar None.  Yes I'm an old fart; I've moved past these days so call me grandpa and buy me diapers but this isn't my scene.
author: Bill P.

description:
Remember that scene at the beginning of Animal House where Bluto is relieving himself? Well, 9 nights out of 10 you'll be lucky enough to see that re-enacted here.  

If you are looking to find all the 25 yr. old kegger-dudes in the Marina, you enjoy the sweet smell of stale beer, and you think it's cool to have your feet stick to the floor, then this is the bar for you! As an added bonus, on any given night you are sure to find at least one pack of screaming drunk chicks. Cool.  

Oh yeah, I have to admit I used to love this place back in the day.
author: Dave L.

description:
i love beer pong yet ironically enough i can't stand frat boys. 
especially the ones dealing with the fact that they are no longer in college and must now hash out a new douche bag identity. 

the bathrooms are impressively disgusting. seriously. every time. 

but i love beer pong:)
author: kiki b.

description:
You are 35, you have a trophy wife and a house on lake street. Let's go out at night and back track to college days with your 'broesiffs'. Play beer pong with your wife holding your sports jacket.

The only redeeming quality is watching women fall down the earths most hazardous stairs ever. All stone, all edge, highfives and yager shots for everyone.
author: F B.

description:
Let's just start with the premise that most Yelpers are more hipster and less fratty than those present at Bar None.  In contrast, I am an equal opportunity bar scene evaluator.  I will go where ever good times are and  beautiful women flock like the salmon of Capistrano. 

   So with that in mind, there are three questions to ask before you go to Bar None:

1. Were you in a fraternity in college?  or Did you go to frat parties in college?

2. Do you like beer pong?

3. Are you under the age of 25?

If you fit these criteria, I am confident that you will enjoy the various activities and attendants of Bar None.  I know that this was the first bar I went to after I graduated from college and moved to SF, and at the time (yes I was in a fraternity in college), I thought the place was amazing.  As I have left the college life and the college mentality with it, this place loses some luster.  But that doesn't stop me from going here for a few games of beer pong every once in a while . . .
author: Jordan J.

description:
Quiet possibly the sorriest excuse for a bar in San Francisco. I was originally hesitant to go to Bar None but my friends' promise of beer pong made the trip down those dodgy stairs seem worthwhile.

As my friends were preparing the beer pong court I was tasked with buying balls for the game (they're in a vending machine and cost $0.50 each for those of you interested). As I was walking back to the table I couldn't help but notice the line of drunk biker type dudes lined up against the wall as if they were auditioning for part two of the usual suspects. All five of them were essentially drooling at the few girls that were playing beer pong....after seeing that i left.

Thanks Bar None for making every other bar in town seem a little better.
author: Bryan B.

description:
Bar No Thank You.  Too many striped shirts.  Can't think straight.  Must leave.  

Let's go take shots with the bartenders at CT or watch that fight about to happen outside of Blue Light...
author: Rachel G.

description:
COLLEGE!!!!!!!!

Any bar that has beirut is a winner in my book (and it's beirut, not beer pong, d-bag). 

My friends and I like to call this place beta nu since it is pretty much a frat. But it's a frat with a lot more to drink than keystone light or warm natty ice. Yeah, there are a bunch of guys here who have their collars popped, and a lot of girls who are wearing gucci sunglasses even though it's 11pm. But hey, that's college.

I especially like the coors light pool table, which I can't believe is as nice as it is considering the stuff that goes on in this bar. Beirut in the back, drinking games in the front. 

The last time I went to the mens room in bar none I walked in on people having sex. It was very awkward, a couple of guys laughing while these people get freaky in the stall, but it immediately got funny when the manager barged in and threw them out naked. 

The scene is never-changing, and when you get sick of it (or too drunk) you can just go next door and grab some extreme. Now that's convenience.
author: David D.

description:
I'm all about rating places relative to expectation.  I haven't been to Bar None in a while, and frankly it's not my cup of tea (since one year after college, at least).

Do people really think Bar None is trying to be anything other than a dive bar for college kids?  They have four BEIRUT TABLES for pete's sake.  Giving this a low rating based on that fact is missing the point.

Do I go to Bar None?  No, I haven't been in 3 years.

Does Bar None deliver fantastically for a dirty dive bar packed with 18-22 year olds?  Yes.

Would I go again?  Sure, but my expectations would be correctly aligned.

Hence, the 3.
author: Nate H.

description:
Can I give this place half or no stars?

I agree with Jack H. that this place keeps *those* people out of your bars and favorite hangouts, but come on!

The only establishment I know of in SF where you can play beer pong, this place reeks of frat house filth. 

It's only appropriate that the last time I came here was because my boyfriend had this despicable excuse of humanity with him and this was the only place he felt right about bringing the waste of space.
author: Christy M.

description:
If you want to relive your college days of never ending frat parties, this is your place. Beer pong? Uh, no thanks. 

Maybe I've just gotten too old for this crap but jesus, it's just not fun. I suppose if you really want someone to hit on you in hopes of boosting your self confidence, you may also check this out. If you're a cougar, you'll probably love this place. 

I think I'll leave it. I have to say, that staff here must have a high pain threshold because I sure as hell couldn't put up with half of the stuff that goes on here. My hat is off to you.
author: Anita B.

description:
I went here on a monday night, it was really empty here, so maybe my review is skewed..

But..I thought this place was pretty cool, yeah so it's in marina...can we just get past that point?  It has beer pong, pool, darts, cheap drinks, a lot of room, couches, and other bar games...So I cant really review the people as you all mentioned since no one was there, but I had a great time and barely spent any dough since it's happy hour all day on mondays.  The bartender was a cool guy who was nice and hooked me up with a free beer, so really I dont know how people can complain about the place or the bartenders...

I had a great time here, it was the first time I've gone to a bar in marina, and after all the crap I heard about Marina, I dont know...I'm starting think it's not as bad as I thought...but yeah again it was a monday night and empty...

Anyway I would highly suggest this place on Monday Nights, the music was good, and you have the bar to yourself.  The beer pong tables are great, the bartender was nice and it just seemed like a cool bar to me...and i'm a mission bar kinda guy...
author: christopher h.

description:
This place is basically a frat house where you pay for your drinks.  It seemed like ex-frat/sorority peeps decided that they needed to carry on their good-old college days and found this bar.  Ugh. dirty floors with spilled beer, drunk sorority girls hogging the bathrooms with their puke because they keep losing at beer pong.  I thought I left the college scene years ago, only to be brought back kicking and screaming.  There's a reason why college frat parties only attract the underage students - they have no choice. 
  
Plus, their juke box has no Madonna? Oh, the humanity! 

Don't make the same mistake I did. Go flee into the night with your legal ID to a better bar!
author: Rita N.

description:
So my friend would always rave about Bar None and I always said. "one of these days...". Finally a year later I stopped by to check it out. I don't know why she loved it so much? Well everybody has different taste that's a given. 

So you walk down stairs to the entrance which is different. The place is huge but nothing really caught my eye or made me love this place in anyway... What I'm trying to say it's not bad but it's nothing special.
author: Ashley C.

description:
After reading a lot of the past reviews, I must agree with a lot of them. 
Yes, there are a whole lot of douchey guys here. Yes it is dirty and has a stale alcohol stench. Yes it is like an underground frat house.

But I must admit...I love this bar. I went to college in a small town in Texas where we frequented many bars that were just like this, and those bars were where I had some of the best times.

I don't know, I really like the crowd and I always have a good time here. I like the beer pong tables in the back, I like the small patio/open-air space and I like most of the people I meet here.

I'm giving 4 and not 5 stars because I can agree that there are a lot of weird guys that hit on you, even when you're standing with your boyfriend, and the drinks aren't as strong as a drink I would make myself (but when is a drink at a bar ever as strong as you want).


Just don't sit on the toilet seats.
author: Ashley B.

description:
This is a college atmosphere bar.  Don't go here expecting more than that.  Come here when you want to reminisce with old college buddies.

Tip:  Beer pong make friends faster than M&M's.
author: Warren C.

description: We wanted to play beer pong but the wait was ridiculously long on a Friday night. We got some drinks and my friend told me that the vodka tasted very cheap and gross. The music was hip hop that night and the crowd was alright. It's not really my kind of place because I prefer to dance or sit down but there was no space to do either.
author: Jenny T.

description:
Welcome to Amateur hour! 

If you like a bar where it takes 10 minutes to get a drink, the bartenders are inept at making a strong drink and you have to pay 7 bucks for a jack and coke, Bar None is your place. There is nothing redeeming about this place, the music makes your head hurt, you can't carry a casual conversation and everyone thinks they are the shit, blah go back to LA.
author: Allan R.

description:
Sup brah, where we heading to? BAR NONE!!!!!!

Frathouse central is where you can relive your college glory days.  Longing for those days of beer pong? Bar none has you covered.  Do you enjoy Abercrombie and Fitch?  You stopped at the right spot!!! Yaayy!!!

Ok Bar None isn't horrible, it just.... hmm... I can't put my finger on it but I'm not really feeling the crowd.   Just like everyone else has mentioned, it definitely attracts that frat/sorority type of clientele.  Now it could be worse as there are plenty of attractive bitties here but I'm always kind of bleh when i come here.  I generally joke to come here when my friends want to go drinking and then my friends usually follow up with a pretty jovial laugh because they know I'm kidding almost all of the time.  I can't lie, I just went recently and it wasn't as bad as I thought it would be, it just wasn't good.

I'd definitely recommend for the 24 and younger crowd here.  25 and overs will probably be turned off by this establishment.  To be young and dumb again.  I'd give this spot 2.5.
author: Jason Y.

description:
I'm afraid to admit how many times I've been here.  When I was underaged, when I didn't know where to go in the city (before I lived here).  When I'm too wasted to make a decision.  OH!  And to play beer pong!  They do have some fun games, which I think is what attracts the frat boys.  2 stars:

1 for entertaining me when I didn't know any better
1 for games

Other than that its horrible.  So incredibly dirty.  The bathrooms make me sick.  The bar tenders are not the nicest.  But I guess if I had to work at bar none I'd prob be the same way :)
author: Angela S.

description:
People who say the Marina district is indicative of the true feeling of San Francisco are unfortunately wrong. I grew up in 'Lamorinda' and to be quite honest with you, after college i left Moraga for San Francisco because i wanted to live in the city and do "city-ish" things (?). And I love Moraga, don't get me wrong, but if i wanted to be with pretentious a-holes i would've elected to spend my 20's in Moraga. 

Going to Bar None teleports me right back to Moraga. Hell, going to Bar None teleports me back to freshmen year of college at a frat. 

Bar None is filled to the brim with 21-22 year olds that just left college and are now testing the bar scene in San Francisco. Ultimately many choose greener pastures for their watering hole (i.e. North Beach, Mission, Hayes, Sunset) but the ones that stay are 30 somethings trying to creep on newly graduated college kids. (((SHUDDER))). Sure going to Bar None once was fun, but once was more than enough to get my fill. 

Tips and Pointers:
-No Cover (at least when i went)
-No dresscode, extremely relaxed
-Cheap, Cheap, Cheap
-Bathroom floor has been pee'd all over by lazy guys (i actually saw a drunk guy do that here, it was an odd and awkward experience for me)

[SEMI APPROVED] (recommended visits: 1)
author: Eric T.

description:
Man, you guys gotta start drinking earlier.  My favorite daytime bar in the marina.  I don't have a favorite nighttime bar in the marina, so this is my favorite bar in the marina.  Roomy, smelly, decent drinks, super friendly and easygoing staff.  It's the Edinburgh Castle of the north, without all that bummer cultural history.  Y'all shouldn't even KNOW how much this bar sucks at night, cuz what are you doing in the Marina at night, yelpers?

Well anyway, go during the day for an hour if you wind up on Union.  It'll do you right.

But of course, you're all exactly right - the one time I went here at night I offered to buy a girl a drink and she said "long island iced tea."  Five minutes later, I'm out 12 bucks and she's making out with Stephen.  Burn.
author: Nick P.

description:
Beirut tables.  That's seriously why you're coming here?  You know a kitchen table can hold up 20 cups as well, right?

The people are laaaaame.   The bartender is an ignorant douche bag, and they charge you for ping-pong balls (they aren't even Butterflys).

The music is from a jukebox, which is a horrible idea when you have a demographic like this.  GUESS WHAT?  WE ALL KNOW THE LYRICS FROM JOURNEY.  ALL OF THEM.

The problem with the scene here is that if you try to joke around with people, they go aggro on you because they're actually too dumb to understand the underlying humor to your comment.


Also, if you suck at Beirut, stay home, the one time I went here I had to watch a couple bros throw the ping pong balls at single cups for about a half hour before one finally made it and we could play.  Boo.
author: Michael P.

description:
If you've been getting the urge to order a pitcher of light beer and stand in a room with a 5:1 guy to girl ratio, then this place rocks!

But seriously, who has that urge?

The beer pong tables are a nice touch, and if that's what you're in the mood for, this place is fine, but be prepared to see all of the worst Marina stereotypes.
