Just as we were leaving, a pink stretch hummer pulled up and dropped off what appeared to be some sort of prom-style birthday party all matching the color of their vehicle... yeah.
author: C P.

description: The reviews don't lie: this place is is here for one reason and one reason alone: Beer Pong / Flip Cup. And the fact that you can play Beer Pong and Flip Cup in a bar, in the marina, in San Francisco is 5-effin stars! Unfortunately, the fact that you can play Beer Pong and Flip Cup in a bar, in the marina, in San Francisco is 1-effin star! Bring your group, play your game, keep to yourselves, and you'll have a blast. +1 if you com before sundown and miss the bigger annoyances.
author: Andrew C.

description: Nothin extra special about this bar....in fact the only reason it gets its 3 stars is because they have a beer pong section - awesome!
author: Charlotte P.

description: Stopped in here for a beer after a late lunch today with my Dad. Wasn't that crowded but the people here seemed pretty chill. The bartender was definitely a nice dude, and I love the fact that they have beer pong in the little back-corner room. It was definitely scorching hot in that little area with the pool table, but it's summer time so it's obviously a given. I'd like to see how this place is on the weekends though.
author: Anthony L.

description:
Minus the fact that I have never been in here without seeing someone from high school here, and that I always feel like I'm at at a Tri Delt party, it's okay for the beer pong alone.  

Typical Marina pub/bar.  

Never had a bad time here so I can't complain or hate on it like everyone else who doesn't like the Marina. 

But when it's time to go out, I never think of coming here.
author: Denise B.

description: Went here a couple nights ago and the guy at the door was trying to extort some kid for money to get his fake id back. Thought that was unprofessional but overall the bar is ok...
author: Alex G.

description:
I probably better watch what I put on here, I might get picked off by one of the bouncers or 37yr old frat boys who enjoy frequenting this place on my way home from a night out.

Basically, this has been crowned "douche bag bar #1" amongst a slew of it's competitors in Marina. Congratulations!!!

I've been here quite a few times, very much so against my will, and usually drink myself into oblivion so as to forget I was ever there. 

But, I will have to admit, If you are bored, have absolutely nothing to do and are looking for some great entertainment, watching hordes of guys with no game make there way down the bar from girl to girl, only to see them get shut down one after the other, is better than any TV show on a Friday night.

Oh, and if you miss the days of launching ping pong balls into plastic red cups of shitty beer from your college days, this is the place to go.
author: Anne Marie S.

description:
Here is my advice; grab a bunch of your friends at 3pm on a saturday afternoon, go to bar none, and rally your friends and the entire population of the bar into a full blown flip-cup tournament.

This will result in lots of fun, new friends and an early bedtime.   :)
author: Megan H.

description:
Awful.  Horrible.  Awful.  Terrible.

The downfall of our society.  More threatening than global warming.
author: Kurosh H.

description:
there are only two reasons to come to this godforsaken scum pool (and i mean that literally for the sticky crud on the floor, and figuratively for the douchey clientele):
- beirut (you commoners may call it "beer pong")
- cheap beer

had one of my most epic beirut games here, and the crowd certainly upped my game.  they serve beer in pitchers here too, which most sf bars dont.
author: dan a.

description:
I managed to spend 32 years in blissful ignorance. And then one day my assistant dragged me out Friday night after work with the words "We're gonna play beer pong, this will be so much fun". Bless her 22-year-old heart.

Not only had I never played such a game before, I didn't even know it existed. To nobody's surprise, I lost. My partner was the DD, so I got to drink a lot. With little frat boys (who, by the way, can't hold their liquor) standing by, wondering what the old lady was doing there.

1 tiny star for the social experiment and introducing me to frat games
1 slightly brighter star for playing all the really, really, really bad music from the 80s and early 90s for my drunken self to sing along.

1 small warning: definitely felt a slightly homophobic vibe in there. Or at least a very heterosexual, narrow-minded one.
author: Tatjana G.

description:
If the answer to any of the following questions is "yes," Barnone is the place for you:

1) Do you like packed bars that have a low celing and get hot since they are sub street level?
2) Did you just get a fake ID and really want to live it up from your apartment parties and keggers?
3) Do you enjoy drinking beer out of a cup that once contained a ping pong ball which a few seconds ago was rolling on the ground, kicked by other people and stopped in front of the bathroom?
4) Are you past the age of 24 and still love a great deal on Pabst?
5) Do you enjoy being with the people who answered "yes" to the above 4 questions as they try to re-enact their sorority and fraternity days by being obnoxious* to everyone around them?
6) Did you just move to SF from college a week ago?

Sure, I've had some fun nights there, but this is a place you grow out of, and quickly.  Its not bad on off nights for a quick drink or even a weekend afternoon to watch sports in a low key setting, but avoid it at all costs Thursday-Saturday.  Especially if you see a bus or trolley parked in front of it.

*Obnoxiousness levels vary, ranging from being obnoxious (i.e. loud and saying idiotic things) with the people you know, annoying everyone else while being oblivious to your surroundings, or actually being in your face obnoxious.
author: Johnson H.

description:
A) They have beer pong, this is a plus.  A fun time to be had by all.
B) It is in the Marina, this is not a plus, to far to get there
C) They have Pitchers of beer.  This is a plus, not many places do pitchers any more.
D) Overcrowded with stripped shirts, This is not a plus.
E) They have good bartenders that are fast, This is a plus.
so three pluses apparently equals three stars.
author: brian m.

description:
It saddens me so on this great Sunday afternoon to see the two star rating for Bar None...

First and foremost, I have worked at Bar None for approximately 4 years.  I am customer turned employee. I have worked the door, kitchen but mostly a bartender.  I want to address all the pundits...

Yes are floors get sticky from all the spilled drinks, yes the bar gets crowded and yes there is a very eclectic group of people but what do you expect...

From most of the reviews I would assume that the people writing the reviews prefer lychee martinis and like the feel of cashmere on their skin, and you thats great but Bar None is for jeans and a tshirt, beer and a shot of jaeger (#1 Jaeger Bar in San Francisco).  The two star people are the ones who walk in and ask me for glasses of wine or choclate martinis...and tip for shit!

If you want to enjoy a night out with a proper bar staff and social people, and not spend 100 bucks for three cocktails, come see us at the Bar None and actually enjoy yourself for a change of pace.
author: Nicholas S.

description:
I'm not sure how I haven't been 86'd from this place. Every single time I go in there, it's like a time-warp back to Frat Row and all of my inhibitions/memories go out the window. I'm only giving it 4 stars instead of 5 because I can't remember how much fun i have there. The beer pong gets me every time and the bartenders make for good company.

Whenever I want to feel like I'm 18 again or if i leave my dignity back in Marin, I hit up bar none.

See you on NYD.
author: Anna F.

description: This has to be one of San Francisco's worst bars for all of the reasons cited by fellow Yelpers. Bar None might be one of the worst places in Northern California. It makes the dives in Stockton look fun and hip.
author: Michael G.

description: And why was this place so crowded again? I felt like I was back in high school at one of those corney small block partys trying to get a mixed drink under the table. It got crowded way to quick, everyone was drunk to the point of throwing up, and yes my friends beer pong was played, along with pool and gossip. Woooo next time save your money on some drinks and realize that there is nothing here wait doesn't the name state that?
author: Sara N.

description:
Was once picked up by a guy here who first cut in front of my friend and I at the bar, then proceeded to tell me he has ADD but stopped taking his medication.  When we tried to leave he grabbed my arm, and told me to check craigslist the next day for the missed connections.  He did, in fact write one, and it was horrifying.  26 years old and could not tell the difference between you're and your. He also refered to me as "hella hot."  Clearly, a catch I failed to pick up. 

However, they have tables in the back for beer pong, and I always get the feeling I'm at a frat party, only slightly more fun.
author: Catherine K.

description:
Bar none, aka a little piece of hell on earth.  Rude staff is the start and then once you walk in it blossoms into something so much more.  Welcome to downtown Douche Central!  It's not really a bar, it's a frat house.  The crowd you'll find here has the IQ of room temperature, and every dude is convinced that every woman on earth is dying to shag them.

If that's your scene you will love it here.  If you're not a self righteous, ego tripped lost soul, it's probably not your scene.

However, with that said.  If you remove the common crowd, the bar is fine, and vaguely resembles a TGI Fridays, but if you're in this neck of the woods i'd hike up the hills to the Filmore and hang out Harry's bar and leave the Marina / Cow Hollow crowd down there to do their thing.
author: James W.

description: A place with Douchbags and beer pong...a good mix??...I don't think so.  They do, however, get that extra star just for the beer pong set-ups.
author: Patrick C.

description:
Post-college keg party.  It's like college never ended!  Dirty college caps, Tommy Hillfiger polos, Colehaan's, and a wrist band.  Girls walk around in gangs, talk smack, but do dress pretty nice.  $500 jeans and  stilettos.  Nice.

And you thought your beer pong skills would not be applicable in real life.  SURPRISE!   They seriously have multiple tables set up in the rear.  I will admit tho, the party does get pretty crackin'.  But remember how annoying keg parties got around 4AM?  Yeah, it's kinda like that at midnight.

$5 off cover if you wear your pledge pin.

1/20/08 update:  went for AFC playoffs.  yo, the buffalo wings suck eggs.  served COLD.  wth.  complained and they just nuked them up.  the pieces were pecker.  the tv's in there are old school fuzz (non-HD).
author: Isaac L.

description:
Soo.....THIS is what beer pong is all about. So last night after dinner, the Wed EATS (Eat And Talk Shit) foodie group is out on the town. So we stop in at Bar None to have a drink with some of Cookie's Kickball Teammates...... Sure...why the hell not!??!?

The place is underground and kindy dingy. The crowd was reminiscent of  college kids that still hadn't realized they had graduated?! Or had they!? So pear cider was on the menu...but they didn't have it...so I had the apple cider....tasted like crap honestly, but maybe cuz I have a refined palette and I was craving pear cider. Anywho....

I will say, Cookie (my roomie) was HIGHLY stoked that they have $8 pitchers of Miller High Life on Wed nights for Kickball Leaguers..... (Means NOTHING to me...) but Cookie was pretty excited about it.

The venue itself is spacious, with a huge bar and darts, pool tables and beer pong. Bartender was nice and attentive. But I probably would not make this a place I'd say,.."Hey guys! I know this GREAT bar we could go to...Bar None!" Nope...that won't be coming out of my mouth anytime soon...

But for those Marina folks....it looks like a good fit...

Now if only they could get rid of that dingy/dank smell....
author: Ann T.

description:
I was there with a girlfriend to hang out and have drinks. We ordered beer and fries. Some random guy came over uninvited and "helped him self" a handful of our fries. 

We told the bartender about the above incident and that we wanted to leave.... and they apologized and asked the fries stealer to pay for the fries. 

The bar owner gave us free shots and gave us another round of beer on the house. 

The crowd was ok... nothing to write home about but if you have good company, this is a great place to hang out at and have some fun.
author: Soham K.

description:
This was our last bar of the night and being that we walked 6 blocks I was glad to just relax.   Well after going downstairs this place was fairly packed, but not crazy. We got a pitcher and just hung out out inside for a bit before going outside. So the 2 girls stayed inside sitting at a table while all the guys were outside on the patio.  

Within minutes guys were just swarming like the women were the first they've seen in sometime.  Pretty funny to watch, but not for the girls.  And as others have stated these are some creepy types in here so we just walked up and stood there smiled and he just kept going. Once he realized what was going on, he decided to leave.  I guess I'm amazed at the crap that comes out of people's mouths.  I was never one to be a cheeky bastard like those I've seen at this bar.

A funny story about this night was my friend from NY was talking with this girl and they were into each other. He asks for her number after talking for a good 20 minutes, and she goes my boyfriend is right there but I'll give you my email.  LOL   They must not have to much fun together because we didn't see her talk with her boyfriend most of the night.
author: Chris G.

description:
OK, so I probably wouldn't spend a friday night here, but I went with a bunch of co-workers for happy hour and enjoyed $10 pitchers of chuggable domestic.  We played a few games of Beer Pong on the 4 tables they have devoted to the game.  They also have darts, pool, and pinball.  It's an awesome dive bar.  I will have to take people's word for the douchebag crowd on the weekends.

Got a good, cheap buzz.  Had a lot of fun.  Even ate some nice greasy sliders to help soak up the Bud Lite.  I agree with some of the other posters.  If you can't have any fun in here, then take a deep breath and inhale that farty goodness.  *FART* *SNIFF* "Ahhhh. . ."
author: matt c.

description:
I go to Bar None after our kickball team because they're nice enough to sponsor us. The bathrooms are decrepit, and the nonkickball patrons seem to be reliving their fraternity days. 

Good sliders, great pitcher specials, an outdoor area that I've taken an unreasonable shine to, but best of all, they let us play flip cup.
author: Kelly C.

description:
I'm horribly embarrassed to admit this...but, I've been to Bar None...  

twice...  

in one weekend.  

(This is why I have no photo.  I'm afraid people will cast stones of shame at me.)

Seeing as to how I've been oversaturated with the Bar None experience, I have some words of wisdom to impart to the 20-22 year olds who'll be at Bar None in the coming weeks:

*Beware of people who are 29-years-old and are still going to Bar None (and believe me, there are).  There's something wrong about 29-year-olds going to Bar None.  In fact, beware of people like me too -I'm way too damn old to be at Bar None!

*If you ignore 99% of the people at Bar None and play darts or Naked Photo Hunt, then you'll have a swell time!

*If you choose not to heed my above warnings...well, then brace yourself to enter the biggest toolshed in SF.  Oh and watch out for the bouncers, some of them just plain reek of "sketchy".
author: Ellen B.

description:
I shall provide the most dreadful review yet, for this local pub caters to mere whelps who posses neither the courage nor the wherewithal to embark upon real libations and their complementary sport!

How barbarous a sport is Beer Pong!

At Oxford, we happy few men of worth engaged in perilous Gin Sport and forced the cowards to succumb during rounds of manly games: Pickledally, Womper Roo, and Tally Whist.   

Oh, how that craven imp Francis B. H. Montague cried upon Culpepper's insufferable bosom when last I made mince meat pie of him during a bout of Tally Whist. At Bar None, one would chase gentle Fortune for years before witnessing a scene so described.

What spectacle, might my reader ask, will be seen during a game of Beer Pong at Bar None?

American athletes hoot and holler like common yahoos each time the ball sails upon the zephyrs and lands gently in a cup of ale.  Then said men-o-game belch in the face of ladies fair, before scratching their nether sides in an oafish manner. 

No glory, no chivalry, and hardly a touch of dignity about this mess.

Oh for the hills of Albion, that I might once again enjoy a real gentleman's game, and drink some frothy ale. This pub offers nothing.
author: Oliver P.

description:
A friend of mine once had sex in the bathroom with a girl ... he had just met.  Enough said.  Perfect for those that are young and randy.  Not so much so for anyone that desires a mature vibe or anything approaching scintillating conversation(at least on weekends).  

It can also be fun if you are with a big group and feel like playing beer pong while getting a little drunk and rowdy.  There is also great pizza next door at Extreme.  Just don't go often after the age of 25 and you'll be fine.
author: Ian D.

description:
I'm a part titme Marina boy and I just don't know about this place. 

I went to Bar None last weekend to catch the UNC vs LSU game and yeah I took LSU to win but I didn't thing Ty Lawson was goig to play. 

But anyway Service cool on the way in the door and they had a march madness special It was like half off everything!  I ordered up the buffalo wings and some buffalo sliders.   They were both pretty good but the sliders were outstanding!  I think the sourdough buns with garlic butter made them pop! 

As for the scenary it could use a little more light, a fresh sand and wax job and it alright . I can only imagine what this place might look like once the sun goes down.
author: Karim R.

description:
So when I'm too cheap to buy a ticket to AZ (like this weekend), I just visit Bar None.

There are at least 2-20 U of A alums here- That's University of Arizona for you Californian non pac 10 overseas-ers.

The sun rippened razzzberry lotion coupled with the beer coated floors makes me feel all collegiate on the inside.  Toss in a dose of Saturday afternoon beer breathe and I'm back
author: Larry C.

description:
Our fourth spot along the way during the DYL Marina Bar Crawl D-bag event is still ringing in my ears.

Beer Pong! Beer Pong! Beer Pong! 

When you first walk in, it looks like a normal bar, but as you go further inside, the scene gets rowdier.  I noticed another sausage fest in the front with creepy looking douche bags lingering around staring at all the ladies like lions circling deer.  There was a photo booth on the left in the back of the pub, two dart boards, and beer pong tables on the right.  In a room by itself, I saw 4 beer pong tables set up for competitive play.  When I went to the restroom, I saw a latrine and one bathroom stall with black and white walls.  Personally, I don't prefer latrines because 1)They always smell,  2)Everyone can size each other up, and 3)If somebody's drunk, prepare for a golden shower since he can't aim right.

On to the Beer Pong! Four tables were setup parallel to each other. Pitchers and plastic cups were flying everywhere.  10 plastic cups filled half way with beer on each end placed in a bowling pin configuration, one ping pong ball, and two players on each side.  The floor was soaked in beer and sweat, but no one really cared.  My sidekick and I had the pleasure of getting a good beat down by Jacob and Vy's precision aiming.  I swear there was something else inside three of the cups other than beer because the liquid was clear but yet it tasted like beer.  To be a gentleman, I agreed to drink most of the beer cups if the other team hit a goal. Yeah right, who was I kidding? I just wanted to get plastered!  The play was great fun and everyone did censored things to keep us from getting our ball in the opposing side's cups (I have pictures).  When a guy tried to stop our ball from rolling around the floor, he stepped on it and flattened it.  I went to the bar and got 2 more balls; one for play and one for keepsake.  

Attention! Attention!
I now hold a commemorative beer pong ball that will be for sale soon on Ebay... just kidding!

This was the first time I've even been to a beer pong pub. I've only seen it previously at a friend's house.  We all staggered out of Bar None and went onto our next bar, MatrixFillmore.
author: Hogan W.

description:
Come here if you want to get checked out up and down from the girls and guys, whether you're the fresh meat or the competition.

And if you do, some sartorial advice:

Girls: there had better not be a goddamn back on your top.
Guys: flip that collar up, son!

(for the record I was tricked into coming here by an old friend.)
author: Shannon V.

description:
Heyyyyyyy high school reunion!

Ok, so I'm TOTALLY too old for this place, but I had a fun/drunken time here on Saturday night. 

They have drink specials--$2 wells from 9-10pm. Love it!

Lauren, a fellow XO, is adorable! Espresso vodka--who knew?! So attentive.
author: Misha F.

description:
The beer is relatively resonably priced and there's beer pong in the back!


Unfortunately you have to get there pretty early in order to even think about playing.  
There's a plethora of frat guy types...as well as girls with no rhythm freak dancing each other to music by The Offspring and Beastie Boys in order to impress their boyfriends who just stand there and look like they don't quite get what's going on.  

And my last note: Why girls feel the need to get all decked out in their  fancy clothes to go play beer pong at a dive bar escapes me.
author: Jackee K.

description:
1 star because (and only because) I had to give it SOMETHING... The average denizen here is less than 21, of that I am almost sure.  You know why this is stupid, wrong and ironic?  Not because they're less than the asinine drinking age in this country (c'mon, WHICH 21 yo is a booze virgin?), but because the brain-deficient bouncer makes this mini-production of checking one's ID at the entrance -- HA!  Ludicrous.  I like flattery as much as the next person, but please don't insult my intelligence, you evolutionary throwback.  
And what's that game that people play here with the beer and the ping pong table -- beer pong? beirut??  whatever... it should be banned outside of frat parties happening IN frat houses.
But... if you can stand it, this is the place to go when seeking a discovery channel-like show, on the mating behavior of 'the loud and the witless'.
author: Godot -.

description: I was extremely drunk at this point, but even then I know when I'm in an awful place.  The bar smelled terrible like someone had peed all over it, which was probably the floor since walking inside was like pulling velcro apart.  All I wanted to do was play some beer pong but the horrid stench and relation of the tables to the bathrooms turned me around very quickly.
author: Mark H.

description:
On Saturday afternoons, this place rocks.  Beer pong, super great gin and tonics, at an even more super price and a crowd that doesn't mind hooligans too much - I'm there!  

Saturday evenings are much different, not as laid back, many people trying to out-cool the next in a crowded throng of seemingly desperate striped-shirts.  Meh.

Bottom line: I like it in the sunshine hours.
author: Beth G.

description:
I used to come here in High School - so, we know how 'cool' this review is going to be.

If you're in High School or maybe the early college years, great place to easily get into.  Always brimming with Abercrombie and Stripped-Shirt clad boys* (not men).

Nice place for a lady to go if you need a little confidence pick-up.  I have never been here and not be vigorously hit-on.  No, it's not me and I'm not bragging, it's the crowd.

I've seen people fall here and once puked on the steps.  Fun, if that's your thang - I believe they even have beer-pong on Thursday nights.  This Bar is definitely age-restricted and I'm 23.
author: Lauren G.

description:
I've been here a few times... People from the mid-west seem to love this place when they come into town.  Just a bar - minus the good music, good drinks and good looking crowd.  Without that trifecta of happiness, what's the point?

Last time I went in was a Tuesday.  Including the staff, there were about 10 people in the whole place.  Typical for a week night most places, just a few regulars.  We played a little pool, looked up, and my friends jacket was stolen from off the back of a chair.  Who steals a jacket from the back of a chair in an empty bar?  A Bar None regular, that's who.  Enjoy the jacket, chump... a pox on your house.
author: Anthony R.

description:
If you like sweaty frat guys, trasher girls, and  cocky bartenders, your're gonna love this place. 

The only cool thing is the fact that you can play  beer pong in the back.  It get's old quickly though. 

Booo Bar none/ Em Phasis on the NONE

Ehem...I played kickball last season, and while I still think this place is not that cool. It is fun on Wednesday night if you're on a kickball team.

Flip cup and beer pone with your close teamates.

Beating the team that may have just kicked your ass on the kickball field, but you can whoop them in a game of true skill, Flip cup.

25 cent wings. Gooood.
author: Adam L.

description:
Boo.

The staff is actually pretty cool. But the clientele makes me hate my neighborhood. It's pretty bad to get excited when you see a Brother in a bar. I have a million anecdotes of why this bar should always be avoided, but my favorite is when we stumbled in after a day of Bay to Breakers drinking. My husband, myself and our roomate were playing darts and my roomate started getting hit on (harassed) by some wasted chick. She could barely stand and we propped her up. This lovely lady's interpretation of flirting was to give us a full frontal flash. Wearning no underwear.
author: Jackie B.

description:
Fun for beirut.  But that's it.
Showed up with my friend a few weeks ago, and the bouncer gave her shit for wearing checkered vans.
author: Mira B.

description:
1 star for Flip Cup last night, 1 star for darts last night, and the final star for being 2 blocks from where I live.

Ok, so normally I avoid this place like the plague...since I do live in the Marina and after awhile the whole crowded frat boy bars kind of lose their luster after the 1st time you've been there.

I know I know...playing flip cup and beer pong is really kind of college frat boy like - but it can still be fun once you get over that little fact :)
author: Sam H.

description:
I went here years ago with some roommates at the time. They were former sorority girls, so this was the perfect place for them. Sometimes you gotta go with the crowd. Those times are really unfortunate.

A newly-divorced forty-ish male approached one of my roommates. He struck up a conversation with her. The rest of us hung around to back her up/see what he was all about. He offered to buy her a drink and she agreed.

"I bet he buys you a Slippery Nipple," I remarked.

I was right. 

Damn. I hate this place.
author: Mark G.

description:
Beer Pong, Beer Pong, and more Beer Pong!!!

Ever wish you could relive your college days? You know, the ones spent drinking in your friends garage with a ping pong table and a keg? Well, look no further than Bar None! (*Note: If this doesn't sound like the kind of college experience you had, DON'T COME HERE! We don't like your type anyway!) The bar itself is a little cramped, but there are a few pong tables downstairs to play on, if you get there early enough!

The one thing that I REALLY didn't like about it was the mess that the beer pong games made. I walked out of there with about 2 inches of beer on the bottom of my jeans from the "play room". Again, though, it's nice to relive those college days!!!
author: Heather T.

description: I love beirut so I had high hopes for this place.  The crowd was meh on a saturday night, but I won't hold that against the bar.  What was completely unacceptable were the bouncers who came around at 1:46, totally napoleon-complexed-out, screaming at the patrons to leave.  I don't care how drunk people are or how much you hate your life because you're making $7/hour kicking people out of bars, but this was ridiculous.  I saw them literally scream at some girl because she took more than 30 seconds to leave the place after last call.  There are too many other options in this city, I won't go back here...
author: Katie P.

description:
Look, Bar None is what it is.

Yes, when you have beer pong and drinking games, you going to have a bunch of drunken ex-frat dudes in there playing them. That's what you should expect. 

Would you rather get rid of the drinking games and for them to increase booze prices? That's what it would take to change the demographic. I can hardly imagine people in slacks all dressed up from dinner to come in and play beer pong. I mean... it's the whole marketing angle, and they do it well.

It's a meat market and a sloshfest, and that's what it's supposed to be. Lose the pretension with the reviews, people. If it's not your bag, don't go. I'll still pop in there from time to time, because it can be fun.

If you're into trying to be classy and want to spend more on your cocktails, go somewhere else...
author: Dan P.

description:
been here a few times, sort of like a bad re-creation of worse college parties. drinks used to be good, but the last few times ive been, they were quite stingy on the booze:mixer ratio--too much sour mix and its waaay not worth it. 
its fun if you wanna play beer pong or flip cup or a random game of buck hunter. or if you want to re-live your college frat days :)
author: Rachael B.

description:
Tim the bartender is the best.  Leave before ten p.m. or risk
1. Making out with a random Marina boy
-or-
2. Getting sucked into a vortex of the puke and rally crowd
author: Mimi S.

description:
I know fully well what to expect when going to Bar None: meat heads, air heads, sticky floors, and 3 men to each woman, no wait.. that is another man.  

However, if you get there early and secure a beer pong table it's a great place to start the night with cheap pitchers and good bar music.  I usually take visiting friends here because well.. it's a unique bar theme if nothing else.  I would give it five stars before 9pm and two stars after.
author: Ryder M.

description:
This place is crazy. Not the good kind of crazy... The place generally is packed with a bunch of hot, sweaty guys, trying to pick up chicks. Completely uncool. Let me setup the scene. It's 11:30 PM, and two dudes with pink and yellow Polo shirts with their collar up sporting Gucci sunglasses. They stand out  like a sort thumb yet they think they are so cool. The place is like a bit fat frat house with a pool table in the back (typical), and beer pong matches. 

The drinks are mildly strong, and the bartenders pour the worse liquor unless you ask for specifically. 

I would advise not to waste your time here unless you are here to get hammered.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Ah, to be a working professional and to get away from the annoying college drama.  Oh wait, people at Bar None must not have got the memo that they're not in college anymore.  I've come with friends several times and have been appalled by the way guys treat girls here and the several times I've witnessed girls vomiting in the bathroom early in the evening. It's almost like the people here just got out of mom and dad's house and can drink "for real" now.  I like having fun and going out, but when the clientele is this annoying it really puts a damper on one's evening.

The only semi-redeeming quality is the option to play beer pong or flip cup without messing up my own house.  Other than that, stay away if you do not like kids who act like they're still in college.
author: Jessica C.

description:
This place is foul and overpriced.  

The men here, too, are foul...and yet...cheap?  How does that work!!  

I've had to call over staff multiple times to get creepy guys to stop harassing me and my friends.

P.S. you can play beer pong at your own house, why would you spend hella money on a pitcher at this poop bar?
author: Ryan S.

description: Worst bar ever. Horrible service, shitty clientele, awful drinks. Terrible atmosphere. Will never return.
author: Will R.

description: The people that work there are cool. But, it's the atmosphere that drags it down. Really crowded and full of rowdy, reckless people. You probably could find a better place elsewhere.
author: Dechawuthi D.

description: I went to Bar None last night to celebrate my friends birthday. I wish there was more then one pool table. The bar service wasnt that bad for being the only one in such a large place. loved the idea of beer pong!! The crowd was young-ish slightly annoying. All and all i had a good time =)
author: Tania A.

description:
Maybe 3 stars, depending on your mood...
If you want to feel like you're back in college, in a frat house, surrounded by other people that probably did live in a frat house while in college (or still are in college), then Bar None is the place for you (complete with a pool table and a disgustingly dirty beer pong/beirut room in the back). 
If not, I'd advise you to steer clear.
author: Rachel L.

description:
First of all, I must reply to Bill who said that beer pong should be played with a paddle-- what type of person would transform a perfectly good drinking game and make it even more complicated? Paddles?! It's like the Ivy League version of a perfectly brainless drinking game. Why don't we also start playing Beer Croquet instead? Or Beer Polo, and instead of riding horses around, you just find the local fat bitch at the bar and strap a saddle on her! 

I digress. The bar is fun and it gets you into a lot of trouble. Everytime I've been here I get in some stupid argument about who was "in line" for the next table... then as opposed to fighting, I challenge them to a simple duel with ping pong balls, a set a half filled plastic beer cups lined up in a pyramid, and NO paddles. After thoroughly running them out of the bar and taking their manhood, I proceed to challenge everyone else in the bar. 

I then wake up the next morning in some sort of stupor, luck to not be in a alley, and banished to the bathroom the entire day. It's a curse to be so gifted at this sport. Yes Sport. Even without paddles. 

Mmm... I smell Bar None right now... beer and puke. That's the ticket.
author: Tim Y.

description:
If there were ever a prize for worst bar in the city this dump should  be crowned prize pig.  This place sucks.  The atmosphere sucks.  The prices suck.  There is even a sucky wait to go in and have a sucky time.  

Conclusion: If you ever wish to be assured of the decline western civilization this toilet is your first stop.

note: I had no choice I had to give it a star
author: ray M.

description:
So I'd have a couple of drinks at a bar down the street, and had sort of adjusted to the fact that I was in the Marina. As I got to the bar, which is built like a literal Frat House, I started to realize how very little I fit in, in the whole neighborhood. I don't hold it against the bros, it's not their fault. I came to their hood. 

It was very much like a college party movie, way too many duders looking for an excuse to show off their testosterone overages. Majority of girls had the perma-sneer of the ex cheerleader who works in reception after earning a masters in liberal arts.

I'd avoid the place if you aren't part of this crowd. If you are, have at it... they've got beer pong! ... if you're into beer pong.
author: Mckay W.

description:
This could be such a cool bar, yet it fails to impress.  I stopped playing beer pong not long after graduating college and my idea of a good time isn't challenging Cal geeks to a match (and then getting my ass kicked).  Nor is my idea of a good time being in a place so loud I can't even hear myself think (I'm sounding like my Mom, geez).  And I certainly don't like having to elbow my way through crowds to get from one end of the bar to the other.  There were a handful of attractive people there, but not enough to warrant going back.  
     As for the hook up scene, oh, it's there allright.  Just don't be picky and it wouldn't hurt to be drunk.
author: Mike R.

description: If you wear popped collars, or maybe 2 collared shirts at the same time, spike your hair, and swear you don't do steroids then you've found your little piece of heaven. All the bad things you hear about the Marina come true at bar none, terrible place...even with good company.
author: Nate E.

description: Good casual place to hang out, but parking is not good at all, you will either be walking a lot of blocks down the street if you don't pay for parking or get lucky and find someone leaving.  Drinks are okay there is backroom area where you can play beer pong and darts.  But the bar itself is okay if you just like to hang out in a casual crowd more of a place for younger people to hang out.
author: Alice T.

description:
Everyone seems to write one of two reviews for this place, so let me do that too:
1) This place is fun because its one of the few places in the city you can play beer pong even though you have to deal with the Marina douchebags that flood this place, especially late at night. As long as you can avoid these people and the frat dog girls that they attract you can have fun here. You must come early.
2) This place is for immature frat boys and typical Marina douches. Be drunk and show up late or you're gonna have a bad time. Great place to get drunk and get in a fight in the same night. Not at all a great scene.

They are both right. I like the fact that its fun to play beer pong and they will play country music on the jukebox, something few places in the city do. This place is a paradox.
author: Matt C.

description: Ok so this place isn't the tidiest, the bathrooms are pretty gnar, BUT (and this is a HUGE but [no pun intended]) this place is pretty awesome.  I go here after kickball - and by the fact that I play kickball you can make assumptions about the kind of person I am (awesome) - and we tear this place up.  I love the bartenders, the tots and all of the other food is great and cheap, and you can do whatever the hell you want here.  There is absolutely -one million pretentiousness, and if you find it at all pretentious than you are most likely pretentious.  Yes there are lame marina frat boys, but hell - they know how to have a good time.  If they had a functioning bathroom with toilet paper/paper towels/a toilet seat than I would have given it a 4 but those are simple corrections (although they haven't had any of these for years and years).
author: Daniella S.

description:
I have a problem. A beer pong problem. I can't get enough of it. Yes, I am a working professional, but damnit, drinking and competition are a winning combination.

The trick to Bar None is to get here early enough (9ish) to snag a table in the back with your buddies. When the place finally fills up, you'll be drunk enough that it won't matter that every former sorority girl and frat guy within a 5 mile radius hits up this bar. 

Minus two stars for almost losing my ID once - bartender wasn't especially nice. Best to stick to the games and avoid the bar.
author: Devon S.

description:
This place sure is crowded for only two stars!  

Yes, it can get crowded, and yes, people can get a little over the top while trying to relive their college days, but all in all, the staff is nice (yay Chuck) the bouncers always say hello to a friendly face (hooray Carlton), and the bartenders make yummy drinks!  

Beer pong is fun, but I prefer it on a week night, when the place is not so crowded.  Also, the bathroom could be cleaner, but really, besides that, the place gets four stars!
author: Marta C.

description:
cheap drinks and beer pong. If that's what you want then that's what you will get here. This place attracts a high concentration of typical Marina frat guys so be ready for what that brings. I give it one star for having beer pong, that's it. Thankfully I was with a good group of people. 

I felt like I was right back in college which is fine but why can't they just keep the damn bathrooms clean like other bars do around the city??? i mean cmon. 

Some people never left the immaturity of college partying and bar none is where those people go to hang out.
author: Shawn A.

description:
Is it me or is everyone 19 in this bar? It sure seems that way.

These people don't know how to drink. It's like high school all over again.
author: Bip B.

description:
A college bar for young people who want to play beer pong.  But this college bar has older, better dressed people.

I will go here again, there is nothing really wrong with it.  It is just what you make of it, and it does have a lot of potential.

No matter how bad of reviews it gets, everyone still goes there and it can get packed.  So obliviously, we still all go there, even when Yelp doesn't recommend it.  Where is the failure?

Who is the girl singing?
author: Julie R.

description:
Beer pong!  Can I just say that again - beer pong!  Okay, so ... I guess you can tell that I miss the ol' college days of drinking and beer spilling and not caring. Where drinking and having a good time reigns supreme over looking cool at a bar.

Tons of young, good looking people here. Everyone knows that this is the spot to be. And if you come early enough, you can catch everyone looking hot. Come any later and you'll see them at their worst (i.e. bring your flack jacket). 

And yes! this is a meat market, but I don't know ... sometimes you don't mind it in some places than in others. Or else it's just the beer talking from being lousy at beer pong.
author: Lorraine D.

description:
Ugh. What a shithole.  Walk on in if you'd like to be assaulted by wave upon wave of belligerent ex-frat boys and coked-out sorostitutes.

Seriously people, at some point, you do have to grow up. To the fellow in the powder blue Giants cap and obscure throwback jersey talking up his sick surfing moves and CSU Long Beach Education: Sorry. My friend wasn't buying it. Stupid just turns her off.

At one point, I heard the words "Let me give you a lap dance." I turned around to find my friend shoved up against a wall with an absolutely piss-drunk persian fellow grinding his crotch on my friend's leg. My friend's face was stuck in a silent expression of horror, her eyes screaming, "Get me out of here!"  We left shortly after.

Ugh.
author: Zachary S.

description:
I'm a dive bar fan. This place kinda sucks.

If you want to get hit on by a guy who refuses to make eye contact with you because he's scanning the room for someone hotter, then by all means. 

If you want to be ignored by the super hot bartender in favor of a bunch of loud idiots at the other end of the bar then be my guest. 

If you want to wait in the bathroom to wash your hands behind a bunch of 28 year old chicks rambling to each other about their friends like they're in high school, then this is your place. 

Its redeeming quality? Boddingtons on tap. Otherwise, I'll get drunk elsewhere, thanks.
author: Jennifer O.

description: Kinda expensive. Kinda sketch. Mostly drunk college guys playing beer pong but a few older creepers lurking for college girls.
author: Teresa G.

description: IF you have been to the one in NYC then you know what to expect. The wings are some of the SF's best (would be average if in NYC). It is a fratty bar (beruit, pitchers, jager bombs, loud drunk people, etc), so if that is not your scene then this is not the place for you. Don't come here and whine about it being fratty, accept it for what it is.
author: Jeremy N.

description: Went once when I very first moved into the city...and not knowing any better! Met some "friends" here, later renounced them as friends. Got talked to by the lamest of the douche, had to watch/listen to every bro in the bar fist pumping to every ballad known to man. Oh and my favorite jacket was stolen. Sweet bar. This place is honestly so bad that when I met my now boyfriend, and mentioned going here without knowing what it was like, he figured I was "a lot of work" and never called me! Yes, a bar so bad, it almost ruined a relationship that hadn't even begun yet.
author: Afton T.

description:
Met a group of friends here to play some BP and to be honest, beer pong is without a doubt the only thing this place has going for it. Hard to say at a bar of all places, but I wasn't impressed with it and it wasn't cheap either. Unless you're enthralled with beer pong and $10 pitchers of Miller Lite, I'd avoid it. It's the DIVE in dive bar.

Don't get me wrong, I had a great time at this place, but yikes...

Oh, and the bathrooms are bad...really bad, and I'm a guy.
author: Jory M.

description: I would give this place 1 star if it wasn't for their cool bartenders. I'm not a big fan of the douchey individuals who tend to flock here so I don't tread these waters often. I actually had a great time here for the Union Street Fair because the crowd was much more diverse and down to earth than usual, that is, until I lost/got my phone stolen in the bathroom. I wrote them an e-mail the next day asking if they had found my phone or if anyone had turned it in, but they never contacted me back to even just say no. A little consideration would have been nice but I guess I can understand that they might not be used to having a decent customer who isn't a total prick. Just when I started to not think so badly about this place they kinda ruined it for me.
author: Heather U.

description:
This bar is fairly large.. and it has some things that are awesome about it and not so awesome about.. so i will break it down real quick... 
AWESOME: they have 6 stalls and 2 sinks in the bathroom... they serve food there... $12 pitchers on tuesday nights... lots of bartenders working so the wait for a drink is minimal.. they have beer pong.. funny signs such as beware of pickpocketers and loose woman hahaha.. and cold bottled beer... thats a big one for me 
NOT AWESOME: no seat covers for the toilets.. i have an issue about that.. when im drunk my hover technique is not up to par and i want seat cover so i can sit and relax while peeing! also tiny tiny stalls.. like i dont know how people who are bigger can fit cause its so tiny.. the place looks kinda dirty and yes i even understand its a bar.. but it looks EXTRA dirty.. the bar is really sticky.. this is a young crowd.. like im going to sing at the top of my lungs to every song kind of crown.. all i heard were girls singing, "i like big butts and i cannot lie!" people u r in public.. and its not sexy in the slightest.. i mean i dunno.. i think this is a bring a big group place to be honest.. i will not wear heels here next time since i was sticking to the floor.. and god only knows what was on that floor.. i saw a chick getting "loved" next to the bathroom.. haha gross i just remembered that.. i may return.. this is a toss up..
author: Ashley M.

description:
If youre looking for some quality day drinking on the weekend...Bar None is the place to be.  Good times, drinking games and cheap beers.

Typically too packed on weekend nights, and the crowd can be hot or miss
author: Ken S.

description:
When Im in the mood to get retarded.. or I've had to much to drink at Bluelight and I've decided its time to venture across the street to bar none to challange my friends in some beer pong (yeah I called it fucking beer pong.. deal with it).. this is where I head..

I dont think I'd enjoy this place sober.. but then again Ive never stepped foot in it sober... and I've never conciously walked out of it.. I typically enter.. then magically appear in my bed fully clothed face down the next morning.. its like a magic trick..
author: Oliver S.

description:
3.6.2007
11:00PM

Cool spot on Tuesday night; still your typical Marina crowd but manageable.  Not as many striped shirts, not as many high fives; just people getting drunk...on a Tuesday Night...and that's alright with me.  

Beirut = cool.
Jukebox = cool.
PBR by the can = cool.

and that's about it....I usually avoid the Marina altogether but last night was fun.  Maybe I was just too drunk to notice anything that would usually send pangs in my stomach...

I'll go again if I have to.
author: William R.

description:
Just like a frat party but with only half the attitude.

We didn't have a chance to play beer pong, but got invited to join a rousing game of flip cup instead. I'll never say no to a free beer, even if I have to work a little for it, so I was pretty psyched.

The drinks are a little pricey for a 'college bar', but this is San Francisco so what are you going to do.
author: Jesse E.

description:
Why to come? You want to re-live your college years.  Or you like to wear your frat/sorority t-shirts somewhere and have it be acceptable attire.  Or you like you some beer pong ... or just consuming massive amounts of beer ... or getting really really drunk really really fast.  Or playing darts (always a good idea when incredibly drunk people are packed in).

Why not?  People throw up on the walls/hallway leading to the bathroom like it's a socially acceptable, nay, fashionable thing to do.

As another Yelper said, I love to hate this bar.
author: Kristen H.

description:
I am going to add to what Johnson H. said...if you answer "yes" to all of the below then go
Do you like men that are 18 and only talk to women that bounce and giggle?
Do you enjoy bitchy bartenders that only serve you if your a hot male?
Are you a tool?
author: Laura J.

description: Oh Blerf... this is not a destination bar but rather a staggering after thought. I agree with megans review and it attracts the 20ish douche scene. The bar was dead on wed @ 10 pm and the security and bartender were lame and unfriendly. However, the place got crowded after 11 and my friends and I dominated the "Beruit pong" tables. I ran into some old friends and met some graduate students and french tourists. So, overall i had a positive experience with the crowd. But the sanitation of the bathrooms is atrocious! Sadly, i'll prob return :)
author: Alex S.

description:
It's definitely for a younger crowd.

They have beer pong, 21 year old chicks, and lots of alcohol. What's not to like?

I'm getting old, so now it's only 4 stars, when I was u25 I'd give it 5.

Funny Story: I went there with some friends and brought my wife and we bumped into every single girl/dated  from college (literally 15 girls that all knew me well), plus my ex-GF from before college. Needless to say it was a rough night for me after we left...
author: Isaac N.

description:
Bar None is one of those places that you sometimes can't resist. Yes, most of the crowd is the sorority/frat type BUT if you look past those there's a good mix of other groups too. I always see a few hipsters, a few hip-hoppers, and the always fun tourists. 

I've learned if you make friends with the staff, it'll make your time even more enjoyable.
author: nicole l.

description:
Shoot, 
I thought you could give no stars. This place licks brutal ass, and I mean brutal just smelly, foul, possibly the most ruthless ass.

 I don't what else to say. People here say that it has an LA crowd to it. No. At least in LA the people don't smell. There are way too many frat type guys here that feel a need to wear a shitty baseball hat to this place. Keep the hat for an actual Giants game. Dude seriously you are not going to hook it up like that. I hate button ups. 

If this were LA at least people would be dressed a little better, and the women... at least you could mooch off of a cougar or even look at some fake boobs when you get bored. Its more like a San Diego crowd where everyone is too scared to be a little less like the guy next to him or girl for that matter. Seven guys rollin to one place all wearing striped button ups makes me very upset. The bartenders? I'm tired of yelping

Their potty has urine as its wallpaper. When you get home make sure you take off your shoes because you have urine on them. :(
author: Ash D.

description:
DON'T EVER GO TO BAR NONE!!!

At this bar, the staff members like to take their customers' credit cards and buy pizza next door.  This place is whack.  Enter at your own risk.  Honestly if u go inside you are only wasting minutes of your life.
author: elena g.

description:
i was 23 and staying in SF for the summer when i went to Bar none the first time in june 07. The friends i made in san francisco just a month earlier invited me to go hang out and drink with them. didn't think this was anything special. Definitely not the best place in the Marina district. It was over-crowded and the bathrooms and prices sucked ass out of a straw! 

Would give it 1 star for quality. The only reason i give it 2 is because despite that low-quality bar none, it was still a fun night due solely to my relatively new friends at the time...miss those days =(
author: Tony V.

description: Going to this bar is like going back to college. Loud, messy, beer pong tables and fun people. We had a great time but it wouldn't be my first choice on most occasions. It's a great place for bar hopping in the Marina  though, and has a fun, casual vibe. Come with young people who are feeling rowdy, not looking for a classy night out.
author: Margo W.

description:
I give Bar None a FIVE because where else can you go and play Beer Pong at a Bar now and days.  This bar is a classic Bar that is very laid and relaxed.  Perfect to have a drink with some friends in a very casual atmosphere.  

This bar is unique because of the underground entrance that's invovled in getting to the bar.  You have to walk down about 4 feet stairway and in a very secluded and relaxed atmosphere you can enjoy watching a game or just talking to friends.   

Bar None's most popular hours start at 10:30 to 11:00 pm that's when everyone starts coming.
author: Nicholas B.

description:
This is the place for looking like a drunken pig on Wed nights...sadly.  Playing beer pong can be great, but fighting your way through all the kick ballers can be a pain.  $10 pitchers of cheap beer, really cheap wings, pool, and beer pong can still pick up the night sometimes.  

I've been warned away on from going on a weekend.
author: Brian H.

description:
As others have said... total high school jump-back... filled with a bunch of testosterone filled men... and mostly brain dead chicks... I suppose I should include mysefl in the brain dead part, because after any amount of time there, anyone in their right mind would become numb. I am embarassed to say that I went... And for the amount I threw down on drinks... I  should of felt a little more than... next to nothing. 

They call it "Bar None" for a reason...
author: Miss B.

description:
I spent a lot of time and financial aid money in this bar during law school.... I have no idea why.

Here's the deal: if you're white, roll with yo colla up, own Nickelback CDs and think Animal House was based on your life.. this is the place for you!

I liked the dive bar vibe, beer pong, darts, buffalo wings, small outdoor area and the bartenders/staff.

Didn't like the subtle and sometimes not so subtle racist remarks from other patrons, the steep steps heading down to the bar that I nearly killed myself on a number of times and the way too disgusting bathrooms...

I still give it 2 stars b/c my buddies and I still had a lot of fun nites there...
author: R P.

description: This is a solid bar to watch football on the weekends.
author: Scoot S.

description: excellent spot to execute a game of beer pong to prove how "good" you are, without needing to procure your own equipment because they provide a ton of plastic cups and balls. there are 3 spaced out tables in the back room (and there's always at least one available if you go before 9) and pitchers are like $12. i don't come here for anything other than the occasional urge to play (and lose) a few games of beer pong.
author: Jessica C.

description:
How could you not love this place? It's college all over again...cheesy 80s music, cheap beer, that weird "party" smell, everyone looking to get blacked out. Sure you could go to some wine bar or have a hauty dinner at Michael Minna or Gary Danko, but they definitely don't have the let-loose nature of Bar None. 

The only people who would dislike this place is someone who never really partied in college, or was/is some lame engineer. You have your entire life to be boring and hang out with old people in some quiet bar...enjoy your youth while it lasts, and it definitely exists to please (and party) here.
author: Mike T.

description: If I could have given this place zero stars I would have. I went there on Saturday to watch the Giants game. Yes I knew it had been a crazy fun day in the Marina so people would be totally wasted. But having your "bouncer" throw a beer bottle at a fight isn't my cup of tea. I was standing in the lower area of the bar outside and the bouncer who was fixing the plumbing (I didn't know "bouncers" fixed toilets but okay) decided he needed to throw a beer bottle at some guy that was in a fight... glass went everywhere including HITTING me in the face. Hello when your a huge bouncer shouldn't you be okay to get in the middle of a fight or whatever and just throwing something? I was completely in shock... I went up to the bouncer to just be like uhhh WTF and he wouldn't even look at me. My boyfriend went inside to try to talk to a manager and the manager didn't even want to talk to him, a very classy way to act. Overall the worst bar I have ever been to... glass in the face = a horrible time.
author: Lindsey M.

description: Dirty place, nothing fun or unique. Bar tender spit in sink right in front of us at bar. Disgusting place avoid at all cost!
author: L G.

description: pretty gross place to play beer pong at, but its the only bar ive ever been to with a legitimte beer pong area, so lets play!
author: Charlton Y.

description:
okay, so im usually a pretty nice guy and its hard to get beneath my skin, unless im drunk and then its easy...

therefore, coming to bar none, semi-inebriated, made for an interesting evening. before i could even pull out my wallet i heard someone yelll 'BRAH'...and then 'DOGGG'. Sigh...why did my just-turned-21-legal-cousin want to come here in the first place. Okay, so im not THAT much older, but i do know that bar none is the quintessential "Frat-away-from-the-Frat...." Guys and gals come here to dive back into college mode and get in a few games of 'beer pong'.
WAIT, beer pong involves paddles and a net...dont you mean 'beirut'. If one is to play drinking games, at least get the fuckin name of it right!!! 
Im not going to put my hands in the air and yell frantically when my boy sinks a quarter into my cup, ill drink it, and scream obnoxiously when someone pulls the 7 in kings cup. yadadaamean?! 

if your looking to take shots of jager and get in a few games of beer pong, scratch that, beirut, Bar None is your spot.
author: Jason W.

description: Everything exists because someone wills it so. I want to know who's responsible for Bar None is so they can be told to never breed. I know that's harsh but over a hundred reviews seriously dis it, I'm just trying to save you. Do we really need to extend the frat years beyond college? Yeah, beer pong and darts may seem cool but you have to deal with the often belligerent, meat-head clientele. Places like this are the reason why people hate on the Marina. Never again.
author: Ligaya T.

description: 2 stars because I appreciate it for keeping these people within its walls, it keeps its customers off the streets and keeps them from going places I prefer to go.  Something to be said for that.  If there were no BarNone's, these people would be overrunning *your* club.
author: Jack H.

description: I was coerced into playing wing-woman here last night for a cute, barely nubile coworker friend of mine.  My extreme annoyance and inner seething softened after the first cocktail and by the third, I am pretty certain a large, strapping Irishman picked me up and intended to carry me out the door and back to his cave.  Were it not for my sharp wit and biting reparte, I'm sure that same Irishman would be dragging me around by my hair right now.  Actually, that's kind of hot.
author: vicarious c.

description:
the last [and hopefully final] time in bar none, i had to use the restroom.  now i have used port-o-potties, train toilets, and been known to pop a squat when in dire straights.  but nothing can prepare you for the bar none "bathroom".  it is a black den of sewage hell.  stall doors don't close, the sink rarely works, there are no soap/towels, and 2 of the toilets are always not working and 2 of the toilets always have someone in them with their heels towards the door [we all know what that means].

so for 10 minutes, i wait in line listening to the swarm of 30-somethings dolled up in their forever 21 satin-polyester blend babydolls+leggings+stiletto's complain about how they can't find a decent man.  i resist my the temptation to point out the obvious, that they are in BAR NONE, but alas, my bladder is in charge here and there was no time for common sense.

finally i reach the stall.  i'm done.  the search for toilet paper begins.  the toilet paper dispenser has been ripped off the wall [of course] and is sans any usable paper product.  turn around to the seat cover dispenser; also empty.  i look down and between my stall and the next one is a fair sized scrap of toilet tissue.  i ponder for a few moments, "am i really going to pick up a piece of slightly dampened toilet paper from the bathroom floor of bar none, and use it?".  i did.  don't tell anyone.

and i realized -- that experience sums up my feelings about bar none.  b-none is the scrap of toilet paper on the ground in the san francisco bar scene which is the bathroom.  you say to yourself i wouldn't ever go there, i wouldn't ever stoop that low.  but alas, you somehow find yourself in such a situation, playing beer pong, reminding yourself that this is why i don't live in the marina, and pretending the whole thing never happened.
author: Kat S.

description:
I had fond memories of beer pong from back in the good old college days...  I remember the laughs and drunken debauchery that came with it, that said I am only about three years removed from college, and it could be because I'm getting older, or it could be that I no longer desire to drink a beer with a ping pong ball floating in it that had on the previous turn been on a floor that who knows how many patrons have walked on in this area, it doesn't help that the bathroom is only about 10 feet away from the beer pong area.  Regardless, if beer pong is your thing and you rationalize that the alcohol will kill any potential strains of bacteria, bar none would be a worthy stop.  Don't get me wrong, I liked beer pong...  in college, I liked to play it...  in the comfort of my or a friend's house, mainly because if I am going to ingest bacterias and other weird crap, I would prefer to do it in an environment of my own or one of people I generally know.  I can see flaws in this logic, but I digress.  

Moving on the bar had a decent selection of beers (can't compare to the east coast bars in that...)  and the woman at the taps was very nice and was explaining the flavor of a certain beer that none of us heard of, it was loud, so we could barely hear here, but I saw the head nod and smile from her.  She did a good job pour my buddies Guinness, as well.  They do have a dart board section as well, we ended up playing that while having drinks, nothings better then combining alcohol in a small area, with lots of people and sharp pointy things.  It is worth mentioning that the men's room doesn't have a traditional urinal, some people may not know what I am describing, but it is essentially a long trough (If you used the bathrooms at a Oakland Raider game you'll know what I'm talking about.).  This long trough has no partitions so essentially if it is busy and you need to go you will stand shoulder touching shoulder as 3-4 people try to do their business there, I wouldn't have a problem with it, except the guy next to me was really plastered, to the point his head was leading towards the shoulder of the guy directly to his right and his stance was swaying, I saw this and tried to hasten my business because I didn't want to me caught in his splash show should he start pointing to me...  And I am sure as I write this, R Kelly jokes are sure to follow...  

Besides this little bathroom misadventure, make sure to stop by and take a photo op next to the ping pong, sorry, let me correct myself, the BEER PONG dispenser by the bar.
author: Chris T.

description: Looking for a frat party? Just pop into Bar None and it will feel like college all over again. Not just any college, but the college of beer pong. Be prepared to drink yourself silly as for there are no rules at this quality joint. The bar staff is of age, as of yesterday and the roaring school boys are on the prowl for some fresh meat. But dont worry ladies, accept the drink and poor it under the bar. No one will notice!
author: Dee C.

description: I'm surprised this bar had so many negative reviews considering it was PACKED when I went last friday.  And everyone I talked to in there was like "I hate this place."  I'm beginning to think everyones just ashamed to admit that they like coming here.  I had a good time pretending to play darts and pretending to drink beer.  I couldve done without the beer pong situation.  I felt like I was in college at some dirty frat house drinking beer with a dirty ball rolled around it only its even DIRTIER cause we're at a bar.  I didn't think the people sucked as most thought, they were nice.  Most people said its a bar for douche bags... I guess I could be a douche bag too.
author: Tiffany L.

description: I cannot really decide if I like this place or I don't. I came here on Valentine's Day with some friends since it was a day off the following Monday. It wasn't super packed but the crowd that was there was great and definitely looking to have a good time. I liked the fact they had about 4-5 beer pong tables in the back which always makes for a great time.
author: Kunal K.

description: Do not go here if you are over 22. I think my sister said it well when she said 'You would have to put a stink bomb up my nose to make me go to Bar None.' Enough said.
author: lindsey l.

description:
What they say is true: Everyone---or at least, all of the girls---at Bar None is underage.  (Except for you, of course.)  The place is full of 27-year-old dudes looking to pick up 20-year-old chicks.  In fact, the only time I ever had much luck at Bar None was when I was 20.  And he was 27.  But I left him there at close.

I do appreciate Bar None's Beirut tables (and ping-pong ball vending machine!), and pool, and darts, and general playful nature.  I don't appreciate its bathrooms (Did the doors EVER close?  Were there EVER paper towels in the dispensers?).
author: Hannah J.

description: Ugh, went to this bar with an ex once. He liked to slum it, but ogle people who are into khaki. Every single person looked the same, it was totally a Stepford moment & I honestly feared he was about to introduce me to some smooth talking guy who was going to take me in a back room, lobotomize me & give me a Marina Make-Over. I begged him to take me home & sodomize me instead.
author: Colleen B.

description: One of my favorite bars in the marina! It's great for a post-college crowd--pool tables, good music, drunk crowd, and best of all---BEER PONG!! I don't know any other bar that has beer pong tables for you to play on!!
author: Jasvir S.

description: Some of my fondest memories of SF took place in this bar. Granted, 99% of them occured after kickball at the flipcup tables in the way back but still...awesome times. Not sure if I'd come here on the weekends (clarification - I wouldn't) but it's the place to be on Wednesday nights during kickball season :)
author: Sadia J.

description: This place is a bridge-and-tunnel hellhole; San Francisco's equivalent of kids from Long Island hang out here. If you really feel the need to play beer pong after age 18, I guess this is your spot.
author: Megan W.

description: A bunch of meatheads gleefully pretending to bomb Beirut (i.e. playing beer pong).  Enough said.
author: Leon R.

description: Though it can be a fun daytime drinking place...the nights are quite awful!  Meat market mania, with a slice of stank!  Just not a fan...fondue fork please!
author: Sarah D.

description: Help. I've only been during the union street fair, but help.
author: Owen T.

description: If you are a 21 or 22 fraternity or sorority member you will feel right at home when you walk through the doors of Bar None.  It is like being back at a college frat party and it feels just as dirty.
author: Katie P.

description: Didn't "Fajitagate" happen in front of this dump? yuck.
author: Rick H.

description:
I literally laughed out loud when I saw their rating and said "Yes!" to myself! hahahaha

Long story (trying to be) short.

I used to go here strictly to play beer pong when there was nothing else going on.  I would go with my friends and we would make sure to go at a ridiculously early hour (like 8am on a Friday) in order to beat the douche-bag (can I say that?) frat boys that roll in around 9:30pm.   So at this point in time (about 2 months ago give or take) I would have given them a 3 for convenience.  But then...

I went there with a group of guy friends for a birthday.  And me, being the nice person that I am, was the DD since they all wanted a ride to the bar.  I had a total of 2 beers in about 3 hours.  They made me give the bartender my license to hold along with my Visa in order to open a tab (strange, right)?  So, we leave the bar and I go to get a hotel.  This is during a brief homeless period in time that is now ancient history (thank you Jenn and fabulous Nob Hill).  Anyway...I go to pay for my hotel and I don't have my ID (go figure - I am forgetful).  So I drive back to the bar and ask the bouncer to please get my ID and Visa since he won't let me in b/c I looked too young.  With my car hazard parked outside the front of the bar, and after explaining the fact that I can't get a hotel room without my ID and Visa, the effer says to me that I have to "wait outside the bar (in the rain) until they close" which is a good hour at this point.  He gives me this "your-problem, I-am-a-huge-tool-smile" and pushes me back (literally)!!

So I ran in.

He chased me.

Words were exchanged.

He got my ID for me.

I hate this bar.
author: Carlyna R.

description:
it's like a frat and sorority house decided to join forces to run a bar. my friends and i were seriously laughing our butts off when we saw immature drunkies running around in shorts and t-shirts like drunk hooligans on union street no less.
i will admit on my 21st birthday i went here after dinner at what was once cosmo's grill (that shows my age) for a game of beer pong. 
after last night's experience of being invited for another game, i remembered why i promised myself i would not return here.
one star for the memories.
author: Lola L.

description: Best place to take advantage of a passed-out girl.  No one will notice, and her girlfriends are too drunk to care.  But expect competition.
author: Andrea U.

description:
"Can I get 2 bacardi diets?" The bartender comes back with two glasses filled almost to the brim with bacardi.  He asks: "What did you want me to mix it with? (looks at the glass) Oh, it looks like I went a little pour happy with the bacardi." "Diet coke please," I say. (Bartender hands me the drinks)  "Two extra strong bacardi and diets for the ladies."  I take a sip and wow that is one strong drink, but hey, i'm not complaining.  A half hour later I was good to go...

Yes bar none is like the post college greek scene.
No not everyone who goes was in a sorority or fraternity...they just like to have fun.
Yes bar none is full of guys with striped shirts and girls who are dressed to impress.
No you do not have to look like that to have a good time at bar none.
Yes bar none has beer pong tables in the back.
No you don't have to play because there are other fun things to do there, like darts, pool, or video games.
Yes bar none serves up strong strong drinks.
No do not complain because your wallet will be very thankful.
Yes bar none promises a good time, every time.
No I do not have any complaints about bar none...I hope to say the same for you
author: Julia W.

description: The place to go to play a round of beer pong
author: Friedrich P.

description:
this place sucks.

the marina is a funny place. the inhabitants try really hard to not look so much better than the rest of the population, but it comes off as a failed attempt. with their backwards polo caps to the popped collars, khaki shorts and sandals which make up the uniform, the male aspect of this locale bring back nightmares of crashing that lambda chi alpha party so many years ago. and the females.. wow. i wasn't aware i could garner such scorn just by being alive. i noticed a tattoo on one's ankle, so i asked about it. you'd be surprised how quickly one of these creatures can work up a conversation in which they mock you, but in the nicest, sugar-coated way possible. it was endearing.

i liked the concept of beer pong here - it seems to be the only reason people really go here, but as true as that is, it leads to the impossibility of actually playing the game. their dart boards have seen better days and should be put down. and there's something vaguely homoerotic about the men's restroom being merely a trough to piss in, next to the other guys. if you're looking to relive those high-school humiliating experiences of yesteryear, this is the place for you. because, at bar none, it is evident you're not successful enough, rich enough, or good-looking enough to take that cute girl in the black minidress home...
author: Jeremiah W.

description: If I was a 22 year old USF student, this would like, totally be my spot. Unfortunately, I'm a 26 year old accountant, and while I still enjoy drinking beer and playing flip cup, I prefer not to feel like I'm an old spinster while doing so.
author: Christine K.

description: Can I give this place no stars at all? Sadly, I wont lie. I went to elementary school and my first year of high school in Pac Heights. Ok, please keep reading, I know, Im sorry, its not my fault... its my parents I swear, as soon as they saw the beginnings of a drug addict rich kid,  they bought my bit and let me go to a hippie arts boarding school in the east coast ( thanks god!!!) I went to bar-blonde once, and threw up in my mouth. The worst part is that HELLA loosers that are even older than me  STILL go here, what looooooossssseeeeerrrssss
author: Liz C.

description:
Oookkaayyy...you have to know what to expect going here.
Summarizing some of these reviews, you can expect:
*A bunch of frat-boy types playing drinking games and trying to pick up women

*A bunch of women who pretend to be bothered by the "striped shirts" (I think it's hiliarious how this is becoming a name everyone knows), but are secretly loving the attention. 
      You know those girls? They go in and sit there looking all hot, putting it all out there, but pretend they are completley uninterested in meeting men? Come on ladies, don't tell me you haven't done this...

*A packed, crowded scene of Marina types...loud, horny, drunk

*A deja vu of your college days

WITH THAT SAID...
It can be a very fun time out with your friends. You meet some hilarious people, usually the drunken men who go to desperate measures to "feel your tit" (seriously, it's happened), and all the while get some free tequila shots. 

IF NOTHING ELSE, stop in there for a free drink and be on your merry way...it's pretty much a guarentee that you will encounter SOME striped dude trying to get you drunk.
The "Power Hour" is from 9-10 every night and you can get well drinks and drafts for $2...pretty good if you ask me!

Ah hell, it's actually a pretty fun time if you're in the mood for it. If you're not, if you're feeling cynical or just not in the mood to revisit your college partying days, maybe this isn't the place for you.
author: Nicole R.

description: Drinks are quick and the bartenders were cool. It is filled with frat boys and annoying ass 21-22 year old girls who think they are the shit but whatever. I've had nights of pure joy here. There is an outdoor smoking area where you can drink too. Bartenders are usually pretty good on getting your drink orders as well.
author: Darius A.

description: I don't get this place. I have tried now 4 times to go and grab a quick drink and every time it has SUCKED!! I get off the bus in front of the bar, so I thought hey this could be cool. Wrong. I go inside and there are 2 other people, bartender acted like he could care less. I tried again the next week, same thing. I met a friend there who said, just give it a try, sucked. Went on Sun and paid $9 for a draft Miller Light and a Blue Moon. Both were warm and we had to ask twice for our credit card back! Thanks but no thanks...
author: Lisa A.

description: In reality I'd give bar none a 4 stars because as much as I love the place its not "as good as it gets" However I'm giving them the full 5 stars because of my last experience there. One day recently some friends and I were having a Sunday Funday in the city and came into bar none for some famous beer pong (really called Beirut) We started playing beer pong and this skinny douche bag at one of the tables starts talking endless amounts of shit. I warned him to shut up and that he was going to feel the wrath of the 6 to 1 ratio he was up against but he continued to get personal. When I went to get another pitcher one of the bar tenders / bouncers noticed my frustration and asked me what was up. I told him about the skinny douche bag and the emminent ass beating that was about to take place and the bar tender said he would gladly kick out the douche if I said the word. This bartender's name was Tao and he rocked. Props to him for diffusing the situation and making the day that much better. 5 stars
author: Freddy G.

description:
Ahhh Bar None...let me crack open a Bud and I'll tell you all about  this crap hole of a bar.   If you lookin for a bar to meet San Francisco locals and natives this aint  ur bar.  This bar is filled with 20 somthin'
 (excuse me 21 somthin') JC college dropouts from various places as...umm Hillsborough, Marin, and Menlo Atherton....well I guess that could be the majority of the Marina, but c'mon this aint the only bar in San Francisco people!!!
