Jesus Chirstos!!! If you go to this bar on a Saturday night like I did last week you can't even enjoy urself because there is   literally over 200 people packed into this place.  The bar tenders are all cracked out on booze and PCP  they can't even make a damn drink right let  alone poor you the right beer!  While  trin to enjoy  the company of my homeboy and 2 lovely ladies a few british douche bag's strolled into our conversation and started hitten of the ladies by exposen their hairy ass Austin Powers chest .  This bar is straight up LAME!...LAME....LAME!
author: Joseph M.

description: This place was fun, I met a group there and played beer pong!  It reminded me of my old college days!
author: C J.

description: The quintessential Frat-boy bar of SF. Ugh. I went here, for a very short time, last night, as my friend was meeting an old friend here. 1 star because my roomate's drink was strong. It is SO crowded here. And if you want to go to a bar where there are more than a few drunk girls crying or being dramatic and guys almost getting in fights outside, come here.  Next time, I am going to be more up front and just. say. NO. to Bar None. Nuff said.
author: Laura D.

description:
I can admit it, when I first moved to the city- naive, 21 years old, fresh out of college...what was one of the first bars I went to? Bar None, of course. 

Walking into Bar None is like teleporting back to your college days.  I can remember some nights here turning the beer pong tables in to crazy games of flip cup- good times. However, I wouldn't  plan on going back. There are so many better places in the city. But if I was wasted and ended up at Bar None....whateves

I encourage people who love this place to expand your horizons and try something new
author: elyssa w.

description: They call this place "Bar Dude" for a reason. Typical Marina slimeball meat market. I avoid this place like the plague. The best time I ever had there was when I saw this wasted dillhole barf right in the middle of the bar and nobody seemed to notice. Awesome.
author: Michael E.

description: Other than 2 dollar Molson and the reminiscence of frat parties, why? why? why?  ...Especially on Friday and Saturday nights, I'd rather go to Mexico and get sick off local beer and taco stand food.
author: Robby T.

description: Bar None is the type of place where guys will bet $300 on a game of beirut, where people will spill entire pitchers of beer on your friends and will give them not an apology, but a mere shug, where girls will scruntinize each other's highlights and nails in the bathroom like its breaking news, and where you will suffer through the dumbest conversations with guys who won't even offer to buy you a drink, but who you know are sizing you up and wondering what their chances are of bringing you home! If you feel like reliving your college days, this is the place where the hambones and sorostitutes run wild! Its an experience and entertaining to say the least.
author: Lauren Y.

description: Looked like fun...but after two other bars and a ton of beers all I remember is Beer Pong...more beer...playing matchmaker....more beer...and other than that I don't remember anything else...just BEER!!  I guess if i ever want to play beer pong, this is my place.
author: Karen B.

description: Bar None bloody Rocks!I don't care if I have horrible taste in bars- this place always has some kind of awesome chaos going on, AND Dane Cook bartends here! The Beer pong is great here because you are guaranteed to meet some characters and have some hilarious stories the next day. This place attracts all kinds...including the bitter lads and lasses you see giving this place a bad name. I love this place, and it will continue to live on as one of the finest destinations in the sacred Weekend pub crawl traditions!
author: Mike M.

description:
this was one stop for my 21st birthday
not bad.....pretty cheap pitchers for a few games of beer pong
it was jam packed on a saturday night and i was pretty hammered by the time we stumbled in there but id definetely go back
author: Patrick R.

description: EW. If you want to play beer pong, get absolutely shit faced, and puke and piss all over the place, please don't do it in public. I thought that shit was illegal.
author: Kimberly H.

description: Go here if you want to relive frat party/college days.  That's it.
author: Rosie S.

description: When this place isn't crowded, it's pretty ok. Been here many times with different groups of friends who just want to play beer pong outside of a house. The bartenders were nice..we asked them if they had $3 jager specials during random nights and they hooked it up, basically a few of my friends got so messed up they'd be yackin' in their garbage by the end of the night. The bartenders just laughed and told us we should drink some more(and we did of course)..ahh reminds me those college days =D
author: Jerold R.

description:
bar none is my "guaranteed good time" bar.

yes its crowded. yes it smells. yes the bathrooms need to be fixed. but thats how dive bars are.

they have beer pong. outside patio. and its a great location. if you wanna go somewhere else theres another bar a block away. if you want pizza theres pizza orgasmica and if you want hot dogs theres what up dog. but thats neither here nor there.

bar none is your typical college bar. the guy to girl ratio is pretty much 10 to 1 and all the guys there are the frat boy type. music is loud just the way i like it and drinks are constantly flowing.

what else can you say about a fun bar?
author: A. V.

description: People's reasons for giving 1 star really annoy me.  Is it that offensive to you that it's a "frat" scene?  I'm so proud of everybody for being over their college years, but you know as soon as college frat parties become ironic like the 80s or snuggies all you haters will be crowding into bars like this.  Personally I'm not crazy about this place, but the times I've been here I've always had fun.  I can see giving a bad review if you really had a terrible experience here, but you don't need to all prove to each other how evolved you are because you would never be caught dead in a pinstriped shirt.
author: Nate W.

description: This place would be ok if I was still in college or had just graduated.  If you are any older, I suggest you look for another place to hang out.
author: Amy B.

description: Please, the frat scene got old after my freshman year of college. I can't believe anyone goes here. Full of lame people who need to get over themselves.
author: Cathy T.

description: What is a frat party doing on an otherwise respectable San Francisco street????  I dont know of a better way to describe it.  Think... polo shirts with popped collars, keg stands, hootchie girls doing shots and dumb looking guys hollering at them.  I wouldn't be surprised to find a foam party in here.  Or a rush ritual party with the pledge brothers.  Or a beer bottle smashing contest.  Oh you're a Kappa Gamma Phi Beta Delta Kappa Zeta Pi?? Oh my cousin like so dated like guy who was like totally rommates with this guy in your pledge class! oh how like totally exciting, lets have sex!  This place is a shame.  If you're the owner of this fine establishment, please let me know when you throw in the towel and want to sell it, anyone could do so much better with such a location.
author: M P.

description: Only been there once, near the end of a drunken night... it must have been a week night, because it wasn't crowded at all.  I had a good time, a couple friends and I just drank some beers, and i made it out the door at the end of the night with the giants pitcher glass my beer had come in... score.  I'd venture in for beer pong on saturdays, but admittedly, frat boys freak me out, reminding me of unhappier times in college... we'll see.
author: Caleb D.

description: i can't speak for the clientele (as I graduated college a long time ago) and obviously they have beer pong (which is definitely a plus). But, they also have anything fried that you can think of: chicken tenders, jalapeno poppers, mini hot dogs, cheese sticks, etc. They also have a slider that can compete with White Castle and just might be better...
author: Nicolas H.

description: I have never in my life been more disrespected at a bar.  The bar was great until last call when they literally put their hands on both myself and my husband and pushed us out of the because we didn't finish our beers fast enough.  I am emberrased I spent money there!
author: Meridith T.

description: You people are crazy for not loving Bar None!  It is always crowded because it is AWESOME!  I love beer games and any time during the day you can find a flip cup, beer pong, foosball, pool game, whatever your heart desires.  You can pretend you are in college all over again.  I love it.
author: Marian G.

description: More like Bar Never Again. Every bar deserves a shot (pun intended) but Bar None only gets one. If you're a student or under 21, then this is your bar and enjoy the multiple games of beer pong in the back. If you're looking for a chill night out or a place to make new friends, this is not your spot.
author: Jessica M.

description: I thought the beer pong competition was bad; however, it ventured into even more unfamiliar territory when I entered the washroom and there was a literal pissing contest going on.
author: Randall T. Bogus, I.

description:
If you're into sticky floors, guido bar fights, sweet home alabama blaring on repeat, disgusting bathrooms and blacked out 18 year olds this place gets 5 stars.

otherwise....

avoid at all costs, this place is a glorified college bar but seems a lot less cool when you aren't in college (or high school for that matter) anymore.
author: Claire M.

description: This place is NASTY. I can see why people have such a negative opinion of the Marina after coming here. My friends and I stopped in on a Saturday night shortly after moving to the neighborhood, without knowing what we were in for. As soon as we got inside I wanted to leave - it was hot, smelly, crowded and the drinks tasted like shit. The further you go into the bar, the worse it gets. The back room is full of tables for beer pong, which in theory sounds like a good idea, but the floor is sticky and absolutely covered in beer. Not to mention you feel like you're back in college at a bad frat party. Will not be back.
author: Lindsey S.

description: Oh my gaw! Where do I begin ... Bar none is like a frat party - complete with douchebags wearing bright colored shirts with costumes!  Who wears a costume to a bar when there is no costume party??!  Seriously, these guys were wearing sparkling pink wings and oversized sunglasses like retards.  Not like retards.. they were retards.  Guys have just lost their game these days or what?  I feel like I walked into a pathology store because I was surrounded by the disease of society.  I rather have a tick head stuck to my ass.  I'm so embarrassed I was there.
author: Christina C.

description: This is a test to see if Yelp lets you give something zero stars (apparently not). And believe me, Bar None earns that zero. Don't ask me how I got talked into going here. I think a buddy of mine wanted to meet up with a girl who said she'd be out here & I owed him a favor so he dragged me out as his wingman. God knows why he'd still be interested after she told him she'd be hanging out in Bar None, but I digress. If you're a Bro in your late 20s, & you spend your weekends taking Jaegar shots while wearing your fraternity letters & a backwards hat, this is the place for you.
author: Pete J.

description: I am a college student so I can't dis college bars, but Bar None is a bad college bar. I don't really have much more to say. If your with people you like then you will have a good time if everything else is ....um closed.   Just go somewhere else.
author: Jen J.

description: This place embodies all that the phrase "I hate the Marina" implies.  But hey, I am under the belief that most people like a bar because they once hooked up there, and people definitely hook up at Bar None.
author: George M.

description: Reminds me of college - the drunken frat boy part of college.  HOWEVER, they are the sponsor bar of everyone's new favorite sport (kickball) and get extra stars for that.
author: Alicia A.

description: the beer pong table is great... lots of good memories come from those tables. The staff is cool, but the people in there are tooo stuck up for me. Its a fun little place, but only during the week.
author: Stormy M.

description: Beer Pong is Great Any night of the week. And look for the Bar Tender in the Cowboy Hat. If you flirt with him he'll take free Jager shots with you!
author: Samantha S.

description: It's always an interesting time at bar none. you can play darts and beer pong, which is cool, and there's a big long bar, and usually not so hard to get a drink even if there's a llot of people.  there's usually a crowd, which isn't overwhelming until you realize it's usually a bunch of drunk douchebag, westrosexuals.  my friends and i get hit on by really weird people everytime we go.
author: Lindsay T.

description:
yuck.

if you're stuck in a time warp and trying to relive the college frat party days, then this place is definitely for you.
author: zoomcracker ..

description: For when I want to remember what a shitty frat party is like.
author: Joe D.

description: You know....this place is what it is...kind of divey...kind of campy...westernish theme, beer pong in the way back and a pool table. Its fun, people don't care about what you wear (i'm from la...its new to me!) i will definitely return....especially when im down to drink, play some pool or beer pong and only have to walk a few blocks to get home!
author: Jess V.

description: I went here with some friends who really wanted to play beer pong. It was raining that day. Moderate rain, not heavy. Inside the back room where the beer pong was going on, the ceiling was leaking. There were dirty puddles of water and wet footprints all over the ground. If you've played beer pong before, you'll find the ball often ends up on the ground. If you played beer pong at Bar None when it's raining outside, you'll find you often are drinking a beer that has been seasoned with a ping pong ball that has just rolled through a dirty puddle. It's ok though. Just dip it in the cup of muddy water to clean it off.
author: Steve C.

description: My friends and I had a great time here after the cabbie dropped us off in front. There was enough room to hang out and beer pong in the back.  I'd definitely go again.
author: rob. l.

description: Two stars because my girls and I kicked some serious beer pong butt. Beer was relatively inexpensive (if you buy the cheep stuff) and the bartenders were nice.  Frat boys playing loud games of beer pong not so much fun when they are rude to everyone around them but when you are busy playing your own game and winning you learn to tune them out so you don't end up throwing the ball right at their head.  Most of the people are relatively nice (except for the few annoying frat boys I just told you about) and are even willing to play three on three which made my game alot more fun.  so... go... play beer pong...  win... or don't... get drunk...
author: Kylie L.

description: Any bar that always has beruit is a bar I like a lot! This place may not be the classiest joint you will ever step foot in, and it is oh so filled with post-sorority and fraternity members who are just shy of letting go of the fabulous life that was college... but the place is really fun and a wonderful spot to go with friends for a loud thurs, friday or saturday night.
author: D S.

description: I guess this place is as close to a college bar that San Francisco can offer.  Tables abound, perfect for flip cuppin' or beer pongin' $10 domestic pitchers, you get what you pay for.  Don't hate, assimilate.
author: Sam N.

description: The reason why i don't miss drunken idiotic frat/sorority/college dayz...
author: Wendy H.

description: Based on the reviews on this site, I would have never considered this bar. But I had to go, because I had to do a promotion here on Friday. I was nicely surprised. This is the typical bar for artists or students, people who do not have a ton of money and who just want to go out with their friends, be casual and have fun. It's sort of cheap and the people who go here are into beer. I am definitely going to go back here sometimes with my friends. I interacted with a lot of customers and most of all were so nice and no one was stuck up or bitchy. I had a great time!
author: Madalina C.

description: It is like a college party. For my age, this place is just right. They have Beer Pong tables and the crowd ranges from 21-25. It is a lot of fun for now. Expect a very belligerent, good time when you make your way to Bar None.
author: Mike B.

description: Flashbacks of college with beer pong, pool, darts, cheap beer and all the things you loved from college.... and some things you didn't.
author: Jess R.

description: OMFG so many frat dudes!!!! Just kidding I'm not going to say that. OR AM I!!!!! No I won't. What I will say is this, this place is a bar, it's dark and it gets crowded, and you can order drinks and drink them and get drunk if that's your thing. If it's not then you're probably not reading this review so get out of here!! Go!! I've been to like 10 billion bars in my life and this one is nothing special but definitely not as bad as everyone says. I've been kicked out of here for nothing so i guess that kind of sucked but whatev's. I will give this a average rating of 3 stars, because it is an average bar. So what if it has beer pong? What are you 22 or something? (I'm 22)
author: John C.

description: For the first couple months I lived here after college, I used to come here all the time. Then, one night, the light turned on, and I turned to my best friend and said, "You know, I hate this place." She turned to me and said, "Me too." Never been back. Its one of those places you go to until you realize there are much better places.
author: Noelle Q.

description: I don't like Bar None but for some reason have wound up there three or four times.  It feels like the basement of a fraternity.  They do have $12 pitchers of coors light though.
author: Tabatha Y.

description: Bar No Fun.  If Beer Pong and hangin' with your bros is your thing, then you'll love this place. If you actually enjoy drinking at a place with an atmosphere (and smell) that doesn't resemble a frat house basement, then avoid this place at all costs. It seriously sucks.
author: Chris B.

description:
my friends are always reluctant to go here (again), but whenever we get there... we never want to leave. 

and i happen to like marina slime.
author: Jessi B.

description: Loud.  Crowded.  Meat market . . . in the worst sense.  Frat party gone wrong.  Um, yeah.
author: Amy C.

description:
Wanna go back to your college days? 

Well, have no fear. 

Just make a quick trip to Bar None and you will surely feel like you're back in college...or better yet, it felt like a frat party to me. 

The only thing I liked about this place was the Beer Pong which is located in the way back, you can't miss it, you know, playing Ping Pong but with no racket thingie and throwing the ball into the cups and drinking up. Now, that's what I call fun, minus the fact, how people drink up from the ball that touched the floor..but if you're tossed, i guess you won't even notice or could careless.

EW.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
good if you like frat parties, beer, beirut, pool, and getting scammed on by underagers.

bad if you are a classy, pearl wearing, snotty, ex sorority girl who is over the whole frat scene.

thankfully, i'm a good mixture of both and had a decent time here. i like playing beirut and i just ignored the skeezy guys. we were with a big group (all ex frat/sorority people) so i think thats why we had a good time. our time here ended with all of us chugging out of the pitcher of beer. cheers!
author: Jessica B.

description:
I have no idea or excuses as to why I wound up here....although I do vaguely remember it being a pretty cool dive bar way back when I was....19!!! This place is just gnarly....I could've peed right there on the floor and no one would've noticed....but hey if you're looking for a frat party, bar none is your pot to piss in...don't forget to check your underwear for skid marks..

Douche bag factor = a strong 10
author: Roger T.

description: bar none is for people who like fun. period.
author: J. K.

description: yet another place where i thought i already had a review for. again this is one of those places that was mostly visited when i was 22. they have beer pong in back and flip cup after kickball. typical marina bar. what else can i say.
author: Ashley H.

description: Beer Pong.  Plastic cups.  It's rowdy and dirty but for some reason we always end up back here... gotta be SOMETHING about this place... I can't think of it yet though :p
author: Angela H.

description: Not the place to go if you're part of the, um, hipster culture that surrounds a lot of the people frequenting a place like Yelp. However, if you were the type of person really into college drinking games and don't mind a bit of a frat atmosphere, Bar None is a great time. I only graduated from school a few months ago and stopping by Bar None feels an awful lot like those times all over again. And are people seriously complaining about the dirtiness of the beer pong tables? It's beer pong! My friends and I were taking doors off the hinges in our apartment for a table, yeesh.
author: Patrick K.

description: Though I avoid the marina like the plague, I have had fun here(though mostly when I'm a walking black-out and my friends tell me I had fun).  I like beer pong.
author: ellyk E.

description: If you like Bar None I don't like you. I'm embarrassed to even review this as it is a direct admission to me having actually been. Next!
author: Valerie N.

description: Hahahaha. Are you fucking kidding me? Well, let me start by saying...oh fuck it, nevermind. Bro.
author: Brandon B.

description: i actually never seen all the comments on Bar None, and find it hilarious to read them, because I work there. One thing is for certain, Bar None is definitely an experience, whether good, bad, or bizarre, its definitely an experience one will never forget.... or never remember....
author: Otto W.

description: If the vomit on the sidewalk out front doesn't make you want to heave, the clientele will.
author: Carla C.

description: The only reason why I'm giving this place 3 stars is because we got a pitcher for a good deal, and there was beer pong.  It's a totally casual dive-ish place and cool to stop by if you have a group of friends who want to play beer pong during the week.
author: Lisa D.

description: This place is the kind of place you go when you're tanked and just don't give a f***, or the place you go when your friends from the Peninsula are looking for a night out on the town. Why is it that I'm always dragged to this place? There's plenty of other places in the Marina to go, so after you've visited those places come here...
author: Douglas L.

description: This is where overgrown frat boys and their sorority girl counterparts go to re-live their good ol' college days of beer pong matches and  rockin' out to Lynrd Skynrd. Don't say I didn't warn you.
author: Justine N.

description: I actually have had some fond memories of this bar.  But memories are from the past and well you know the saying "the past is the past" ...so lets keep it that way.  I am not a marina chick, I don't even go out in the marina.  But on a few occasions (when I was already drunk and dragged here) a long long time ago I too had fun here.  Now if I was really in the mood to be nostalgic of "frat parties" than maybe I would go back there.  Wait...hold the phone...go back to "frat parties"? Oh helllll no! Because no matter how drunk I get now....ugly is still ugly.  But I will say this the bartenders and actually the entire staff of Bar None are really nice.  Plus you have got to give them major brownie points for putting up with this "crowd".  So kudos to the staff of Bar None.  Cause I sure as hell couldn't do that job!
author: Amanda P.

description: This place is so GROSS!  When we walked in, the front area was alright...but when we saw the beer pong tables, we were so disgusted.  There was beer all over the floor and dirty cups everywhere.  I felt like I was in a digusting frat house again.  Also, the bathrooms were horrifying!  And, one of the guys cleaning up the area was spilling more beer everywhere (we literally saw him take a pitcher and pour the remaining contents onto the floor).  I was so grossed out....
author: E M.

description: On those rare moments that I get a hankering for the fraternity party antics I left behind a few short months ago in college, I might go to Bar None. Because it only takes two assholes in a striped shirts worth of conversation and cheap, lite beer, to remind me that some things are best recalled fondly, rather than re-enacted...
author: Sophie S.

description: I love Beirut!!! I can't stay away.  It's totally a guilty pleasure but where else can you chest butt Mike Dunleavey after sinking a ping poing ball in plastic cup.  I know I'm too old and my striped shirt is too faded but it's still fun. I wouldn't necessarily hang out here if you're over 22 but I don't think there's anything wrong with buying a pitcher and heading striaght back to the tables. I prefer weeknights when it's less crowded and the serious competitors are out.
author: Brian B.

description: There's no way I'd come here sober (though I must admit, the naked lady photo hunt is pretty fun), but if you're a nostalgic Cal Bear this place will leave you swirling with memories of late nights spent at Kip's and Bear's Lair.
author: Krystle S.

description: Look, I know that this bar caters to the 21 and under crowd, but I really don't think it is that bad.  It actually has decent size, the drinks are not unreasonably priced and there is beer pong.  I will admit, I am not a huge fan of the obnoxious young-and-should-not-be-in-the-bar-and-fix-your-collar-while-you-are-at-it and the man-troughs (I prefer to have some space to do my business and not having the guy next to me's back splash).  But, the beer pong bumps this place from a three star to a four.
author: Jonathan M.

description: I was challenged to a game of crossfire at the piss trough.  To make a long story short, this night ended in tears and a cold shower with my clothes on. Thanks Bar None!
author: Peter S.

description: I woke up in the morning with all manner of UDI's, and a limo receipt in my pants pocket.  Thanks, Bar None!
author: Sam M.

description: If I could give less than 1 star I would. I freaking hate this place. The people (guys/bouncers especially) are worse than the disgusting bathroom. I don't know what's worse, the over priced ugly clothes overload, or the ugly bro overload. This is definitely the last place on earth you will ever find me. PS- Ctrl+F "bro" and see how many times it comes up. Hey, I guess if you're a bro this is the place...just be ready for competition, and wear as many collared shirts as physically possible so you look your BEST.
author: Shari Z.

description: I haven't been here since I was barely 21 and I have to say that I have outgrown this place. The energy is that of a college frat party with horrible bathrooms and lame crowds (i.e., the young crowds and the older guy in their blazers and button downs trying to fit in and be young= gross). I don't think I will be returning any time soon, unless I'm already inebriated.
author: Christina D.

description: Really fun place for beer pong! YES BEER PONG! challenge people at the bar or your friends to a good friendly game of beer pong! Minus one star for the overprice cocktails!
author: Lucky M.

description: Too many people take themselves too damn seriously.  Take this bar for what it is, a fun place to come hang out on a Saturday or Sunday afternoon (when it is NOT crowded with the aforementioned college frat boys and girls in mini-skirts), enjoy a game of pool (or beer pong), cheap drinks, loud music and a million and one televisions.  I'm a fan of all kinds of bars and this bar doesn't try to be anything more than it is.  Will you find fancy drinks, plush seating and a trendy atmosphere? No, you'll find a place to go have a beer, drink with friends and maybe even re-visit your college days.  Yes, it's clientele at night can get a little young and annoying, but on a Saturday afternoon it is a FUN and FRIENDLY place to hang out.
author: Chrys W.

description: This bar reminds me of college, which is a good thing (every once in a while).  It's crowded, the floor is sticky, and it's filled with frat-boy types, but it's a good place to get a pitcher of beer with friends.  They also have beer pong.
author: kiki d.

description:
this place seems to be a favorite of a lot of friends of mine. i come, i sometimes have an enjoyable time.  but if this is the 'destination' of the night i may as well just stay home. i just dont see its appeal. 

its clear that the majority of this joints service comes in the form of beer pitchers, which are then used to play beer pong with.  i must admit that it is a novel idea to have beer pong tables in your bar, but lets be honest, do i really want to travel to a bar to play a house party game? the answer is clearly no.  

furthermore the area the beer pong tables are set in is reminiscent of a frat house basement. hole in the ceiling: usually considered a building code violation at any other bar. at bar none it is merely character.  gigantic pot hole sized chunk of concrete missing from the floor: something i would consider a huge liability. at bar none it is just an ambience builder.  i do not have any problem with people who like to relive their undergrad experience. what i am trying to say is it is just not my scene.

in addition the drinks hit you about as hard as an anemic child trying to punch underwater. on more than one occasion i spent 40 bucks on four drinks that probably amounted to about 2 shots of liquor. no thanks. 

one star for the music, which is usually rocking. 
one star for the women because there are usually a lot of good looking ladies at the bar.

but lets be honest there are beautiful women at almost every bar in san francisco, why would you want to put up with all the 'extras' that come along with bar none?

oh and to be clear--by 'extras' i meant the fratty douche bags that frequent this bar.
author: Jason B.

description: Awesome for going out to play beer pong or flip cup, although is good pitcher is like... $20. I can get a pitcher of margaritas for that....
author: Jen D.

description: Ugh, I am way too old for Bar None, maybe even all of the Marina.  It was super crowded and dirty.  Drink specials were fine, but I'd rather pay a little bit more and be more comfortable.
author: Olivia T.

description:
ok looks like i found the secret of really loving this place! i have been to bar none twice and have had a really great experience. i think you may have a great time as i did if u leave before 7 or 8pm to avoid that obnoxious college crowd. i love the decor of the place and the neighborhood it's in is great for people watching. one one occasion we sat by the front door and watched monday night football and the ladies walking by were soooo darn hot. seems that the people walking by were pretty darn upscale and really took care of themselves.

they have many great beers on tap and some pretty good specials on the menu from time to time. the jukebox had some really great tunes, the pool tables were clean and that darn golden tee golf game was calling my name til i had spent a good $12 in quarters. 

so come in get your drink on and get out of there before your surrounded by popped collars!
author: Scotty D.

description: If you want to relive your college days then jump in the time machine called Bar None. Here you see a bunch of overaged "Frank the Tank's" reenacting the movie Old School. Typical college bar scene with the beerpong tables and touch-screen video games. A little filthy but its a place to take a pitcher of beer to the dome or act belligerent again. People get kicked out of here like its the new trend.
author: Ed L.

description: Good place to work on your Beirut game if you are out of practice from your college days.  Avoid the weekends, though.
author: Peter R.

description: I love this place. It reminds me of an awesome college party, with a slightly older, more fashionable crowd. It always feels really comfortable, and the music is awesome-- perfect songs to drink to. ;-)
author: Jon N.

description: The characterisation of this place as popular amongst the recent college grad, 21-26 year old crowd, is spot on in my experience. Many yelpers give it low stars because of it. But if you fit that picture, like I do, then it's a damn good place. As a young "party" bar, it works. Beer pong tables (if you're in to that), seating and quiter area in the back, a long bar, plenty of room, and hot people. Yes, it's like a college party. So if you're not in to that, go somewhere else!! But for the young crowd, there aren't many places where we congregate. Indie kids and non-preps won't really fit in here.
author: Jack O.

description: If you're into dark, dirty bars filled with tons of guys getting macho and competitive over beer pong, this is the place for you. I was expecting to go to a nicer bar, ANY nicer bar at the Marina but we somehow ended up here. I felt like I was getting infected with who-knows-what after sitting on one of the chairs and the bathroom was crowded and disgusting. I think it was only an ok experience after having a few... or five drinks and being with good friends, haha. The bartenders don't know much beyond the standard "popular" drinks so don't order anything fancy.
author: Miss H.

description: Asshole bouncer, really dirty, and the specials were not that great, and the bathrooms were dirty and not working.  They have a good idea with the beer pong in the back and it would be cool if you didn't feel like you were hanging out in a dirty garbage pit.
author: Steve A.

description:
I used to come to bar none all the time, being that its a 5 minute walk from my house and would have somewhat of a decent time.  Very large bar, good selection of brews, pool table, darts, beer pong room and small patio to smoke cancer sticks.  My only complaint is the scene, which is unavoidable in the Marina.  Bar none is a host to ex-frat boys and recovering date raped cheerleaders which seem to be a perfect combination for each other. The music generally is from the top pop chart and sometimes youll be lucky to hear the same song 3 times in a row.  
Other than these douches, bar none is great during the day to come to with some friends, grab some sliders which are damm good, drink some beers and move on from there.  If you come at night, be prepared to pop your collars, over gel your hair and sport your $1500 outfit from Ambercrombie.
author: Ray M.

description: Yeah for drinking games!  I went on a Sunday afternoon and had a great time.  It was early enough that the beer pong tables were free.  The crowd was young but friendly.  I can see how it might be a nightmare of a place at night.
author: Lindsey W.

description: I just don't find drinking and worrying about hitting my head all night very fun (5'8" usually is not the norm for a ceiling, and I don't think my height is unusually tall).  I was over the pool table, sticky EVERYTHING, and lame crowd before I walked in the door.  Would not go in there unless I got free drinks for life, no...not even that.
author: Lulu B.

description: Good for kickball parties, and that's about it!  I loathe the Marina, and this bar is the epitome of such places I hate.  Guys in collared shirts, and girl drunk off of Budweiser.  I don't understand how a place like the Marina even exists in a city such as San Francisco, but I guess if there are enough So Cal kids in any city, areas like this will thrive.
author: Max M.

description: Beer Pong is always a great time, but too much marina slime around this bar.
author: Erin F.

description: A bar for the beer pongers looking for a total frat scene, meat market, with lots of scandalous marina chicks.  What's not to love?!
author: Andrew C.

description: I really don't know what to say about this except that I felt like I was at a Chico bar. But in Chico, CA the drink would have been a whole lot cheaper. It was very crowded, it had trash on the floor and the bathroom was terrible. All these things along with a college crowd would make you feel like you were in a college town- not the city. The prices of the drink and the pretentious attitudes you get from the patrons  was a total turn off. I love college type bars but not when it's all fake.
author: Sharon M.

description: Basically a typical, trashy college bar. Cheap, no frills, full-but-not-suffocating, decent place to get wasted and possibly hook up.
author: Amar R.

description: Personally not a fan, Its overloaded with chest-bumping frat boy types.  Just don't really care for the "house-party" type of bar.
author: Courtney M.

description: This place was just a bar full of fraternity dudes.  I swore i walked into the Abercrombie catalog...The music was awesome, but it no way made up for the scene.  I saw heads playing Cups...Cups in a bar...damn was i in a frat house???? Just go to the bar across the street it was better and not as hectic....
author: Bernardo C.

description: Ugghhhhh...I have been here twice. The first time was okay because the bartender was friendly but there were no people there. Maybe that was a good thing. I have heard the rumors about "marina" people- but I was not a believer...until now. And to think I almost moved there....worst people EVER = worst bar EVER. I'd rather stab myself in the eye than go back.
author: Jess W.

description:
The atmosphere: frat party, freshman year....
so if you are okay with that then you'll have a blast...

there's a time and a place for bar none...it's usually a Sunday afternoon of flip cup =) and then when you're drunk..and forgotten about the germs beer pong....

this is another marina hang out that is fun during week nights...or Sunday mid day....never ever on a weekend night...
author: Joy Y.

description: Have not been here in 7 years. Funny thing this place is lame! I went there on friday with my younger cousin and friends and remembered very quickly that I am OLD! lol. Overcrowded HOT stinky and well it is your typical marina bar. need i say more.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
this frat-boy haven was the last place in the world i wanted to be. seriously, crowded bar for a Thursday night

all the guys wearing flip flops kakhis and collared plaid shrits

icky. 

took forever to get a drink, much pricier than other places i had visited that night...

bathroom smelled like vomit. typical i guess but the whole vibe of this place really turned me off.
author: c e.

description: Aside from the fact that you have to wait longer than usual for a cocktail and its in the marina, this is a pretty chill bar with good tunes and Beer pong!  i didn't play but i have ev ery intention of going back to do so.
author: Michelle M.

description: If you like boys, beer and Beirut!!!  This is the spot!
author: Natalie E.

description: Hell, pure and simple.  I walk into this place and almost immediately I want to lash out violently at someone.  I've gone to this place a few times to visit the lovely friends who for some reason (money) bartend there, and it's never good.  It's not horrible if it's a weekday (Mon-Wed only), but on the other days I find myself witnessing a spectacle of the worst aspects of humanity on open display.  Sometimes I can make it through a night there by pretending I'm on an anthropological expedition, charting the behavior of a primitive and undeveloped culture, but other nights it's just too much to bear.
author: Jesse H.

description: There was a time, in this century, when I would have rated this a 5.  Now, I'd go for 1.  It was a great spot for meeting guys when I first moved here.  I can't even remember what it was called waaaaaay back then..... we're talking 2000...
author: Megan G.

description: Total ex-frat-boy-meat-market horror show! My girlfriends and I walked in and immediately made a bee-line for the loo and right as we were heading back out another girl not in our party said, "You ladies don't want to head back out there either?" --and we all nodded in agreement. YEAH, Bar None is like that! Beer pong??? --WTF. Never again.
author: Devon P.

description:
"Bar None is a World Famous New York City" they should have just left this in NYC then if thats the case... this place is awesome if you want to be surrounded by 10,000 frat brothers. the concept of rollin beer pong was a good idea, its just not worth fighting through that crowd. 
If'n its still in there i recomend you find that bucket that hangs from the corner of the bar and with all your might, bang the sh%t out of it...  probably the best time you can have...
author: jamie z.

description: Okay place to go with a group of friends if you're just looking to get wasted and maybe play beirut or flip cup. Not good if you're looking for anything else.
author: Bruce D.

description: The only time this place is fun is when no one else is there.  My apartment is too small for beer pong, so Bar None is a substitute location.  I suggest 7 pm on a Tuesday.
author: Dale M.

description: I managed to go to this bar in one night 3 times after taking cabs in, out and around the city. It was good, just your typical bar that has beer pong tables and darts. I was really amazing to see all the dart boards in SF bars since they aren't allowed in LA bars (i dont think, because i only see places in the bar where they used to be, or don't see them at all, or maybe LA just think's they're way to cool for them, anyway... i really appreciate the dart boards).
author: Rhoi C.

description: Does this bar deserve three stars? I am not really sure, but i feel like more of an idiot giving a bar that i have often frequented only 1 star. Every time i decide to go here i think it will be great, pass down the stairs, squeeze up to the bar for a beer, take a sip...and then realize that i kindof hate it here. It is def. a watering hole for the crustiest upper crust Marina crowd, fresh with salt in their hair after spending the day on their yaughts or the other half are 30 somethings that are too boozed up to notice that they graduated from college a decade ago. there is beer pong though, not sure if that is good or bad?
author: melissa c.

description: This place gets way too many negative reviews. Without a doubt, if it wasn't for Bar None -- SF bar hopping would suck.
author: Nick A.

description:
A fun place to be if you have the right company. The big attraction is the beer pong setup in the back and some big screen TVs. Beer is good, it always is but the appetizers are lousy. I saw a lot of people hang out, have a few beers, throw some darts and then probably head out to have dinner somewhere else.

And the restrooms are not as bad as some of the reviews say or maybe I am the unfortunate few who has seen worse :-)
author: Gagan M.

description: If you are in the mood for a traditional and classic fraternity dive bar scene, look no further.  This place definitely has it all, darts, beer pong, etc.  Drinks are reasonably priced and usually a great crowd for a great time
author: Charles C.

description: It's a bit too much like a college party. Don't go there unless you're in that mood.
author: Mike C.

description: If you want loud people singing and having a good time then you should definitely go to bar none. It's great if you are looking for a casual place to have a good time with your friends.
author: Jen L.

description: Awesome Happy Hour!  I came to Bar None on a Tuesday evening and boy this place was poppin.  Beer Pong, $10 pitchers.  $3 well drinks/draft beer at Happy hour from 4 to 8 and there was Power Hour from 9-10.  I can't wait to go back!
author: Crystal S.

description: The bartenders were really good for the most part but towards the end of the night a bartender poured an extra pitcher and asked people if they wanted it for a discount. I said I would and ordered shots as well. He came back with mixed drinks. He gave me a whopping two bucks off the pitcher and made me pay for the wrong drinks.
author: Conor F.

description: yes it's fratty, yes there's beer pong and yes, the smell hints of a mix between stale beer and vomit but if you're looking for a douchey good time, this is the place to be. the drinks are reasonable, the bartenders are attentive and generally attractive and the crowd is always fun, even for day drinking.
author: Jillian M.

description: If you wanna meet with meat head frat boys strolling around in flip-flops or have this thing for curvy cheeks coming back from softball practice with their backpack, then you've found yourself a gem. Foreigners, go get lost, people here want "made in USA".
author: Damien J.

description: So, I've only been to this place a couple times in my entire college career in San Francisco, but one of the times was one of my best nights out. I really wish I could meet this guy again- The bar itself is just a crowded college bar, nothing special, but when my roommate and her girlfriends wanted to go out to the Marina and we found ourselves here it was no biggie, we were already a couple drinks deep. So anyway, it was time to head over to the loo and I was groovin to the music on my way, and this guy picks up on it and we totally start Swing dancing in the middle of the crowded bar, for like two whole songs. I was doing the whole swing dancing thing at the time, so it was awesome and amazing that we both were up for it. Anyway, so I was too cool for school and I didn't give my number out or anything, but to this day, I still remember how awesome it was. In my mind I cannot remember how gross the bathrooms were or whatever, or who else was there, all I remember was a great dance in a super crowded, hot bar. 4 stars for fun, but not 5. It's still a college bar.
author: Tiffan C. W.

description: ok drinks, super hot bartenders, very pack on weekends. they have 1 pool table and a few beer pong tables. place is super hot inside, maybe with some better ventilation this place could be awesome. just hate the fact that i wear a tshirt in there and its still super hot.
author: Frankie L.

description: this review is only for Football season the early games. I have Not been here at any other time so I can not comment on that. But the bar opens at 10am for football and they have numerous tv's playing all the games. It is not too crowded which is a plus. But mostly the staff who works Sundays is great. Lauren is an Excellent bartender. She is on top of all orders and customers, does not bat an eye if 10 of you want a bloody mary. She always notices when you need some more water and is really nice without being the type who neglects the bar by chatting. And they serve food-- big plus. I am not a fan of the beer bong but at least it is a seperate area. They also have great drink specials during the game beginning at noon.
author: Susan s.

description: if you want to play beer pong you have come to the right place, crowd is mostly white. drinks are decently priced, only thing that isnt great is the smell of warm spilled beer. but it would be impossible to have beer pong and not smell
author: Angelo C.

description: i love bar-hopping in the marina but i usually avoid this place... probably because the crowd tends to be on the young and immature side. if that's what you like, then you may enjoy this frat-party-gone-wrong atmosphere. otherwise, the marina has much better wateringholes.
author: Michelle I.

description: ok....i completely see why everyone hates this place but there is some little part of me who still kinda misses college and regrets having my shit together enough to graduate in four years.  For that reason I have gone to Bar None more than once.  It's ok...feel free to judge, I know you already are but I challenge you to acknowledge the possibility that  Bar None really can be fun (or at least bearable) as long as you know what you are getting yourself into.  If you really hate frat boys and marina chicks and are unable to coexist with people who are different than yourself then stay away.  If you are a borderline alcoholic who happens to be in the marina then I recommend Bar None on a Thursday night.  Don't go for the $2 wells and $8 pitchers, don't go for the darts and pool, not even for all of the TVs that you can watch sports on, go for the flip cup.....do it for the drinking games my  friend, the drinking games.
author: Jessica H.

description: bros and bro hos. if you wanna act super drunk and not wanna look stupid, go here. if you wanna play beer pong like when you play in your garage back home, I recomend you go there on sunday. on friday nights, bathroom stopps working around 10pm but you go anyway. haha.
author: chihiro i.

description: ok so its monday and im in the no neck, zone. clearly by-passing the post-college beer pong tournament...we posted at the bar and played some funny computer games, picked all the beats to listen to, and got free after-call drinks by the incredibly insane bartender that i cant say whether he scared me or pleased me. either way, it was me, my friend, and monday night in the marina..what can you expect?
author: Daniella B.

description: this place gets a bad rep for this reason and that reason but come on... you go to this bar to grab a decent guiness, play some darts and beer pong and then move on to the next bar!
author: Swarup B.

description: Frat party mixed w/ sleezy old men who spill alcohol on you. Have fun if you go... I'll never see you there....
author: Courtney W.

description: i went here on a sunday evening when it was not so full, but i totally liked this place!  they had beer pong tables in the back, and while all the tables were full the people playing gladly let us join in.  overall good atmosphere + beer pong tables = good, in my book.
author: Emily W.

description: If you are all about reliving your frat days, this is the place for you.  I have several friends that were in a fraternity, but not even they can handle the place.  Sure, beer pong is fun sometimes but I have never seen such a collection of bing drinkes in my life at bars in SF.
author: Matt J.

description: this place is always way too crowded with "dude bros" and "plastics". the only thing this place has going for it is the beer pong in the back. it takes forever to get a drink and really isn't worth the time it takes to make your way anywhere in the bar. the overall vibe of the bar is an overinflated sense of self worth! i give bar none a huge booooooooooooooo!
author: Kristin Y.

description: I probably shouldn't be allowed to review this place since I've never stepped inside (and I'm proud of that fact).  But every time I walk by there are tons of frat boys, cheesy Bon Jovi music blaring, a nasty stale beer stench and lots of drunk hootin' and hollerin'.  Plus I've heard they have beer pong in there, which is foul - a ping pong ball touches the nasty floor and you put it in your beer and chug it?
author: AngelaS F.

description:
bar none!! hands down is one of my favorite bars on Union St. 

the fun and cool atmosphere is just a great setting for good times with friends and strangers. people that go there are really friendly and specially the beer pong crowd. where else can you play beer pong outside of frats and house parties? ummm.. BAR NONE! ? DURRR

but i must bitch about the dirty martini i got from there... it was really bad.  i didnt really mind because i forgot to mention i wanted top shelf vodka instead they gave me some cheap ass shit that almost made me spit my drink in my friend's face but i didnt. it would have been a waste of $12... oh lastly about my dirty martini... it had little sad olives... i mean i paid $12 for a bad martini and i couldn't even get decent sized olives? COME ON NOW!! 

but besides my bad martini... i can over look it because i really like this place. 

maybe the bar tenders there will read this and remember my picture so when i go there i can get a real dirty martini with real olives  =)
author: R M.

description: Place is cool for Seniors in high school and freshmen in college after that it's not cool.
author: scott g.

description: Sue Ellen the bartender rocks!!!!!!! I went here on a Sunday, highly recommend it, and had a blast. This bar is best when its not super crowded.  The facilities are awesome. I give this bar 5 stars when its deserted and 3 stars on a normal weekend night (the crowd that frequents this establishment is too "bromantic" and competitive. The girls that come here are young, pretty, and naive; so at least you have something to look at besides b-bag fresh college grads.) Go here on a tuesday night or at daytime in the weekend. You'll like it if ur under 30!
author: Patrick R.

description: This place was the definition of a college meat market.  If thats what you want, go here. Boys playing beer pong in the back made it extra special!!!  I have been here for happy hour and it was fun, but to tell you the truth, when I went at night, it was just too packed...and also, being underground doesnt help the stuffy-ness and heat. It was actually quite gross. That being said, if I had a bunch of friends in town and we wanted to get rock-bottom drunk and possibly pick up, this would be the place to go.
author: Katie G.

description: there's barely enough room to breathe in here on a saturday night, and everything *screams* frat party...from the the people, to the decor, to the abudance of cheap beer.  of course, frat parties can be fun, so i added an extra star!
author: Roshni R.

description: Okay, this bar really sucks!  I only gave it one star because I had too. There is not a "No Star / avoid this place like the clap" category on Yelp yet. Much like the 84 Delorean we all loved as children, this place will take you back to the days of nasty, sticky-floored fraternity house basements complete with games of flip cup and beer pong. The biggest problem is that most of us who live here have matured beyond that point! However, there must be some group of people whose dynamic still resembles that of PCU or Van Wilder, because this place manages to stay in business (Sorry PCU, you're a good movie and I hate to mention you along with this place but its just to make a point). Now, don't get me wrong, I once embraced the same virtue-questioned, half-drunk, fraternity meat-head lifestyle of this bar's patrons. The difference though was that I grew out of that phase and into adulthood. So girls if you're looking to get picked up by some idiot playing a game of grab ass and reeking of Pabst blue ribbon this is the place for you! Don't worry about taking a number because you'll likely be the only one still in this line. Best Nights (Choose up to 3):  (1) High School Grad Night, (2) Your 18th birthday, (3) Never.
author: Ryan M.

description: Wall to Wall douche... Bad music and beer prong attract piles of douche. Especially in the Marina.
author: G S.

description: You get exactly what you expect from this bar.  It's a frat house.  There's holes in the ceiling and sticky floors and beer pong.  Better earlier in the evening so you don't have to fight for a table.  Don't bother with $10 pitchers, pabst is $2 a can.
author: Nate B.

description: pbr in a can. need i say more? and lots of hot young fawns. but when there are a lot of fawns, there are also a lot of hunters. so beware.
author: Dean E.

description: Why would anyone who was actually of legal age want to attend one of Bar None's frat partys? If I wanted to play beer pong, I would stay at home and drink cheap beer that wasn't going to cost my left testicle. If I wanted to be able to actually talk to a beauty of the opposite sex without getting bumped into by a popped collar or a thug brawler, I would call her ass up and invite her too.
author: Glen S.

description: If you're drunk and want to play beirut, go here you'll love it. If you want to do anything else, don't go here you'll hate it.  It smells bad, bathrooms are disgusting and the 40 year old bitter bouncers will ruin your night. It sort of reminds me of all the meatheads in college conjugated in the same area drunk, loud and violent.
author: Jordan L.

description: great bartenders, great music, great people. Even though i'm gay i went to this bar with a few of my straight friends and I had an awesome time and met lots of cool people. this bar can be a little overwhelming so I suggest a few cocktails before heading here but you're bound to have an awesome time.
author: Anthony R.

description: Filthy, bad booze, arrogant bartenders, terrible service!!  I will never be going back.
author: Erin V.

description: Recently I saw the movie Death Race. The preview for the movie (which I saw in advance) gives away every possible spoiler and advertises intense car racing action, unnecessary amount of gore, whorish looking females, and acting by Jason Statham. I went into that movie knowing the exact amount and type of happiness I would derive from that movie and I was really satisfied by the results. Maybe even a bit charmed. Bar None is Death Race. If you go into this place expecting anything other than overly competitive beirut, bro grabs, and whorish looking females, your expectations are bogus, and that's your fault. I say if you're going to roll into Bro None don't hate just because you turned a normal night into a fratty night. Anticipate and just feel the homosocial love. With that said though, it's still not that great. Just don't hate because you came here and didn't get locally brewed porter and super mature clientele.
author: Nick G.

description: bartenders were assholes. bouncers were assholes. and can't you just go play beer pong at home?
author: N. M.

description: i have never felt so out of place. douchebag central. i have been dragged here 3 times and it never changes. im not jokin, the three times i was there guys were walking around with their shirts off wearing mandles. something i have never seen before is when journey dont stop believing comes on that place goes nuts. i do have to say on a good note that the last time i was there some chick poured her beer all over these three guys all wearing pink polo shirts, it made my night.
author: Sonny M.
